requirements.name: Regression from 5.7.1: Race condition with texture updates
requirements.text: When changing the texture assigned to a material's Parameter, there is a race condition between the load texture job (executing on a threadpool thread) setting the dirty flag on the corresponding GLTexture object, and the OpenGL submission thread clearing the dirty flag when processing textures.\r\n\r\nPatch coming up to fix this.

requirements.name: LLDB: incorrect code in LldbEngine::runCommand function
configure should not pick up QMAKESPEC from the environment
requirements.text:
To compile Qt 5.6 with Android NDK, I wrote a script (qtandroid.sh).

everything goes fine till the configuration step, here is how it looks :

{code}
./configure \
     -opensource -confirm-license \
     -release \
     -xplatform ${QMAKESPEC} \
     -nomake tests -nomake examples \
     -android-ndk ${ANDROID_NDK_ROOT} \
     -android-sdk ${ANDROID_SDK_ROOT} \
     -android-ndk-host ${ANDROID_NDK_HOST} \
     -android-toolchain-version ${ANDROID_NDK_TOOLCHAIN_VERSION} \
     -skip qttranslations -skip qtserialport \
     -no-warnings-are-errors \
     -prefix ${QT_ANDROID_ARM} \
&& make -j6 && make install \
&& echo "y" | rm -rf  /tmp/qt_src
{code}

here is the error I got :
{code}
Running configuration tests (phase 1)...
Done running configuration tests.
Creating qmake...
./bin/sh: 1: ANDROID_NDK_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX: not found
/bin/sh: 1: ANDROID_NDK_TOOLCHAIN_VERSION: not found
/bin/sh: 1: ANDROID_NDK_HOST: not found
/bin/sh: 1: ANDROID_NDK_TOOLS_PREFIX: not found
/bin/sh: 1: /tmp/android_ndk/toolchains/-/prebuilt//bin/-g++: not found
make: *** [project.o] Erreur 127
{code}

While investigating, I found out that the Makefile was not well generated.
{code}
CC = /tmp/android_ndk/toolchains/$$(ANDROID_NDK_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX)-$$(ANDROID_NDK_TOOLCHAIN_VERSION)/prebuilt/$$(ANDROID_NDK_HOST)/bin/$$(ANDROID_NDK_TOOLS_PREFIX)-gcc
CXX = /tmp/android_ndk/toolchains/$$(ANDROID_NDK_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX)-$$(ANDROID_NDK_TOOLCHAIN_VERSION)/prebuilt/$$(ANDROID_NDK_HOST)/bin/$$(ANDROID_NDK_TOOLS_PREFIX)-g++
QMAKE_CFLAGS = -pipe
QMAKE_CFLAGS_SPLIT_SECTIONS = -ffunction-sections
QMAKE_CXXFLAGS = -pipe -std=c++11
QMAKE_CXXFLAGS_SPLIT_SECTIONS = -ffunction-sections
QMAKE_LFLAGS = --sysroot=/tmp/android_ndk/platforms/$$(ANDROID_NDK_PLATFORM)/arch-/
QMAKE_LFLAGS_GCSECTIONS = -Wl,--gc-sections
...
{code} 

So {{make}} can't interpret {{$$( )}}

But when I modified {{mkspec/android-g++/qmake.conf}} by replacing all {{$$( )}} with ${ } , make can now interpret the Makefile without the previously mentioned error.

But yet, it's *doesn't* configure successfully as now I have error related to missing headers that are in NDK. 

{code}
In file included from /tmp/qt_src/qtbase/include/QtCore/qglobal.h:1:0,
                 from /tmp/qt_src/qtbase/qmake/library/qmake_global.h:37,
                 from /tmp/qt_src/qtbase/qmake/library/qmakeparser.h:37,
                 from /tmp/qt_src/qtbase/qmake/library/qmakeevaluator.h:41,
                 from /tmp/qt_src/qtbase/qmake/project.h:37,
                 from /tmp/qt_src/qtbase/qmake/project.cpp:34:
/tmp/qt_src/qtbase/include/QtCore/../../src/corelib/global/qglobal.h:39:21: fatal error: cstddef: No such file or directory
 #  include <cstddef>

{code}

the source of this problem is that :
{code}
QMAKE_INCDIR            = $$ANDROID_SOURCES_CXX_STL_INCDIR $$QMAKE_ANDROID_PLATFORM_INCDIR
QMAKE_LIBDIR            = $$ANDROID_SOURCES_CXX_STL_LIBDIR $$QMAKE_ANDROID_PLATFORM_LIBDIR $$LIBGCC_PATH
{code}
are not added to the Makefile. At the end of the *qmake.conf* they are stored in :
{code}
QMAKE_DEFAULT_LIBDIRS = $$QMAKE_LIBDIR
QMAKE_DEFAULT_INCDIRS = $$QMAKE_INCDIR
{code}

But in *qtbase/qmake/configure* (~ line  4006) they are not added when generating the Makefile 

These problems were generated in my local machine and also in a docker image having Ubuntu 14.04.4 as base image.

here is the log https://hub.docker.com/r/theshadowx/dockerfile_tests/builds/bqldh8zikrxjxzj577hbaoh/

2) drag one of them somewhere inside the list so that small black bar does not appear
3) drop it
4) crash

requirements.name: Window loses focus when moving mouse cursor during loading
requirements.text:
Since I updated my Mac from El Capitan to Sierra I've got an issue with focus on my Qt Application window.

When I launch my app, if I mouve the mouse cursor BEFORE the applications shows up, the applications hasn't focus (the 3 Mac top left buttons are grey, window title is grey). See attached file "focus.jpg".
I can use my app, enter some text using keyboard, then, I click on a button that opens a modal Qt file picker dialog which is totally stucked (because the app still hasn't focus).

To have focus, I must launch the app without moving the mouse cursor before the app window shows up (which is easy to do with the trackpad, but not with a physical mouse). Or, if the app shows up without focus, I can click on another app then go back to my app and then it gains focus.

requirements.name: Move the configure argument information from Coin to Qt5 repo
requirements.text:
We should get rid of folder pointings inside Coin. For example: Coin should not need to point where MySQL is located. Instead the information should be stored in the product repository. To be more exact, the provision script that installs MySQL is the one knowing where it is installed.

The information is then passed on to configure by adding the corresponding -I or -L arguments to a file which is picked up by Coin. In the same fashion as sudoers.d folder picks up and processes files, should Coin pick up new configure arguments that are given by the provision script.

The structure of the configurations could be something like:
/provision/platform_configurations/<target>/<host>/<features>/mysql.txt

To avoid having flags in multiple locations (in qt5.txt and the one mentioned above), qt5.txt should be split up into those folders as well. Each folder could have a base.txt keeping the non-provisioned feature flags mentioned direclty as they appear in the configure (-debugandrelease), not as feature flags. That way we uniform the way we enable certain features again.

requirements.name: CMake configuration items do not persist properly if they contain "//" or "#"
requirements.text:
If a CMake cache variable is set to a string containing "//" using the projects : CMake widget, it initially applies fine, and is written into the .user file CMake.Configuration correctly.

However, when the project is closed and reloaded, it is read back in with the "//" (and everything after it) truncated, and reapplied (forcibly overwriting the correct values from the CMakeCache).

When set via the Kit CMake Configuration textbox, the corruption occurs immediately.

Our project expects some download URLs for external projects to be provided as part of configuration; this bug crops them after the scheme: prefix.

This bug appears to be due to CMakeConfigItem::fromString attempting to crop off # and // as comment markers. It's not clear to me what circumstances would lead to comments in either of these places, but if they are present this should at least respect some form of quoting allowing the characters to be be present in a string-valued cache variable.

requirements.name: missing sys/ipc.h for ::ftok
requirements.text:
For ftok(3) need to include sys/ipc.h. This fixes cross from Cygwin.

See:

http://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/009695399/functions/ftok.html

Affected file is "qtbase/src/corelib/kernel/qcore_unix_p.h"

requirements.text:
When using Inspect or Visual UIA Verify (C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\bin\x64\UIAVerify\VisualUIAVerifyNative.exe) I get the window and title bar bound rects correctly, but everything inside the window is being reported in virtual pixels not corrected by the screen's devicePixelRatio

Attached is a code to reproduce. It contains two panels each with two buttons.

requirements.name: Coding style documentation regarding NULL/0 vs. nullptr is outdated
requirements.text:
The coding style docs still recommend using 0 for null-pointers.

However, nowadays nullptr is the recommended and used everywhere in Creator (except the places that have not been updated yet).

Reference: https://doc-snapshots.qt.io/qtcreator-extending/coding-style.html#null-pointers

requirements.name: Remove separate QNX offline installers from Qt 5.11
QNX6.6 target for QtLocation needed
requirements.text:
QNX6.6 target has been replaced by QNX7 target for the QtLocation module.
Sadly, the QNX6.6 target is still present for qt5.git.

Since this target has a very picky compiler, the result is patches being merged because they pass all the targets in QtLocation, and then blocking qt5.git integration because they do not pass QNX6.6.

Example: 
https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/199760/ failing because of https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/199581/ merged correctly, resulting in the latter having to be reverted in order for qt5 to pass, and to be reworked, but without even a COIN target to test against for compile errors.

So please add QNX6.6 target back to QtLocation too.
Thanks!

requirements.name: HTML offline documentation pages do not show content
QmlProfiler: Loosing notes when changing ranges
requirements.text:
Steps to reproduce:
* open/create QtQuick related project and profile it
* go to Timeline, select one the displayed items and add a note or two..
* use the "Select Range" feature to select a smaller range (without these added notes)
* right click at this range and trigger "Analyze Current Range"
* right click again on the timeline and trigger "Analyze Full Range"

Current result:
* notes are gone

Expected result:
* notes are still accessible

requirements.name: RHEL 6.6 cannot be provisioned
requirements.text:
Since recently any attempt to re-build a RHEL 6.6 machine appears to be failing:

{code}
coin:2017/01/25 11:30:00 provision.go:141: qtci-linux-RHEL-6.6-x86_64-60b761-provisioning-tmp: 2017/01/25 11:29:59 provision.go:108: Error running bash script "/tmp/provisioning-304765066/coin/provisioning/qtci-linux-RHEL-6.6-x86_64/06-odbc.sh": Error running bash /tmp/provisioning-304765066/coin/provisioning/qtci-linux-RHEL-6.6-x86_64/06-odbc.sh: exit status 1
coin:2017/01/25 11:30:00 provision.go:141: qtci-linux-RHEL-6.6-x86_64-60b761-provisioning-tmp: Stdout: Loaded plugins: downloadonly, product-id, refresh-packagekit, security,
coin:2017/01/25 11:30:00 provision.go:141: qtci-linux-RHEL-6.6-x86_64-60b761-provisioning-tmp:               : subscription-manager
coin:2017/01/25 11:30:00 provision.go:141: qtci-linux-RHEL-6.6-x86_64-60b761-provisioning-tmp: This system is registered to Red Hat Subscription Management, but is not receiving updates. You can use subscription-manager to assign subscriptions.
coin:2017/01/25 11:30:00 provision.go:141: qtci-linux-RHEL-6.6-x86_64-60b761-provisioning-tmp: Setting up Install Process
coin:2017/01/25 11:30:00 provision.go:141: qtci-linux-RHEL-6.6-x86_64-60b761-provisioning-tmp: No package unixODBC-devel available.
coin:2017/01/25 11:30:00 provision.go:141: qtci-linux-RHEL-6.6-x86_64-60b761-provisioning-tmp: 
coin:2017/01/25 11:30:00 provision.go:141: qtci-linux-RHEL-6.6-x86_64-60b761-provisioning-tmp: Stderr: Error: Nothing to do
{code}

The inability to re-create the RHEL 6 template is critical to our ability to get changes into qt5.git needed for the release. While RHEL 6.6 is not critical
for 5.9 from a packaging point of view anymore, there are changes to the
coin/provisioning/common sub-directory that are required and changes to
that directory will cause a rebuild of all VM templates, including RHEL 6.6.

requirements.name: [REG 3.6 -> 4.0] Live QML/JS console no longer working
requirements.text: In Qt Creator 3.6.1, it was possible to use the QML/JS Console to interact with QML objects while the application is running in debug mode. This is no longer possible with Qt Creator 4.0. You can set a breakpoint and pause the application to use the Debugger Console but it is not the same because functions you call from the console may require the event loop to continue running. This means you need to continue the application and then pause it again every time you call a function that requires the event loop to be running.

Update Unit Test Documentation
Creator highlights macros and variables that are unknown at usage position
requirements.text:
Creator highlights macros from an include file as correct (and Goto Definion works), even if the macro is unknown at the usage position (because the file is included at a later position).

It also highlights global variables and function names from the same file, that are declared later in that file.

Expected behaviour would be to see a syntax error (red underline). If Goto Definition still works, this would be a bonus to fix the situation (by moving the include or definition, or be creating a forward declaration).

requirements.name: Resizing window before changing active framegraph results in skewed rendered screen.
requirements.text:
To reproduce, open attached example. Screenshots are included to illustrate.

Step 1) open program
Step 2) resize window
Step 3) switch to second framegraph
Step 4) resize window again
Step 5) switch to first framegraph (bug occurs, rendered screen is skewed)
Step 6) resize window, back to expected behaviour.

Also a problem in commit 5c5e807018cff0f807ce850da50a14e693c4365b (Aug. 8).

requirements.name: Neptune 3 - Map Application could not get online by default
requirements.text: Neptune 3 - Map application cannot get online by default even though Neptune 3 is connected to Internet already.\r\n\r\nThis is happen because in our Pelux image, it uses systemd-networkd instead of NetworkManager. Therefore, the path that is currently used cannot be seen. Neptune 3 should be able to see which service is available, and use the intended path.

qt-apps/neptune3-ui project is using git-lfs to store binary assets. To clone this repository correctly, build machine needs to have git-lfs

Same requirement is for the jenkins template 't-ubuntu1604-x64-5100'

And in the Coin machine which is responsible for creating the source packages used in Coin builds.

requirements.name: Python 3.6 Support
requirements.text: I was curious if the PySide 2 project was looking into support for Python 3.6. I see it currently only supports up to 3.5 which means it should be relatively compatible. I also tried building everything and running it in a Python 3.6 environment and everything seemed to work correctly. Is this safe to include in the supported versions list?

requirements.name: Update the qtwebengine examples assets
CMake build step does not work with multiple targets
requirements.text:
CMake does not support multiple --target arguments being passed on the command line. Until [1], specifying --target multiple times silently ignored all targets but the last one.

Still, since the change at [2], line 322 and following, Qt Creator will potentially invoke CMake with arguments --target. So far my comment in Gerrit was ignored, so I'm filing this bug in the hope of getting attention.

[1] https://github.com/Kitware/CMake/pull/214
[2] https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/145242/5/src/plugins/cmakeprojectmanager/cmakebuildstep.cpp

requirements.name: [REG 4.5 -> 4.6] Which files are shown by git commit editor depends on the project's name
requirements.text:
# Start creating a new Qt Widgets Application project with the name "gitProject".
# On the last page of the wizard, select "Git" as version control system.
# Select "Tools" -> "Git" -> "Local Repository" -> "Commit" from the menu.
The project's .pro.user file is being shown as untracked file which can be committed:
!prouser.png!
When the project has a different name, the .pro.user file will not be shown.

It usually will not make much sense to commit the .pro.user file into git. What is even worse is, that it depends on the name of the project which files will be shown. 

This did not happen with Creator 4.5.

Found and tested by Squish test tst_git_local.

{noformat}

requirements.name: MSVC2010 does not work
requirements.text:
Occurs at least when only build tools are installed.

There appears to be some problem with detection, compilers for auto-detected kits seems to be wrong as can be seen in attached screenshots. When manually setting kit with 2010 compiler, it also cannot compile directly, claiming not to find cl.exe.

Qt Creator does output:
{code}
“Failed to retrieve MSVC Environment from “C:\Program Files\Microsoft
SDKs\Windows\v7.1\Bin\SetEnv.cmd”:
ERROR: The system was unable to find the specified registry key or value
{code}

Manually setting up PATH before starting qtcreator works though.

requirements.text: Windows10 x86 template on branch 5.11 runs automatic windows updates, seems to cause random fails on provisioning and RTA tests.

requirements.name: QTextEdit crashes in some weird circumstances

requirements.name: Build config "Default" is translated to a invalid string for makefile compilation.
requirements.text:
My system language is French, and Qtcreator translates the "Default" build config in "Défaut".
Unfortunately the resulting build folder includes the build config name, so make compilation ends up using absolute paths with the character "é", which returns a Make error.

This error exists since the "Default" configuration has been added (i don't remember the exact Qtcreator version), and is still present in the 4.0.0 version.

It is not critical since it is easy to avoid by renaming the build configuration or using another.

Clang: Enumerator is highlighted as type within class declaration
avoid copying of all qml files into app-bundle on MacOS and iOS
requirements.text:
Currently when deploying an app for MacOS or iOS, all qt-qml files from all qt plugins are copied into the app-bundle.
This behaviour is hardcoded into qtbase/mkspecs/features/qt.prf:
{code}
        # copy qml files. this part is platform spesific.
        mac {
            osx {
                # Note: user can override QMAKE_BUNDLE_QML from pro file to change target bundle path
                isEmpty(QMAKE_QML_BUNDLE_PATH):QMAKE_QML_BUNDLE_PATH = "Resources/qt_qml"
                qmlTargetPath = $$OUT_PWD/$${TARGET}.app/Contents/$$QMAKE_QML_BUNDLE_PATH
                qtconfTargetPath = $$OUT_PWD/$${TARGET}.app/Contents/Resources/qt.conf
            } else {
                # iOS: flat bundle layout (no Contents/Resources)
                isEmpty(QMAKE_QML_BUNDLE_PATH):QMAKE_QML_BUNDLE_PATH = "qt_qml"
                qmlTargetPath = $CODESIGNING_FOLDER_PATH/$$QMAKE_QML_BUNDLE_PATH
                qtconfTargetPath = $CODESIGNING_FOLDER_PATH/qt.conf
            }

            # set import path in qt.conf to point to the bundeled qml:
            QT_CONF_CONTENTS = \
                "[Paths]" \
                "Imports = $$QMAKE_QML_BUNDLE_PATH" \
                "Qml2Imports = $$QMAKE_QML_BUNDLE_PATH"
            write_file("$$OUT_PWD/qt.conf", QT_CONF_CONTENTS)|error("Aborting.")

            # write qt.conf and copy each qml import dir into the bundle.
            # But strip away archives and other files that are not needed:
            !isEmpty(QMAKE_POST_LINK): QMAKE_POST_LINK += ";"
            QMAKE_POST_LINK += \
                "cp $$OUT_PWD/qt.conf $$qtconfTargetPath; " \
                "test -d $$qmlTargetPath && rm -r $$qmlTargetPath; " \
                "mkdir -p $$qmlTargetPath && " \
                "for p in $$QMLPATHS; do" \
                    "rsync -r --exclude='*.a' --exclude='*.prl' --exclude='*.qmltypes' "
            macx-xcode: QMAKE_POST_LINK += "$p/ $$qmlTargetPath; done"
            else: QMAKE_POST_LINK += "\$\$p/ $$qmlTargetPath; done"
        }
{code}
It would be nice to have the possibility to avoid this behaviour, if needed.
I think the easiest would be to put the copy actions ahead of any user defined QMAKE_POST_LINK actions, so that the user can easily remove the files by adding his own QMAKE_POST_LINK commands.
(I know that I can just edit the qt.prf, but I would prefer to just edit my *.pro files once and don't have to remember to edit qt.prf for every new Qt version)
Or is there any qmake variable that defines actions that are executed after QMAKE_POST_LINK is done?

The Material and Universal designs both have specs for dialog titles. We should provide support for dialog titles, giving the appropriate looks (padding & font) out of the box.\r\n\r\nWe should get rid of the button-box weirdness, and simply fill in all Dialog styles with a title in the header and button-box in the footer. This is a high-priority task because it will be a behavioral change and needs to be done before Dialog is released in 5.8.

requirements.name: multiple definition of `__bss_start'
QtCreator fails if source Directory already contains a CMakeCache.txt
requirements.text:
Please see the attached demo project. Make sure that you are using cmake < 3.7 (I tested without server mode, just to eliminate another source of errors).

The following steps (assuming the demo project) reproduce the issue:
 * Run (manually) _cmake ._ in the extracted tests directory (make sure to use _make_ as generator)
 * Open the project in Qt-Creator and choose a new kit (not the detected temporary one) and use a kit with _ninja_ as generator.

Trying to run this will result in:
{code}
Running "/home/florian/sources/cmake-3.6.3-Linux-x86_64/bin/cmake /home/florian/sources/cmake-3.6.3-Linux-x86_64/tests '-GCodeBlocks - Ninja' -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE:STRING=Debug -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER:STRING=/usr/bin/clang++ -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER:STRING=/usr/bin/clang '-DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH:STRING=%{Qt:QT_INSTALL_PREFIX}' -DQT_QMAKE_EXECUTABLE:STRING=" in /tmp/QtCreator-FlUb1d/qtc-cmake-XXzad8pP.

CMake Error: Error: generator : Ninja

Does not match the generator used previously: Unix Makefiles

Either remove the CMakeCache.txt file and CMakeFiles directory or choose a different binary directory.

*** cmake process exited with exit code 1.{code}
This error message makes absolute sense since _cmake_ detects the existing _CMakeCache.txt_ and tries to reuse it, but the enduser might not realize that the source directory is at fault.

I'd like to suggest the error message to be improved for the case where a _CmakeCache.txt_ or _CMakeFiles_ already exists in the source directory (since it is not going to end well in any case) – or maybe flat out refuse to operate if the source directory is configured and one tries an out of source build.

To make matters worse:
 * Change the generator to _Unix Makefiles_ without extra generator and try to rerun cmake. It will work fine but will write the build files to the (existing) source configuration:

{code:java}
Running "/home/florian/sources/cmake-3.6.3-Linux-x86_64/bin/cmake /home/florian/sources/cmake-3.6.3-Linux-x86_64/tests '-GUnix Makefiles' -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE:STRING=Debug -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER:STRING=/usr/bin/clang++ -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER:STRING=/usr/bin/clang '-DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH:STRING=%{Qt:QT_INSTALL_PREFIX}' -DQT_QMAKE_EXECUTABLE:STRING=" in /tmp/QtCreator-FlUb1d/qtc-cmake-XXzad8pP.

-- The C compiler identification is Clang 3.8.1

-- The CXX compiler identification is Clang 3.8.1

-- Check for working C compiler: /usr/bin/clang

-- Check for working C compiler: /usr/bin/clang -- works

-- Detecting C compiler ABI info

-- Detecting C compiler ABI info - done

-- Detecting C compile features

-- Detecting C compile features - done

-- Check for working CXX compiler: /usr/bin/clang++

-- Check for working CXX compiler: /usr/bin/clang++ -- works

-- Detecting CXX compiler ABI info

-- Detecting CXX compiler ABI info - done

-- Detecting CXX compile features

-- Detecting CXX compile features - done

-- Configuring done

-- Generating done

-- Build files have been written to: /home/florian/sources/cmake-3.6.3-Linux-x86_64/tests

CMake Warning:

Manually-specified variables were not used by the project:




CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH

QT_QMAKE_EXECUTABLE
{code}
If you restart QtC now it will obviously not find a Cache in the configured build dir and running CMake does not help either. The clue ends up in the general messages:
{code:java}
-- Build files have been written to: /home/florian/sources/cmake-3.6.3-Linux-x86_64/tests
{code}
*Note:* None of this is an actual/real bug in QtC or CMake (maybe the latter since CMake does not allow you to specify source & build dir but only one and tries to be clever.), but the user experience could be better, especially for newcomers who are messing around and execute cmake in the wrong locations or whatnot.

requirements.name: [regression] Data is not written to file if QFile::size() is called before writing ends
requirements.text:
There is a serious regression in QFile/QTemporaryFile between Qt 5.9.5 (and all earlier versions) and Qt 5.11.1.

Here is what I do:
 # Open a QTemporaryFile and write some data to it.
 # Call size() on that file.
 # Open same file using QFile and write more data to it (using Append flag).
 # Copy the temp file to some other place.

Result:

Copied file contains only data written in 1. - all subsequent writes are *lost* when using Qt 5.11.1. On older versions (tested with 5.9.5 and 5.5.1) all data is copied correctly.

If I don't call size() (point 2), code works correctly and I see all the data on Qt 5.11.1. 

 

I am not sure if QTemporaryFile has anything to do with the issue

Attached:
 * main.cpp contains a minimal example
 * destination_good_595.txt contains data written by example when run with Qt 5.9.5

 * destination_bad_5111.txt contains data written by example when run with Qt 5.11.1

Many times when I switch kits, the three icon sin the bottom left get disabled, which is normal while it parses the project. After parsing they are supposed to be re-enabled. Many times they are not. Sometimes the build icon is enabled, and when doing so, the compile pane says "Nothing to be done...". Running qmake doesn't seem to fix it either. The only fix aside from editing is switching back and forth between kits until it end up with the buttons correct.

requirements.name: Provide portable PySide2 wheel via pip
requirements.text:
Here's a formal request to make it easier to distribute PySide2 using a wheel.

* Portable (do not require Qt installed, bundle it in the wheel)
* Pip-installable (without compiling during install), distributed via PyPi.
* Compatible with Python 2.7 and 3.5/3.6
* Bundle the pyside2-uic binary and make it work without errors: https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/PYSIDE-357
* Review and rewrite setup.py. It's not up to today's standards in terms of packaging.
* Definitively include PySide2.QtUiTools (requires Qt Creator on build) and requires fixing https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/PYSIDE-552
* Built against Qt 5.6
* Add some form of way of figuring out which version of PySide2 is used: https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/PYSIDE-557 (or better, maintain the __version__ string)
* Windows, macOS and "Manylinux" support

You may argue that PySide2 is not yet at a stable release, but users are starting to rely on it – and although I don't want to get political – I see PySide2 already loosing out on adoption because of this hurdle. I far too often see people move to PyQt5 just because you can just pip-install that and move on with work/life and achieve results.

requirements.name: Diffeditor is "Waiting for data" from deleted file
requirements.text:
# Go to "Tools" -> "Diff..." and select two files.
Creator will show the files' differences.
# Delete one of the files.
# Click "Reload Diff"
The diff editor will display ""Waiting for data..." and that's it.

Instead of waiting forever, the diff editor should inform the user which of the files is missing.

requirements.name: Qt Creator passing wrong path format for g++ binary path to CMake when using default build kit
requirements.text:
I upgraded my version of QTCreator to 4.0.0 and upon opening my non-qt cmake project it seemed to want to try to reconfigure it as a ninja project (another issue entirely). This caused me to delete my existing .user file in the source and the existing builds and try to start again.

However when using the default build kit, (using the bundled MinGW 32bit 4.9.2, Qt 5.5.1) it couldn't generate the build environment with CMake throwing out an error that seems to be due to the backslashes it's passing to CMake with the "-DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER:STRING=C:\Qt\Tools\mingw492_32\bin\g++.exe" argument. This causes CMake to complain about an invalid escape sequence \Q

The full output is available here

https://gist.github.com/trainmeditations/6434a74c83e573a98a778c879cff8174

I tried deleting my user's Qt Creator config which seemed to reset everything to default but did not fix the issue.

After creating a new build kit using a separate mingw-w64 install and no Qt enabled it worked correctly and the general tab output showed it using forward slashes in the -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER:STRING argument.

https://gist.github.com/trainmeditations/3621a8c6bef921e717c92ff896973447

requirements.name: [WinRT] Dispatcher memory corruption
requirements.text:
{{bool QEventDispatcherWinRT::event(QEvent *e)}} has a really bad memory corruption caused by copying into a dangling reference.

A reference varaible info taken from d->timerInfos:
{code}WinRTTimerInfo &info = d->timerInfos[id];{code}

The same reference later copy assigned even though it may be danging after d->timerInfos modifications.

{code}info = d->timerInfos[id];{code}

It has the right idea of getting a new "reference", but that's not how references work and this is just a balant copy assignment into potentally dangling reference.

And to top it most of the time the heap corruption causes random crashes elsewhere. There is more reckless reference usage that could use a review, but this is the biggest random heap corruptor that I have finally cought in the WinRT plugin.

Two simple fixes attached, I personally prefer the scoped with minor reordering apporach to prevent accidental usage of the first reference, but the last {{info.inEvent = false;}} after {{QCoreApplication::postEvent(this, new QTimerEvent(id));}} might still be toxic and neither solution solves that.

# Open a session

requirements.name: MSVC2017 ABI should be the same as MSVC2015
requirements.text:
Trying to create a kit combining Qt 5.8.0 MSVC2015 with the compiler MSVC2017 causes the error message "compilers produce code for different ABIs". This is not correct. Binaries built with 2017 _are_ compatible with those built with 2015. Microsoft have gone to the effort of making sure the ABI won't change this time around. The ABI that Qt Creator detects for 2017 should be the same as the one it detects for 2015.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/40854917/is-visual-c-2017-binary-compatible-with-vc-2015
https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=12969425

requirements.name: TypeError when static library depends on static library
requirements.text:
The attached test project has the following structure:

Project
 * App [CPP Application] (depends on Shared / Base)
 * Shared [CPP StaticLibrary] (depends on Base)
 * Base [CPP StaticLibrary]

 

Building the project results in the following error:

{{/usr/share/qbs/modules/cpp/GenericGCC.qbs:382: error: TypeError: Result of expression 'inputs["obj"]' [undefined] is not an object.}}

 

When removing the line:

{{Depends \{ name: "Base" }}}

from the Shared.qbs file outside the Export section, the project builds. Syntax highlighting within Shared, however, is then broken.

requirements.name: Make the runtime itself use private headers only
CMake: setting project variables before the first parse are getting lost
requirements.text: Try opening a cmake project that fails to configure without some extra variables being set (e.g. scribus which needs WANT_CPP11=1 to build with Qt 5.7 or later).\r\n\r\nYou can add "WANT_CPP11" via the Project mode, but after pressing "Apply Changes" the setting is gone from the UI. The project configures fully, so it probably is set in CMakeCache.txt.

requirements.name: Improve JSON analytics data structure
Locale reports incorrect system language on WinRT
requirements.text:
It seems QLocale::uiLanguages(); returns the incorrect UI language when there is a mismatch between the regional setting and the system language on WinRT.

I can easily reproduce this by setting my phone language to Finnish or Norwegian, while the Region setting is english and different from the language itself. 

Here is a typical printout:
{quote}
Locale Name: "en_US"
UI Languages: ("en-JM", "en-US")
GlobalizationPreferences: "nb"
{quote}

Note that the correct system language is obtained from checking this function directly:
Windows::System::UserProfile::GlobalizationPreferences::Languages

requirements.name: Provide a way to have an icon match ToolButton's text colour
requirements.text:
In the following file, there is one ToolButton that uses FontAwesome for its icon (using the text property):

https://github.com/mitchcurtis/slate/blob/999b02434c7e3d11e00a39fcf7cdddbe8436453f/app/qml/ui/IconToolBar.qml#L186

The ToolButton that uses the text property changes its icon colour when checked, but the one using icon.source doesn't.

It's not possible to use Material.hintTextColor (for the disabled state), otherwise I could set the icon colour myself.

requirements.name: Filter CMake variables
requirements.text:
To be useful, Qt Creator's support for editing cache variables should at least have the basic features found in cmake-gui:

- Filter variables by search string
- -Option to enter PATH and FILEPATH variables via file dialog- (see QTCREATORBUG-17705)

requirements.name: Timeout based on latest activity
requirements.text: Would it be possible to change the 5h timeout based on the total build time to something a lot shorter, and count it from the latest seen activity instead? For example, qtquickcontrols2 is a small module and takes typically 5-15 minutes to build, and about the same to test. A timeout of 5h means that builds hang doing nothing for over 4 hours. Presumably the 5h timeout is based on the long build times of qtwebengine and qtwebkit. If the timeout was counted from the latest activity, the timeout could be most likely reduced to something that is surely enough to run the longest lasting linker command for those.

requirements.name: Qt3D doesn't follow the coding conventions when including headers
QML debugger does not update "type" when it's assigned to from createBlock() in samegame.js
requirements.text: Possibly it doesn't track any assignment to function parameters. If so, then it's likely a bug in Qt, though.\r\n

requirements.name: Wrong "Too many arguments" warning when using QSharedPointer<T>
requirements.text: When using QSharedPointer<T>::create with more than one parameter, Qt Creator gives a warning. The code compiles well. See attachment picture.

requirements.name: Ctrl+letter  key events not reported properly on Wayland
requirements.text: Ctrl+letter key events are sent with the wrong text(). E.g. Ctrl+A will have text() returning 'A' (0x41) instead of Ctrl+A (0x01). Some Qt applications (such as Konsole) depend on the text() for these events.\r\n\r\nThis affects Wayland clients on Weston as well as in Qt Compositor, so it looks like this bug needs to be fixed in the platform plugin.

requirements.name: now fixed, Website breaks when the browser window has a width > 1280
Test results webserver does not show new published tasks with F5 refresh
requirements.text: Refreshing webpage on both [https://testresults.qt.io/coin/] and [http://ci-files01-hki.intra.qt.io:8080/coin/] do not show newly published test results despite the task/state files have been uploaded by the publisher and are located in the appropriate place on the server.

requirements.name: Go through code for lingering MFC dependencies
requirements.text: Go through the code to map out any lingering MFC dependecies and to check all dialogs are now ported over to Qt etc. Any findings should be reported as bugs/tasks under QT3DS-20 Code Cleanup.

requirements.name: MapPolyline swap 2 first coordinates
[eglfs] Race condition between window system events and input events
requirements.text:
Input events could potentially be sent to the wrong window when a modal dialog is triggered on eglfs, but not on XCB or Windows.

The problem can be *QWindowSystemInterface::flushWindowSystemEvents()* calls in the *QPlatformWindow::setVisible()* implementation of eglfs. If the *flushWindowSystemEvents()* is changed to *flushWindowSystemEvents(QEventLoop::ExcludeUserInputEvents)*, then the behaviour is correct.

It can be, that without the QEventLoop::ExcludeUserInputEvents flag, it's effectively a race between showing the window and reacting to input events. This is especially obvious when we rapidly click/tap some UI component to cause a modal dialog to be created, some of those input events could be processed even before the modal dialog is shown. This could cause the modal dialog to show behind the window/widget that was clicked/tapped on with eglfs for example.

The attached demo shows a push button that creates a modal dialog when pushed, the dialog would show the number of nested exec()s being executed due to failure to block events going to the push button in time. If you click/tap the push button in rapid fashion, the "depth" value can get pretty big quickly.

It seems to be a bug to omit *QEventLoop::ExcludeUserInputEvents* from *flushWindowSystemEvents()*.

requirements.name: CMake server mode projects view : absolute dir folders
requirements.text:
Some context:
I use Qt Creator both on Linux and Windows via dual boot.
My projects are stored on a single partition available in both OS.

To make Qt Creator's configuration file (CMakeLists.txt.user) separated, I use a "cmake source directory" below the project dir like this (see also test_subdir.zip in attachment):
- project_root/
  - CMakeLists.txt     << this is the main CMakeLists.txt
  - src/
      - main.c
  - project_windows/
    - CMakeLists.txt    << this file only include ../CMakeLists.txt
    - CMakeLists.txt.user   << Qt Creator's configuration when on Windows
  - project_linux/
    - CMakeLists.txt    << this file only include ../CMakeLists.txt
    - CMakeLists.txt.user   << Qt Creator's configuration when on Linux

This layout was working great before the use of cmake server mode (no configuration conflicts and no issue in the project hierarchy view in Qt Creator, see also qtcreator_4.2.png in attachment).


But since Qt Creator v4.3, the sources files are in deep folders based on the absolute path in the projects view (see attachment qtcreator_4.3.png)

Likewise, the folder says "Other Locations" instead of "Sources Locations". I think this is caused by a check whether the file is inside the root CMakeLists.txt folder (which is project_windows/) [here|https://github.com/qtproject/qt-creator/blob/04a525877ba7583621771e61f605cec9a76c9399/src/plugins/cmakeprojectmanager/servermodereader.cpp#L265].

I think about 2 solutions:
- Make Qt Creator able to have multiple configuration files for one project without overriding others so having the same project folder for multiple OS in a dual boot is possible
- Change the cmake project parsing behavior with this project layout to handle it properly (ie: without using absolute paths when listing sources inside a target)

I may be able to contribute for either solutions given one is chosen.

Thanks

requirements.name: Create contentItem lazily where possible
Confusing creation of "styles/customized%i.xml" files
requirements.text:
In case the qtcreator.ini has a _TextEditor_ section without a defined _ColorScheme_ value...
{noformat}
[TextEditor]
FontZoom=90
{noformat}
...Qt Creator decides to create a new "styles/customized%i.xml" and select that as scheme.

I find this confusing, since I don't know what purpose this feature has in the current state of Qt Creator. I assume that this was implemented way back then, as migration code when selectable Color Schemes were introduced.

Code: http://code.qt.io/cgit/qt-creator/qt-creator.git/tree/src/plugins/texteditor/fontsettingspage.cpp?h=3.6#n210

This makes implementation of QTCREATORBUG-15229 uglier. If we don't remember what this was for, I suggest removing that "Save it as a color scheme file" part.

requirements.name: Test 1.1 snapshot installers
requirements.text: Test the snapshot installers for Qt 3D Studio 1.1 immediately when they are available and give feedback on things that are wrong. This is needed to maximize the time for fixing various issues we find in the installer.

requirements.name: QML profiler misbehaves when server switches recording on while we're processing data
requirements.text:
QmlProfilerTool will try to clearEvents() in this case, and that will rightfully (soft) assert on not being in a permissible state to clear the events. Furthermore, eventally the trigger for finalize() will hit (the details rewriter ...), and finalize() will again be called from the wrong state, causing unknown havoc.

It's unclear what to do about this. In principle we'd have to track down and cancel all the processing that's currently going on, but that would be error prone.

The more future proof option is doing away with the separate "processing" step and resolving the details on the fly. That's also not trivial, though.

requirements.name: Execute Operation Fails When Paths Have Space Characters
requirements.text:
I attempted to have my installer's component script add a firewall exception using the netsh utility on Windows. If any of the arguments I pass to the Execute operation contain spaces (even if they are correctly enclosed in double quotations) the operation fails.

Component script that fails:
{code:javascript}
component.addOperation( "Execute",
"netsh", "advfirewall", "firewall", "add", "rule",
"name=\"Has Space\"", //!< Fails due to space, even tho its in quotes
"dir=in", "action=allow",
"program=\"C:\\bad folder\\wtf.exe\"", //!< Fails due to space, even tho its in quotes
"enable=yes" );
{code}

Error message from installer:
!ExecErr.PNG!

I have verified this operation will succeed if there are no spaces in the arguments.

requirements.name: QWindowContainer not supported on Android
requirements.text:
It is very desirable to get QWindowContainer working in order to allow embedding OpenGL or Vulkan(!) QWindows into widget UIs.

https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/92070/ has the right idea but that won't directly solve the QWindowContainer case. Instead, the hole punching has to happen in the QWindowContainer widget itself.

requirements.name: WebEngineView: Using offTheRecord profile with Pepper Flash plugin leads to assert in debug mode
requirements.text:
When using the Pepper Flash Plugin and loading a page with flash content into WebEngineView, which has offTheRecord profile set, there is the following assert in debug mode:
[0114/222123:FATAL:pepper_flash_file_message_filter.cc(56)] Check failed:
false.
The problem raises from Chromium, which hits NOTREACHED() when it gets empty user profile data directory path - even in offTheRecord/incognito mode.
This could be fixed by returning a non-empty path also in incognito mode, but is that really a right way to do it.

requirements.name: configure llvm on windows: no C compiler
requirements.text:
when I'm using LLVM/clang on Windows with cmake build system
cmake requires CMAKE_C_COMPILER, otherwise there is a error at configuring stage.
however qt creator recongnize llvm as c++ compiler only, no llvm in C compilers.
It requires to look for workarounds, like adding manually or set MSVC as C compiler

requirements.name: Building static libs with mingw32-make and Git Bash generates NUL files
QtCreator fails to recognize Qt 5.8 built from source on Windows
requirements.text:
I have built Qt 5.8 from source on Windows successfully using the following configure line:

configure -prefix c:\qt\5.8\msvc2015_5_8_static_32 -commercial -debug-and-release -static -static-runtime -nomake examples -nomake tools -nomake tests -opengl dynamic -skip multimedia -skip qt3d -skip qtsensors -skip webengine

After a successful build QtCreator fails to recognize it. See screenshot.

However, I can use it normally through the command line.

I have posted this issue to the interest list and Thiago Macieira commented the following: "My guess is that this change to the way we store mkspecs in Qt 5.8 broke the detection on Qt Creator."

requirements.name: Change supported targets documentation to be SoC based
requirements.text: Change the communication [http://doc.qt.io/QtForDeviceCreation/qtee-supported-platforms.html] for Supported Platforms from listing boards to listing SoC (Silicon on Chip) and to reference boards as examples.\r\n\r\nThis is part of the business driving Epic QTPM-887 “Supported HW+OS combnations with commercial Qt offering” which outlines our business situation and gaps on our ability to support enough of the target hardwares. The current documentation and split of hardwares to Groups 1, 2 and 3 is very precise but while at it, also sometimes too precise as Qt will work also on other hardware.

requirements.name: Support debugger out of task manager
requirements.text:
Trying to debug a process by selecting 'Debug' in the Windows Process Manager just brings up a dialog {code:java} --------------------------- Qt Creator Debugger --------------------------- Unexpected option: p
Usage: qtcdebugger[-wow] [-help|-?|qtcreator|default|register|unregister] <process-id> <event-id>
Options: -help, -?   Display this help
         -qtcreator  Launch Qt Creator without prompting
         -default    Launch Default handler without prompting
         -register   Register as post mortem debugger (requires administrative privileges)
         -unregister Unregister as post mortem debugger (requires administrative privileges)
         -wow        Indicates Wow32 call
         -nogui      Do not show error messages in popup windows

To install, modify the registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\AeDebug:

  • Create a copy of the string value Debugger as Debugger.Default
  • Change the value of Debugger to 
    "C:\Qt-test\Tools\QtCreator\bin\qtcdebugger.exe" %ld %ld

On 64-bit systems, do the same for the key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\AeDebug, setting the new value to 

"C:\Qt-test\Tools\QtCreator\bin\qtcdebugger.exe" -wow %ld %ld

How to run a command with administrative privileges:

runas /env /noprofile /user:Administrator "command arguments"
--------------------------- OK    --------------------------- {code}   It seems that , despite the registry entries under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\AeDebug , the debugger is always called with -p argument. Maybe qtcdebugger should just accept the argument?

QML Profiler crashes when there is a custom QML control
requirements.text:
For example, there is a custom QML control (I named it {{CustomButton}}). It is simply a customized {{Button}} control. *QML Profiler* (*profiling.exe*) crashes when I use {{CustomButton}}, but if I use just {{Button}} instead, it does not crash.

{quote}
  Problem Event Name:	APPCRASH
  Application Name:	profiling.exe
  Application Version:	0.0.0.0
  Application Timestamp:	587e1766
  Fault Module Name:	Qt5Qmld.dll
  Fault Module Version:	5.7.1.0
  Fault Module Timestamp:	58402cdc
  Exception Code:	c0000005
  Exception Offset:	002b9632
  OS Version:	6.1.7601.2.1.0.256.4
  Locale ID:	1049
  Additional Information 1:	0a9e
  Additional Information 2:	0a9e372d3b4ad19135b953a78882e789
  Additional Information 3:	0a9e
  Additional Information 4:	0a9e372d3b4ad19135b953a78882e789
{quote}

This issue has appeared in Qt 5.7.1. In Qt 5.7.0 it was not there. I just tested it with a separate Windows 7 virtual machine and Qt 5.7.0 installed there - it was fine (no crashing, QML Profiler works fine), but then I updated it to Qt 5.7.1 and QML Profiler started to crash.

I have attached a project for reproducing the issue.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open and run QML Profiler with the attached project (start QML Profiler from Qt Creator);
2. Click the {{some btn}} button in the top right corner of the app's window;
3. Everything works fine, no crashes. Close the app;
4. Comment 22nd line and uncomment 23rd line in {{main.qml}};
5. Run QML Profiler again;
6. Click the {{some btn}} button in the top right corner of the app's window;
7. QML Profiler crashes.

requirements.name: SwipeView: dynamic creation / deletion of subpages crashes application
requirements.text: I'm trying to dynamically create / delete subpages of a SwipeView using a Repeater. If I assign a arbitrary but fixed int value to the repeater model, everything works fine. As soon as I try to change this value during runtime the application crashes. In the attached code you can either click twice on the decrease or the increase button or click on one of the buttons and do a swipe. Using the same repeater in the same way in a Row (see attached code line 32ff) works as expected.

requirements.name: High resolution (@2x) Image shown on low resolution screen when hires display is present
requirements.text:
In a setup where we have low resolution and high resolution displays, the application picks up high resolution image when started in low resolution display. If you move the application window to the other display and back, then the low resolution image is correctly shown. Thus the error is reproducible only when starting the application.

The attached example shows the issue. Start it in a low resolution display and an image with "High DPI" text is shown. Move the window to another display and back, and an image with "Low DPI" will be shown.

Tested on Windows only.

requirements.name: Make sure qtwebglplugin is exported properly
requirements.text: [qtwebglplugin|https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/admin/projects/qt/qtwebglplugin] will be TP (and separate installable component) in 5.10

requirements.name: Qt Creator tries to compile .qdoc files into .o files
requirements.text:
1. Create a file on your system with the .qdoc extension.
2. In a Qt project, "Add Existing File" to the project.
3. The .qdoc file will be added to the "SOURCES" variable in .pro file (this is necessary for the file to show up in the project explorer).
4. When you build the project, it throws an error: ":-1: error: no such file or directory: '<qdoc_file_name>.o'"

Essentially, Qt Creator attempts to compile .qdoc files that are in the SOURCES qmake variable into object files, and this throws off the linker. Qt creator should allow you to add .qdoc files to the SOURCES variable but not try to compile them into object files.

requirements.name: [REG 5.6->5.7] Performance drop for QIODevice::peek
requirements.text:
h3. Problem
Qt 5.7 changed how QIODevice::peek works internally. For a use case presented here, this leads to a big performance drop.

h3. Related to
"QIODevice: handle incomplete reads
" (7d257aab8175f3d4fd3b838d4f47457a8d868885) https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/114792/
https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-44418

h3. Use Case
In my particular use case, I am parsing a file with variable length encoded data (always peeking maximum theoretical size of a field and after parsing incrementing read pointer by a lesser amount). This could also be done in other ways avoiding the problem described here (using map() or ungetChar()). Still, this reveals a performance problem which not existed before.

h3. How to reproduce
{quote}
    char readBuf\[20\];
while(!testFile.atEnd()) {
  testFile.peek(readBuf, 20);
  testFile.read(readBuf, 15);
}
{quote}

Compile the attached MWE "qiodevice-peek-performance.zip" on Qt 5.6 and 5.7 and run it with a file as argument with size at least 1gb.

For a 1.6GB file on SSD drive, run on the same system, output is following:
{quote}
Time: 0m 5s 914ms (Qt 5.6.0)
Time: 4m 19s 682ms (Qt 5.7.0)
{quote}

I'm happy to provide any more data you might need.

h3. Qt 5.6 vs. Qt 5.7 technical details
For the presented case, here is what 5.6 and 5.7 does:

h4. Qt 5.6
* peek() issues qfiledevice read
* peek() immediately writes the read data back into the linear buffer with ungetBlock()
* a followup call to read() will read the peek'ed data from the linear buffer, the qfiledevice is only read for new data
* from perspective of qfiledevice, it is read sequentially (because peek'ed data is buffered for the second access)

h4. Qt 5.7
* peek() makes sure a transaction is started
* peek() issues qfiledevice read
* peek() will always clear the qringbuffer before returning (either through seekBuffer() within a previous transaction or through roolBackTransaction() calling seekBuffer(), seekBuffer clears the qringbuffer when going 'back' on random access devices)
* a follow up call to read() will invoke a seek of qfiledevice and a second read of same data on the qfiledevice, because the qringbuffer was cleared by peek()
* effectively from perspective of qfiledevice, it is not a sequential read, but jumping around and reading data twice

h3. Thoughts on improvement
These are loosely thoughts from different angles to improve current situation.

h4. Put peek'ed data back into buffer
Does peek() really need a transaction? Within an active transaction or not, the iodevice is expected to keep the internal read and transaction positions. This should be possible with just reading the device and putting everything back into the qringbuffer (as qt 5.6 does it with linear buffer). Similar like ungetChar, but for a whole block.

h4. Avoid deallocation of memory
Clearing a classical ring buffer should be as fast as writing two pointers. I'm not sure, but I think seekBuffer() calling qringbuffer::clear deallocates memory which is slow when done often (currently for every peek!).

h4. Support rewinding of qringbuffer
When seeking back, currently everyting is cleard. For a ring buffer, it could potentially be possible to rewind the read pointer. Instead of clearing, the buffer could provide the contents without a device-read as long it was not overwritten by the write pointer in the mean time.

h4. Implement custom read-like function for peek
peek() could be implemented to always read directly into the qringbuffer. First it would try the qringbuffer::peek if enough data is already available and if an underlying device read is necessary, it would read into qringbuffer and copy data to the user's buffer. This could be faster than using ::read() (incrementing the data position with freeing memory of qringbuffer) and than writing it back to the internal buffer again.

h4. Documentation change
If proposed improvements are not suiteable (e.g. because of other use cases I did not think of or any misguided thoughts on my part), a note could be included in documentation of QIODevice::peek saying that from 5.7 performance is compareable of doing a device read+backseek for random access devices.

requirements.name: [REG 4.4->4.5] Progress bar is red when qmake project finishes parsing
requirements.text:
Every time I open the Qt Creator project or change configuration, when it finishes to parse the project it shows a red progress bar.

This is caused by 09b127f9f10ede579702a6ea66fd2b37ad4ad9f2.

In {{QmakeProFile::applyEvaluate}}, some of the results have EvalPartial state, so m_validParse remains false. This value is passed on to {{m_project->decrementPendingEvaluateFutures(validParse());}} in {{QmakeProFile::applyAsyncEvaluate}}, and that reports the task as canceled.

requirements.name: Prebuilt mingw package does not contain d3dcompiler_47.dll
requirements.text:
Prebuilt MinGW Qt binaries do not contain d3dcompiler_47.dll. This dll is required by Angle. Lack of this file can cause problems with windeployqt.exe, since it will try to find the dll from system directories, and that dll may not be compatible with other windows versions (Windows 7 <-> 8 <-> 10).

Visual Studio prebuilt binaries contain this file.

Older Qt versions also do not include this file for mingw packages.

requirements.text:
https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/173816/ introduced a crash on macOS when using dock widgets.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Run qtbase/examples/widgets/mainwindows/mainwindow
2. Go to Main Window menu and also check "Nested" and "Groupped dragging" options.

Drawing QPolygon on openGL window doesn't connect first&last points
requirements.text:
If you have a QWindow set up to draw using OpenGL, and you use a QPainter to draw shapes on the current context, then there is a problem drawing polygons with a QPen style other than Qt::SolidLine.

Basically try to draw a rectangle by setting four points. The rectangle won't be solid unless you use SolidLine. 

See the attached example. Expected result would like is described in this http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qpainter.html#drawPolygon, but when DotLine used it won't be closed.

requirements.name: On Mac OS X, overlaid multitouch capable elements conflicts between them when using the trackpad
requirements.text:
When a component that makes use of multi point touch handling such as the ListView (or Flickable) is interacted with the two finger scroll gesture and it is place above another interactive element such as the Multi Point Touch Area, the two interact with each other even being on different layers and separated by another non interactive item such as a Rectangle item.

It seems that the touch points are not grabbed by the ListView and therefore accepted by Multi Point Touch Area, causing a complete mess. ListView gets pressed when it shouldn't and the MultiPointTouchArea gets interacted when it shouldn't.

It seems that this is not a new bug. I thought this was introduced in Qt 5.10 but I can reproduce it on older versions of my software using Qt 5.8 and I also can reproduce it using the most recent Qt 5.9.4 and Qt 5.10.

Also, this seems to only happen on Mac OS X with the Magic Trackpad and the builtin trackpad of Macbook computers. I don't have problems with both iOS and Android kits. I didn't test on Windows with a multi touch screen yet.

I have attached a minimal example that reproduces the problem. A ListView is laid over a rectangle that is laid over a multi point touch area that does nothing, is just sit there in the back. The multipoint touch area enabled property is bound to the button checked property.

When you interact with the ListView using a Magic Trackpad or a trackpad with the two finger gesture, you will notice the scroll bar is jumping while scrolling. You will also notice console output being printed. You will also notice that the items of the list gets pressed when they shouldn't. However, if you click on the button at the bottom which will disable the Multipoint Touch Area, it will stop having that behaviour.

Wayland support for EGLStream
requirements.text:
Current situation is as follows:

* For an introduction see the blog post http://blog.qt.io/blog/2015/11/17/embedded-linux-news-in-qt-5-6/

* This means that in Qt Wayland 5.6 we have full support for the Jetson with the old C++ APIs. On the other hand, there is no support at all for the Qt Quick (QML) APIs. There are no plans the make the latter work since this branch (the old compositor API) is soon irrelevant.

* With Qt Wayland dev (earlier known as wip-compositor-api) branch (that will become 5.7) we have a half-broken merge from 5.6 that includes the basic enablers. Neither the C++ nor the QML APIs are functional on the Jetson at this stage.

* See this open patch https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/139180/ and the comments regarding the current issues. This tries to bring the new C++ compositor API into a usable state on the Jetson.

* Once the C++ APIs are usable, QML is a completely separate story. This is because EGLStreams involve using texture targets other than GL_TEXTURE_2D to which the infrastructure is not prepared at all. There is an (abandoned) patch against 5.4 that can be used as an inspiration for the QML bits. However, the way QWaylandSurfaceItem is changed there is not ideal (it really should not be an FBO) and will anyway not apply to the new branch at all.

So in short, the following needs to be done:

1. Make https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/139180/ work and get it in.

2. Come up with a solution that allows using GL_TEXTURE_EXTERNAL_OES textures in Qt Quick compositors.

requirements.name: [macOS]: Simulating touch events does not work correctly on a webengineview
requirements.text:
[macOS]: Simulating touch events does not work correctly on a webengineview. 

Firstly the main issue is that it will assume that all touch events are coming from the system as gestures, there is no check whether it is a spontaneous event so it never handles them anyway. Once this is rectified, then it works for TouchBegin and TouchEnd, but TouchUpdate does not work unless there is more than one touch point. This could be down to the fact that it assumes that everything is going to be a gesture rather than touch events.

Attached is a modified simplebrowser, you can go to http://kiev.tm/touch.html as a test and use the File | Emulate Touch action to see the behavior. Attached is also the patch that circumvents the initial problem on macOS (it's a one liner, so safe to view).

This works fine on Windows without any modification.

requirements.name: Useless / non-existent entries in cmake project tree
requirements.text:
In the project view for cmake server mode, if you have multiple subprojects, there are entries in the tree for every project() declaration in cmake that don't seem to do anything. They have the same icon as the top level project entry, but appear under each subdirectory entry in the tree.

Also, there are extra targets like the ProjectName_autogen target and any custom command targets you've added that have only non existent 'files' as sources, which could probably be hidden from the tree. (The actual qrc_ and moc_ .cpp files show up under ProjectName/<Build Directory>/ProjectName_autogen, not the _autogen target)

!qtc2.png!

requirements.name: Clang: No underlines for diagnostics
requirements.text:
Build current Qt Creator from the 4.1 branch against current Qt dev branch.

# Start Qt Creator with the clang code model enabled:
{{./qtcreator -load ClangCodeModel}}
# Create/open some project and insert a syntax error

After (re)parsing a text mark circle/triangle appears on the left editor margin, but no underlines are visible.

Qt Creator build against Qt 5.7.0 is fine. This looks like a Qt bug.

requirements.name: When moving window while a select dropdown is open in WebEngineView, the dropdown menu does not follow the window
requirements.text:
When opening a select dropdown and then moving the window, the dropdown portion stays in it's original position and it does not follow the window.

Steps to reproduce:
- Run attached sample
- Open the select component
- Move the window
- EXPECTED: The select component's dropdown popup follows the window
- ACTUAL: Dropdown popup stays in it's original position, even outside the main window

Sample URL: https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tryit.asp?filename=tryhtml_select

requirements.name: QStandardItemModel::dataChanged does not implement Qt5 arguments
requirements.text: QStandardItemModel::dataChanged never implemented the 3rd argument introduced in Qt5.\r\nThe change should not be titanic, it just requires a couple of adjustments in QStandardItemPrivate

requirements.name: Unable to do HTTP POST with WebEngine
requirements.text:
While porting a call of QWebView::load() to QWebEngineView I did not find a way to select whether GET or POST shall be used. My intention is to create a POST request.

Either this is a documentation bug or a QWebEngine bug.

requirements.name: Update documentation for Boot2Qt 5.6.3
requirements.text:
Boot2Qt documentation  needs to be updated for the 5.6.3 release.
 * version numbering
 * change log
 * colibri-vf is not supported (-QTBUG-52924-)

requirements.name: Qt5.7 offline: SCXML, Gamepad and Datavisualization examples not visible in QtCreator Examples page
requirements.text:
Installers (enterprise and opensource) from 30.5./1.6.

Run installer with default options, start QtCreator, search for QtGamepad, QtSCXML or QtDatavisualization examples -> no examples visible on page.

QtGamepad: example-manifest.xml has no projectPath="" specified
QtSCXML: example-manifest.xml has wrong path in projectPath
QtDatavisualization: example-manifest.xml has wrong path in projectPath

If Gamepad examples are not visible because the TP mode of the module, it can be excluded from this bug.

requirements.name: QKeyboardInput changes
requirements.text:
* rename to QKeyboardHandler
* rename property controller to sourceDevice
* remove protected ctor
* mark virtuals as private
* move keyEvent() to the dpointer class

requirements.name: Create a new model base class which can be used for the model autogeneration
requirements.text: Create a base class which supports the usual fetch modes of QtIvi models (see the SearchAndBrowseModel).\r\n\r\nThe BackendInterface should be reusable by the SearchAndBrowseModel and future models, which extend the basic fetching usecase. The BackendInterface should support talking to multiple instances of actual model class (frontend)

requirements.name: [macOS] High DPI drag cursor is scaled up 2x on retina display
requirements.text: When using a custom high dpi pixmap for cursor and setting it with QDrag::setDragCursor(), the shown cursor is twice as large as it should be. Setting the same pixmap with QWidget::setCursor() shows the cursor in correct size.\r\n\r\nSee the attached example for reference. The cursor of the application is set with QWidget::setCursor() and it has correct size. Now drag any of the texts from left to right and see the extra large cursor on top of right hand side drop area.

requirements.name: Installed qtbase not compiled with xkbcommon-evdev support
requirements.text: I installed Qt 5.9.0 Beta 1 through the unified installer. In order to get a working Wayland setup I tried to compile QtWayland manually, but this results in a useless QtWayland as xkbcommon-evdev support is missing in qtbase.

requirements.name: Inheritance property failed, Qbs1.6.x works fine
Remove LUA references from documentation
requirements.text: Now that Lua has been removed from the project, all remaining references to Lua scripts need to be removed from the documentation as well.

requirements.name: Fix code review findings
requirements.text: Review KDAB TODO comments in the code and organise a meeting on those what to do.

requirements.name: Get OpenWF reference device up and running
requirements.text: Before any work can be done to implement support for hardware layers in Qt Wayland Compositor on OpenWF, we need a reference device up and running.

requirements.name: /Zm200 flag is hardcoded in core.qbs
requirements.text: https://github.com/qbs/qbs/blob/master/src/lib/qtprofilesetup/templates/core.qbs\r\n\r\nNo possible to override /Zm200

requirements.name: Flaky qmltests::WebEngineViewUserScripts::test_twoScripts
requirements.text:
While trying to integrate https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/182977/
I got some flaky failure.

{code}
 ********* Start testing of qmltests *********
 Config: Using QtTest library 5.6.3, Qt 5.6.3 (x86_64-little_endian-lp64 shared (dynamic) debug build; by GCC 4.8.1 20130909 [gcc-4_8-branch revision 202388])
 QWARN  : qmltests::UnknownTestFunc() 
 WARNING: This project is using the testsupport QML API extensions for QtWebEngine and is therefore tied to a specific QtWebEngine release.
 WARNING: The testsupport API will change from version to version, or even be removed. You have been warned!
 
 PASS   : qmltests::WebEngineViewUserScripts::initTestCase()
 FAIL!  : qmltests::WebEngineViewUserScripts::test_twoScripts() Compared values are not the same
    Actual   (): New title
    Expected (): New title with appendix
    Loc: [/home/qt/work/qt/qtwebengine/tests/auto/quick/qmltests/data/tst_userScripts.qml(130)]
 PASS   : qmltests::WebEngineViewUserScripts::cleanupTestCase()
 Totals: 2 passed, 1 failed, 0 skipped, 0 blacklisted
 ********* Finished testing of qmltests *********
 make: *** [check] Error 1
{code}

The test code seems to be improved for Qt 5.8, so a cherry-pick should be done to 5.6 branch.

requirements.name: QProcess::startDetached does not support native arguments
Create the code example to show Clazy and Tidy warnings and fixits
requirements.text: Make a good code example (100-200) lines which shows pretty warnings that come from clazy and tidy.

requirements.name: Regression: Burmese rendering issues under Qt 5.6
requirements.text: Under Qt 5.6, Burmese rendering of text based on the ZawgyiOne font is broken. It used to render properly under Qt 5.5.\r\n\r\nThe Qt libraries offered by Ubuntu are compiled using the -system-harfbuzz flag. I've tested the system harfbuzz library (1.2.7.1) using hb-view, and confirmed that the rendering of Burmese text using ZawgyiOne font is working properly there. This effectively rules out a harfbuzz library regression.

requirements.name: const variables are wrongly scoped
-developer-build broken with disabled features due to the -Werror and unused variables/parameters
requirements.text:
As Qt Light allow to disable some components, I tried the following config:
{panel}
~/Development/qt5/qtbase/configure -prefix ~/Development/qt5.9_git -developer-build -opensource -confirm-license -no-pch -skip qtwebkit -skip qtwebkit-examples -skip qt3d -skip qtxmlpatterns -skip qtwayland -skip qtwebengine -skip qtwebview -skip qtmultimedia -skip qtlocation -skip qtcanvas3d -skip qtwebsockets -skip qtwebchannel -skip qtenginio -skip qtsensors -skip qtserialport -skip qtpurchasing -skip qtquick1 -skip qtscript -skip qtconnectivity -skip qtcharts -skip qtdatavis3d -skip qtgamepad -skip qtvirtualkeyboard -skip qtscxml -skip qtremoteobjects -skip qtspeech -skip qtnetworkauth -no-feature-bearermanagement -no-feature-colordialog -no-feature-columnview -no-feature-commandlinkbutton -no-feature-cssparser -no-feature-cups -no-feature-datawidgetmapper -no-feature-dial -no-feature-dockwidget -no-feature-fontdialog -no-feature-ftp -no-feature-imageformat_bmp -no-feature-itemviews -no-feature-lcdnumber -no-feature-listview -no-feature-listwidget -no-feature-mdiarea -no-feature-mimetype -no-feature-movie -no-feature-pdf -no-feature-printdialog -no-feature-printer -no-feature-printpreviewdialog -no-feature-printpreviewwidget -no-feature-qml-network -no-feature-quick-designer -no-feature-quick-flipable -no-feature-quickcontrols2-universal -no-feature-tableview -no-feature-tablewidget -no-feature-textodfwriter -no-feature-treeview -no-feature-treewidget -no-feature-undocommand -no-feature-undogroup -no-feature-undostack -no-feature-undoview -no-feature-wizard -no-feature-xmlstreamwriter -nomake examples -nomake tests
{panel}

It results in a multiple failures, because warnings treated as errors and there are some unused variables and parameters.

Either -developer-build shouldn't be combined with the -no-feature or all this variables should be properly placed in the #ifdef and unused parameter should has Q_UNUSED.

I made several patches to fix the issues, but there may be more:
https://codereview.qt-project.org/189456

Replacing QUICK_TEST_MAIN macro may cause Qt Quick test to disappear
requirements.text:
I want to register a C++ for use in a unit test. I succeeded, but the unit test disappears inconsistently in Qt Creator 4.6.2. When I determined how to reproduce this I tested on QC 4.7.0-rc1 and verified the same behavior.

To register my C++ class, I expand the QUICK_TEST_MAIN macro in place and add the qmlRegisterType call. When I do this, the respective Qt Quick test becomes flaky and will disappear from the Tests view. The QUICK_TEST_MAIN macro seems to be key for showing Qt Quick tests in the Tests view, which I cannot find documented.

Here are my steps to reproduce:
 # To make this easier, split the "Projects" view and show the "Tests" view so that both are accessible.
 # Create a "Other Project" | "Subdirs Project", name it "Tests", select a kit, press Next, then Finish & Add Subproject.
 # Create a "Other Project" | "Auto Test Project", press Choose, name it "Test1", press Next, select the Qt Quick Test framework, name the Test case "Test1", select a kit, press Next, then Finish.
 # Observe that there is a "Test1" Quick Test in the Tests view.
 # In the "Projects" view, right-click the "Tests" project and select "New Subproject..."
 # Create a "Other Project" | "Auto Test Project", press Choose, name it "Test2", press Next, select the Qt Quick Test framework, name the test case "Test2", select a kit, press Next, then Finish.
 # Observe that there is now a "Test2" Quick Test in the Tests view.
 # Open main.cpp in the "Test1" project for editing.
 # Right-click the QUICK_TEST_MAIN macro name in the 3rd line and select the "Follow Symbol Under Cursor" menu option to jump to the declaration of the macro.
 # Copy the selected macro definition (it's the first of the four similar macros) from the "int main ..." line to the closing brace and paste it into the main.cpp file just under the existing QUICK_TEST_MAIN macro.
 # Comment out line 3 with the QUICK_TEST_MAIN macro.
 # Replace the #name argument to quick_test_main() on line 9 with "test1" and save.
 # Right-click the "Tests" view and choose "Rescan Tests".
 # Observe that both Quick Tests are still available in the "Tests" view.
 # Edit Tests.pro and comment out the subdir entry for Test2 and save. Wait a couple seconds while Qt Creator parses the .pro file changes.
 # Observe that there are no Quick Tests anymore – they are both gone.
 # Edit Test1/main.cpp and un-comment the 3rd line with the QUICK_TEST_MAIN macro.
 Observe that the Test1 Quick Test almost immediately appears, even without saving.
 # Comment-out the 3rd line with the QUICK_TEST_MAIN macro again and save.
 # Right-click the "Tests" view and choose "Rescan Tests".
 # Observe that "Test1" is removed again.

I attached my project at step 10 right before expanding the QUICK_TEST_MAIN macro in place. I did not insert code to register a C++ class for QML, but it would go inside main().

The behavior is so consistent that I wonder if QUICK_TEST_MAIN is required for "Tests" view support. If it is, how can C++ classes be registered for use in QML while allowing the auto test to be accessible in the "Tests" View?
