requirements.name: Scxml Editor: Import the Visual Scxml Editor as plugin
Investigate the performance overhead of the JS interpreter on the WASM VM
requirements.text:
h1. Objective

The port of QML to the WASM VM defaults to the use of QML byte code interpreter to run JavaScript binding expressions and code in .js files.

The port does not utilize a Just-in-time compiler. It is conceivable to generate a WASM module on the fly, but due to high frequency of function calls in and out of the JS VM, the extra overhead of function calls across WASM modules may not be worth it.

Instead the objective of this task is to investigate what overhead the QML byte code interpreter has when running in the WASM VM.
 * The QML interpreter uses a computed goto on the traditional target architectures to speed up jumping between different byte code instructions. This is supported when using clang and gcc.
 The WASM MVP specification does not support such a control flow and consequently the byte code interpreter for QML uses a traditional switch statement to direct between different byte code instruction implementations. This makes the interpreter running in the WASM VM slower than on other architectures.

 * The byte code instructions involve a step of decoding parameters. This applies to all target architectures.

h1. Prototype

A prototype was written to translate the byte code instructions directly to WASM expressions, to eliminate the cost of the old-style switch statement as well as the instruction decoding. In a straight-forward manner, the prototype compiles a .qml or .js file to a relocatable WASM module. Every JavaScript function or binding expressions is mapped to a WASM function, with a parameter structure suitable for the JavaScript virtual machine. The QML binary data structure is embedded as a data segment in the WASM module and along with the individual functions made visible to the LLD linker via a symbol table in the linking section. The byte code instructions in the function code are decoded and translated to WASM expressions and control flow structures.

Here is a simple example of how this translation can look like. Assuming the presence of a function local called $acc (i64) that represents the byte code VM's accumulator, $enginePtr for the address (i32) of the V4 engine and $jsStack (i32) for the address of the JavaScript stack, the "loadName" instruction that looks up a property in the activation and stores the result in the JS stack can be encoded as follows:
{code:java}
(set_local $acc
    (call $qv4runtime_method_loadName
        (get_local $enginePtr)
        (i32.const 5) // index in compilation unit's string table for the name
    )
)
(i64.store offset=16
    (get_local $jsStack)
    (get_local $acc)
)
{code}

As the above example also shows, function calls into the JS run-time can be resolved directly by the linker and require no extra indirection. 

h1. Results

The prototype work was developed to the point where a simple factorial calculation test-case could run and be used to measure the switch and decoding overhead. The following example was measured:
{code:java}
var d1 = +new Date

for (var x = 0; x < 1000000; ++x) {
    var res = 1;
    for (var i = 2; i <= 12; i=i+1)
        res = res * i;

    if (res != 479001600) {
        console.log("KO", res)
    }
}

var d2 = +new Date
console.log("done in", d2 - d1)
{code}
The generated code involves a large amount of calls into the JS runtime as well as reasonably complex control flow due to the loops as well as exception checking after run-time calls.

*The above example runs ~35% faster when compiled directly to WASM compared to the traditional byte code interpreter.*
h1. Implementation caveats

The prototype uses binaryen for the code generation as well as llvm's
 WASM back-end as well as WASM enabled lld to link the traditional Qt
 code together with the ahead-of-time generated WASM module. This imposes
 a requirement on a bleeding edge toolchain that even required
 modifications.

There are two possible ways of productizing this, if desired:
 * Pursue the path of relocatable WASM module generation by upstreaming
 changes to binaryen and emscripten as well as putting together an SDK
 with the latest set of tools for use with the Qt port.
 The downsides of this approach are the dependency to a toolchain and spec that is
 still in development as well as the work required to upstream
 changes to allow for embedding relocatable wasm objects in archives
 and "passing" them through to emscripten. The upside of this approach
 is that the code generator can be fully tested against the entire
 test suite of Ecmascript as well as QML through embedding of the
 binaryen interpreter. This was used for prototype development.

 * Replace the generation of WASM code with generation of C++ code.
 The downside of this approach is that it is harder to test the code
 generator for correctness. The upside is that it does not require any
 changes to the SDK or toolchain. The approach itself is also not
 validated yet with a prototype.

Consider adding a declarative arc element with an API based on e.g. angle (like that of QPainter or [https://www.w3schools.com/tags/canvas_arc.asp]) to make this common use case easier.

requirements.name: SpinBox resets to "from" value when loses focus
requirements.text:
{code}
Button {
    id:but1
}
SpinBox {
    focus: true
    KeyNavigation.backtab: but1
    KeyNavigation.tab: but2
    KeyNavigation.left: but1
    KeyNavigation.right: but2
    from: 10
    to: 1000
    value: 100
    onValueChanged: but1.text = "aa " + value
}
Button {
    id:but2
}
{code}
Steps to reproduce:
 - change the sinbox value
 - press tab|backtab|left|right hey
Spingbox will reset the value to 10 ("from" value).
 - same thing happens if you just press on any button

:/qtlabscontrols.conf
[Controls]
Style=Material

[Material]
Theme=Dark
Accent=Teal

requirements.name: Improve UX when dragging objects to tree
requirements.text:
Dragging objects to timeline tree can be bit frustrating, as studio doesn't implement a couple of basic UX features:
 * The tree view should scroll the tree up/down when hovering on top/bottom edge (e.g. first/last visible row)
 * Hovering over a collapsed row should expand it after a short timeout

[~soili_vainamo] to specify exact behavior/timeouts.

requirements.name: qml Text ignores padding on calculating height, when lineCount > 1
requirements.text:
Incorrect calculating height of Text, when number of lines more than 1. 
When lineCount > 1, topPadding and bottomPaddings are ignored.

PS: green rectangle is background of Text, it is the real size of Text.

PSS: in main.qml - click to right side of green rectangle to add text(or new line) and left side to delete line(or cut some characters from start)

requirements.name: Windows: licheck cannot find license files if system username contains unicode characters
requirements.text:
License checker fails to locate license files if user profile path contains some unicode characters (at least on Windows 10).

To reproduce:
- create new user with a username of "gröp☻"
- login with that user
- try compiling any qmake project (with Qt Creator or directly through qmake)
-> build fails because license file cannot be found

requirements.name: Assigning screens in ApplicationWindow possible only AFTER they have been created
requirements.text:
The Qt.application documentation says:

 

In addition to examining properties like name, width, height, etc., the array elements can also be assigned to the screen property of Window items, thus serving as an alternative to the C++ side's [QWindow::setScreen()|https://doc-snapshots.qt.io/qt5-5.9/qwindow.html#setScreen].

...which sort of works, but might not be the expected/desired behavior (ie *assign* works, but *binding* doesn't)

 

For example, this fails:
{code}
import QtQuick 2.5
import QtQuick.Controls 2.1
import QtQuick.Window 2.2
import "utils.js" as scr

ApplicationWindow {
    visibility: Window.FullScreen
    screen: Qt.application.screen[scr.getExtScreenId()]

...

}
{code}
... with ""ApplicationWindow.screen" is not available due to component versioning.", but

{code}
 import QtQuick 2.5
import QtQuick.Controls 2.1
import QtQuick.Window 2.2
import "utils.js" as scr

ApplicationWindow {
    id: wnd
    visibility: Window.FullScreen
    Component.onCompleted: wnd.screen = Qt.application.screen[scr.getExtScreenId()]

...

}
{code}
 

I know managing the lifecycle of attached properties like Screen can be tricky, but if this is the intended behavior, the documentation needs to be more clear on the recommended ways of how to use it.

requirements.name: Qt 5.8.0 pre-alpha fails to compile on Ubuntu 16.04.1 with gcc 5.4.0
requirements.text:
I get errors when building QtSerialBus on Ubuntu 16.04.1 with gcc 5.4.0 (see attached).

The same system was able to build Qt 5.7.1.

QtSerialBus in Qt 5.8.0 pre-alpha does build okay for me on an Ubuntu 14.04 system with gcc 4.8.4.

requirements.name: update apalis-imx6 documentation
requirements.text: Number of changes are done to the apalis-imx6 image that need to be documented.\r\n * u-boot now defaults to ixora v1.1 dtb, using any other carrier board need to change the fdt_file variable in uboot environment.\r\n * ixora v1.1 dtb enables the new capasitive touch display ([https://www.toradex.com/accessories/capacitive-touch-display),] using Fusion displays requires change to kernel and possible to the u-boot.

requirements.name: Screen rotation broken on iOS
requirements.text:
Rotating the screen can lead to black borders on iOS. Steps to reproduce:

# Start a Qt app.
# Turn off the screen and rotate the phone.
# Turn on and unlock the screen. The Qt app's screen is rotated but only half of the screen is filled.

requirements.name: qdoc: Empty documentation generated for namespaces
requirements.text:
Changes to qdoc between 5.11 and 5.12 seem to have broken namespace docs:

 

[http://doc-snapshots.qt.io/qt5-5.12/qt.html]

 

The index file looks OK, but the namespace members -do not- appear in the output *for obsolete members*.

requirements.name: Ability to use Qt Lite configuration with Yocto
requirements.text:
PM owner: [~santtuahonen]

R&D owner: [~kavi]

It must be possible to use Qt Lite configuration (with commercial Qt and) with Yocto based embedded Linux.
h1. Business justification

Qt Lite configuration is by far most useful on confined (embedded) platforms. Turns out we have not fully implemented or documented how the Qt Lite configuration that is created with Qt Configurator Tool can be used in context with Yocto recipes.

For Qt Lite, the support for Yocto based environment is more important than support for desktop (QTPM-732) or mobile platforms (QTPM-460).
h1. Effort

[~kavi] to enter.

requirements.name: Windows: 32bit package does not register as 64bit postmortem debugger
requirements.text:
qtcdebugger -register only creates an entry for the WoW64 node as it is a 32bit executable (the problematic part is that it ships with a 64bit Qt package).

Looking at the code of "Support accessing 32-bit Registry from 64-bit programs and vice versa"  64261c0871043ef44a0a9c855d78428e773dfa94  (qtbase/5.7) https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/121446/ and   http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa384129%28VS.85%29.aspx , it should actually be possible to access both registry sections.

It could either be reimplemented in terms of QSettings using the new Registry32/64Format (5.7) or use WinAPI.

requirements.name: [REG 4.3->4.4] Line filter in locator is not fast enough
requirements.text: When I try to jump to a line, I type Ctrl-L, the line number and immediately press Return.\r\n\r\nThis works fine in 4.3, but in 4.4 there's a short delay (~200-500ms, it's hard to tell) in which Return has no effect (and the line number doesn't appear in the locator).

requirements.name: Crash when suspending and resuming an Animation

import QtQuick 2.6
import QtQuick.Window 2.2

Window {
    visible: true
    width: 640
    height: 480
    title: qsTr("Hello World")

    SequentialAnimation {
        id: mainAnim
        running: true

        ScriptAction {
            script: {
                mainAnim.pause()
                mainAnim.resume()
            }
        }
    }
}
{code}

requirements.name: Add roughness map to the standard material
requirements.text: Standard material shaders already support changing the specular roughness, but there is no roughness map to change the value across the material. Add roughness map to the standard material in editor and use it in the shaders.

requirements.name: Windows: qmake generates incorrect path for Qt DLLs in check target
requirements.text:
When a project has {{CONFIG += testcase}}, the {{test_wrapper.bat}} that is generated adds the Qt "libs" path to the {{PATH}} environment variable. On Windows, for installed Qt builds (i.e. not developer builds), the DLLs live in the "bins" directory so the tests can't run correctly.

You can reproduce the issue using the attached example project.

requirements.name: EGL QPA seems linked to libEGL with a wrong path
requirements.text:
I'm Crossbuilding Qt 5.10 in LibreELEC for Rpi.

We have been using fine Qt 5.9.2 up to now, Qt 5.10 built ok aside that issue which has been solved with a patch https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-65079.

When i run my application on the target i get the following error :

 
{code:java}
plexmediaplayer 
QStandardPaths: XDG_RUNTIME_DIR not set, defaulting to '/tmp/runtime-root'
libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
Logging to /storage/.local/share/plexmediaplayer/logs/plexmediaplayer.log
[1345:1397:1221/074013.471727:ERROR:surface_factory_qt.cpp(93)] Failed to load /home/longchair/github/longchair/LibreELEC.tv/build.PlexMediaPlayer-RPi2.arm-9.0-devel/toolchain/armv7ve-libreelec-linux-gnueabi/sysroot/opt/vc/lib/libEGL.so.1: /home/longchair/github/longchair/LibreELEC.tv/build.PlexMediaPlayer-RPi2.arm-9.0-devel/toolchain/armv7ve-libreelec-linux-gnueabi/sysroot/opt/vc/lib/libEGL.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
[1345:1397:1221/074013.480266:ERROR:gl_surface_qt.cpp(701)] Requested OpenGL implementation is not supported. Implementation: 0
Received signal 4 <unknown> 000070b9b810
#0 0x00007174467e <unknown>
#1 0x0000717444ca <unknown>
#2 0x000070b52172 <unknown>
#3 0x000071744904 <unknown>
#4 0x0000756d1a30 <unknown>
#5 0x000070b9b810 <unknown>
#6 0x000071e2ec46 <unknown>
#7 0x000071e42c96 <unknown>
#8 0x000071e44720 <unknown>
#9 0x000071e452de <unknown>
#10 0x000071e4124e <unknown>
#11 0x000071e41638 <unknown>
#12 0x000071e40d3e <unknown>
#13 0x000071e423ba <unknown>
#14 0x00007179beca <unknown>
#15 0x000071756f90 <unknown>
#16 0x000071757884 <unknown>
#17 0x000071757af0 <unknown>
#18 0x000071758538 <unknown>
#19 0x00007176c5e8 <unknown>
#20 0x00007177ed64 <unknown>
#21 0x00007177baf0 <unknown>
[end of stack trace]
Calling _exit(1). Core file will not be generated.{code}
 

So it seems that the path at which it's looking for libEGL is using the build host path to the sysroot, which wasn't the case in 5.9.2 with the same configuration options

I have attached the configure.* files as a first step.

 

Any help will be greatly appreciated :)

requirements.name: Adding new automotive devices
requirements.text: New script to add automotive devices in squish.\r\n\r\ncheck if old scripts are useful.

requirements.name: Custom style of the VKB does not work properly after using windeployqt.exe on the project binary
requirements.text:
The user is using Windows 8.1 x64. The user created a nice looking style for the Virtual keyboard. The user did everything in exact same way as described here http://doc.qt.io/QtVirtualKeyboard/technical-guide.html#styles-and-layouts. When user is running the application from the Qt Creator, she can see, the style is displayed as it was intended. Now it is time to send the project to the end-user. However, it cannot be done, since the custom style is not properly displayed.

Expected behaviour:
The exact same outfit as in Qt Creator.

What actually happens:
Custom style is not displayed properly. See attached screen-shots.
This screenshot vk_in_qt_creator.png shows a custom style applied to the VK 1.3 in application run from Qt Creator.
This screenshot in_release_after_windeployqt.png shows, how does custom style displayed after windeployqt.exe was applied to the project binary.

Steps to reproduce:

0. VK must be compiled and installed in release mode as well as the example VK application
1. Install style attached as described here  http://doc.qt.io/QtVirtualKeyboard/technical-guide.html#styles-and-layouts (unpack test.7z under [Qt]/qml/QtQuick/Enterprise/VirtualKeyboard\Styles
2. Run standard VK example in Qt Creator (Examples/QtVirtualKeyboard/quick/enterprise/virtualkeyboard\virtualkeyboard), set  QT_VIRTUALKEYBOARD_STYLE=test
3. Observe, everything works fine
4. Now, use windeployqt.exe tool on project binary to create a stand-alone application package.
5. Double-click on binary.
6. Observe, style does not displayed properly. Background on some buttons is white instead of red, green and blue.

requirements.name: No documentation of editor side on using QML streaming
requirements.text: Missing documentation on how to use QML streaming in the editor.

requirements.name: PhongAlphaMaterial renders Quick item behind the Scene3D
requirements.text: When rendering an object with PhongAlphaMaterial, it show's something behind the Scene3D.\r\nThis is expected that PhongAlphaMaterial renders something behind the 3D object in Scene3D, not behind the Scene3D.

requirements.name: Shortcut stops triggering Action when the Action is assigned to a Button in a Repeater
requirements.text:
Shortcut stops triggering Action when the Action is assigned to a Button in a Repeater.

This affects QtQuick applications using Controls2.

 

How to reproduce:

1) Create an Action and assign a shortcut to it, do some action on the trigger

2) Create a Repeater (with only one repetition) with a Button delegate

3) Assign the Action to the Button delegate

4) Start application, hit the shortcut -> BUG -> nothing happens

5) Observation - if the shortcut is reassigned to the Action it starts working again

 

Desired behavior of course is that the Action triggers. When removing the Repeater the Action triggers. When including it in a simple Button (outside of a Repeater) the Action triggers.

 

Real use cases include creating multiple buttons in a Repeater and assigning them Actions from an ActionGroup based on their index.

 

I'm including a minimal example as an attachment.

requirements.name: WebEngineView: Using offTheRecord profile with Pepper Flash plugin leads to assert in debug mode
requirements.text:
When using the Pepper Flash Plugin and loading a page with flash content into WebEngineView, which has offTheRecord profile set, there is the following assert in debug mode:
[0114/222123:FATAL:pepper_flash_file_message_filter.cc(56)] Check failed:
false.
The problem raises from Chromium, which hits NOTREACHED() when it gets empty user profile data directory path - even in offTheRecord/incognito mode.
This could be fixed by returning a non-empty path also in incognito mode, but is that really a right way to do it.

requirements.name: Module validation is broken when there are both optional and required dependencies in the current context
requirements.text: If the current product has multiple dependencies on a module, some optional and some required, the module validation may only run once where it is optional and then will silently succeed validation (even though validation fails) when it is required.\r\n\r\nFor example, numerous modules depend on the xcode module (optional). If you create a CppApplication product and explicitly depend on the xcode module with an incorrect property set (try xcode.sdkVersion:2), no failure is reported.

requirements.name: Class QLogicComponent changes
requirements.text: Rename class to QFrameAction\r\n\r\nframeUpdate -> triggered

requirements.name: Support documentation of all available controls in Neptune 3
requirements.text:
As a user, I want to have the documentation of all available controls in Neptune 3. They are currently only partially documented, hence not supporting our QDoc project documentation as well. Documentations need to be improved and follow the structure of QDoc to be documented with other components in Neptune 3.

Those controls are:
 * ListItem
 * ListItemBasic
 * ListItemProgress
 * ListItemSwitch
 * ListItemTwoButtons
 * ScalableBorderImage
 * ToolsColumn

With an external Logitech HD webcam C615 the image takes 20 seconds before it initially displays and then about 5-10 seconds for the image to update afterwards.\n\nThis is reproducible with the declarative-camera example

requirements.name: [REG] Popup shadow leaks events through on touch
requirements.text:
Steps:
- Run the test app with the Material style on any device that has a touch screen
- Drag to the right from within the popup's shadow

Expected result:
- The modal popup should block user input and therefore it should not be possible to drag the drawer open.

Actual result:
- It is possible to drag the drawer open if started from within the shadow of the modal popup.

Test app:
{code}
import QtQuick 2.7
import QtQuick.Controls 2.0

ApplicationWindow {
    id: window
    visible: true
    width: 400
    height: 400

    Drawer {
        width: window.width / 2
        height: window.height
        dragMargin: window.width
    }

    Popup {
        modal: true
        visible: true
        x: (window.width - width) / 2
        y: (window.height - height) / 2
        width: window.width / 3
        height: window.height / 3
        closePolicy: Popup.NoAutoClose
    }
}
{code}

requirements.name: SwipeView: dynamic creation / deletion of subpages crashes application
requirements.text: I'm trying to dynamically create / delete subpages of a SwipeView using a Repeater. If I assign a arbitrary but fixed int value to the repeater model, everything works fine. As soon as I try to change this value during runtime the application crashes. In the attached code you can either click twice on the decrease or the increase button or click on one of the buttons and do a swipe. Using the same repeater in the same way in a Row (see attached code line 32ff) works as expected.

requirements.name: [REG 5.6.1 -> 5.7.0] Qt Mapviewer, the center at start is wrong
requirements.text:
I experienced a problem with Qt5.7.0,

If I build mapviewer example and run it in my android phone, the center
location is not the right one, it gives me a latitude of -0.9485, the right value
should be the one for Qt Company lat:59.9485, longitude give me the right value.

If I use Qt-5.6.1 with the same android development kit and the same ndk the center is the right one.

So, it seem that there is a bug in the android library on Qt5.7.0.
There is no problem for the Desktop version.
The iOS , no problem.

This bug appear when I start the application. We should see
Qt Company, but the center is an other country.

Some of you experimenting something like this ?

Using Cycle map as MapType.

requirements.name: build failure with X32 ABI
requirements.text:
After configure -developer-build etc. and starting the build, eventually we come to this:

{code}
g++ -c -pipe -g -std=c++1y -fvisibility=hidden -fvisibility-inlines-hidden -fno-exceptions -Wall -W -Wvla -Werror -Wno-error=cpp -Wno-error=deprecated-declarations -Wno-error=strict-overflow -D_REENTRANT -fPIC -DQT_NO_TSLIB -DQT_NO_USING_NAMESPACE -DQT_BUILD_NETWORK_LIB -DQT_BUILDING_QT -DQT_NO_CAST_TO_ASCII -DQT_ASCII_CAST_WARNINGS -DQT_MOC_COMPAT -DQT_USE_QSTRINGBUILDER -DQT_DEPRECATED_WARNINGS -DQT_DISABLE_DEPRECATED_BEFORE=0x050000 -DQT_NO_EXCEPTIONS -D_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE -D_LARGEFILE_SOURCE -DQT_CORE_LIB -Wall -Wextra -Werror -Woverloaded-virtual -Wshadow -Wundef -Wnon-virtual-dtor -Wpointer-arith -Wformat-security -Wno-long-long -Wno-variadic-macros -pedantic-errors -Wchar-subscripts -Wold-style-cast -Wcast-align -I/home/rutledge/dev/qt5/qtbase/src/network -I. -I/home/rutledge/dev/qt5/qtbase/src/network/kernel -I../../include -I../../include/QtNetwork -I../../include/QtNetwork/5.8.0 -I../../include/QtNetwork/5.8.0/QtNetwork -I../../include/QtCore/5.8.0 -I../../include/QtCore/5.8.0/QtCore -I../../include/QtCore -I.moc -I/home/rutledge/dev/qt5/qtbase/mkspecs/linux-g++ -DQT_NO_CAST_TO_ASCII=1 -DQT_NO_CAST_FROM_ASCII=1 -DQT_STRICT_ITERATORS -DQT_NO_URL_CAST_FROM_STRING=1 -DQT_NO_CAST_FROM_BYTEARRAY=1 -DQT_NO_KEYWORDS=1 -DQT_USE_QSTRINGBUILDER -DQT_USE_FAST_OPERATOR_PLUS -Dsignals=int -Dslots=int -Demit=public: -Dforeach=public: -Dforever=public: -xc++ /home/rutledge/dev/qt5/qtbase/src/network/access/qabstractnetworkcache.h -o .obj/header_qabstractnetworkcache.o
{standard input}: Assembler messages:
{standard input}:12: Error: cannot represent relocation type BFD_RELOC_X86_64_GOT64 in x32 mode
Makefile:1122: recipe for target '.obj/header_qabstractnetworkcache.o' failed
make: *** [.obj/header_qabstractnetworkcache.o] Error 1
{code}

Seems like BFD_RELOC_X86_64_GOT64 is a "large code model" relocation which probably assumes that pointers are 64-bit, so I wonder why such a thing would be generated - the compiler should know better, unless we did something which forces it to happen.  I wonder if we have a way to specify a different code model.

Qt 5.5.1 is the latest version that has an ebuild so far on Gentoo, and builds fine with x32 ABI.

requirements.name: QtQuickControls2 Drawer doesn't close if tapped outside
memory overflow
requirements.text:
Memory overflow in the cpp code with comment in code page windows-1251. With "utf-8" all right.
The problem in recursive function "parseSimpleDeclaration" in source qtcreator "src\libs\3rdparty\cplusplus\Parser.cpp"
The header file "mapgdi.h" that cause this problem in archive.
Simple example in attachment archive.

This bug not present in qt creator with version less than 3.2.

additional information:
qt creator in debug mode in the header "mapgi.h" of the attachment performs the infinite recursive call between the functions of module Parser.cpp parseClassSpecifier and parseSimpleDeclaration

requirements.name: [Android]: When using the holo theme the copyright text will not be visible on the map
requirements.text: [Android]: When using the holo theme the copyright text will not be visible on the map. This is because the background of the image being used for drawing the text is always white. But if the application's palette uses white for the text then it will end up being white on white and thus not visible.

requirements.name: Windows binary packages: Add 64-bit build
QtCreator Windows: Offer to copy example as on Linux when installed in write-protected location
requirements.text:
On Linux, when Qt is installed in a  write-protected location ( e.g. /opt/qt ), Qt Creator offers to copy the example to another location when clicking on it (and conveniently, as on windows, opens the help for this example). On windows it opens the example in the installed location, even if it is read only, and, of course, you won't be able to configure or build it.

Attached some screenshots to show the linux functionality and windows error messages. (Danish "Adgang nægtet" means "Access Denied" in english)

-Can this multi user functionality be ported to the windows version?- (Functionality is already present in the windows version, according to [~con] so it seems to be a bug)

requirements.name: [XCB] unexpected deadlocks with XIAllowTouchEvents
requirements.text:
Some systems are still having libXi 1.7.1 and the following changes are breaking Qt working properly:

requirements.name: Runtime warning about COMPAT signal QProcess::error
On some occasion QScreen::devicePixelRatio() crashes.
requirements.text:
There is no fixed step to reproduce this But generally it is found that when users frequently connect/disconnect an external 4k monitor then devicePixelRatio crashes with following stack.

{code}

```

requirements.name: Refactor Coin/CI dependency resolver
requirements.text:
workitemfactory.py
dependency.py

Refactor the get_dependencies.py (make it more clear to understand)

There is also one related bug:

[https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/198930/]

Also if possible generalize the workitemfactory, once the product repository stuff is in place there can be numerous products with product level dependencies.

requirements.text: Cross compile and test Qt 5.10 + INTEGRITY on Renesas H3 Salvator-X board

requirements.name: Implement NetworkManager class for QTelemetry library
requirements.text:
Create sample base class for sending telemetry data to REST-server backend:
 * -QTelemetry::INetworkManager - Interface abstract class-
 * -QTelemetry::QNetworkManager – base class for actually sending JSON data to backend-
 * -Test REST-API server - dummy or DB based (SQLite or PostgreSQL), based on Node.JS Express or [QttpServer|https://supamii.github.io/qttpserver/].-

requirements.name: QmlLive: update docs for 5.11
requirements.text: See [https://doc.qt.io/QtQmlLive/usage.html] and the snapshots [https://doc-snapshots.qt.io/qtqmllive/index.html] from [https://doc-snapshots.qt.io/qtautomotivesuite/index.html,|https://doc-snapshots.qt.io/qtautomotivesuite/index.html] \r\n Add into documentation where to get Qml Live (installer or source code + how to build) and describe that qmake should be the same with which was used for building app.

requirements.name: "comparison doesn't meet irreflexive requirements" when browsing local files
requirements.text:
With the current 5.9 with 55-based, when opening {{file:///}} in the demobrowser and clicking a few sub-directories (so far I needed 3 tries outside gdb, one with gdb), I get:

{code}
/usr/include/c++/6.3.1/bits/stl_algo.h:4737:
Error: comparison doesn't meet irreflexive requirements, assert(!(a < a)).

Objects involved in the operation:
    instance "functor" @ 0x0x7ff58fffe5c8 {
    }
    iterator::value_type "ordered type" {
    }

requirements.name: ButtonGroup not recognized by Qt Creator
qt_message_fatal crashes if context.file is empty
requirements.text:
Not sure if this is a WebEngine issue or just a QtCore issue, but it crashes on my anytime it logs a fatal error.

One way to duplicate this is to remove Qt's bin directory from your Windows PATH variable, and make sure QtWebEngineProcess.exe is NOT in the same folder as your executable. When you try to run and load a QtWebEngineView, you'll get a console.log message echo'd about how it can't find QtWebEngineProcess.exe. But it will ALSO crash, with this stack trace:

Qt5Cored.dll!convert_to_wchar_t_elided(wchar_t * d, unsigned int space, const char * s) Line 256    C++
    Qt5Cored.dll!qt_message_fatal(QtMsgType __formal, const QMessageLogContext & context, const QString & message) Line 1593    C++
    Qt5Cored.dll!QMessageLogger::fatal(const char * msg, ...) Line 784  C++
    Qt5WebEngineCored.dll!`anonymous namespace'::subProcessPath(void)   C++
    Qt5WebEngineCored.dll!WebEngineLibraryInfo::getPath(int)    C++
    Qt5WebEngineCored.dll!WebEngineContext::WebEngineContext(void)  C++
    Qt5WebEngineCored.dll!WebEngineContext::current(void)   C++
    Qt5WebEngineCored.dll!QtWebEngineCore::BrowserContextAdapter::defaultContext(void)  C++
>   Qt5WebEngineWidgetsd.dll!QWebEngineProfile::defaultProfile() Line 516   C++

The crash dialog gives this:

Problem signature:
Problem Event Name:	BEX
Application Name:	qxs.exe
Application Version:	2017.0.0.23696
Application Timestamp:	56c25435
Fault Module Name:	StackHash_0a9e
Fault Module Version:	0.0.0.0
Fault Module Timestamp:	00000000
Exception Offset:	00000000
Exception Code:	c0000005
Exception Data:	00000008
OS Version:	6.1.7601.2.1.0.256.27
Locale ID:	1033
Additional Information 1:	0a9e
Additional Information 2:	0a9e372d3b4ad19135b953a78882e789
Additional Information 3:	0a9e
Additional Information 4:	0a9e372d3b4ad19135b953a78882e789

For some reason the debugger won't let me step in past the QWebEngineProfile::defaultProfile() call, so I can't see why it's crashing in qt_message_fatal. Fortunately, enough information was echo'd to the console prior to the crash that I could figure out what the problem was.

I've had other crashes (reported elsewhere) in QtWebEngine that also crash when it's logging an error message.

requirements.name: Port to Windows
requirements.text:
Test that the existing functionality works on Windows and make the necessary porting.

The first obstacle is getting libusb to work with the Boot2Qt devices. On Windows libusb relies on WinUSB, which is delivered along with Windows. However, a .inf needs to be written that specifies that devices with certain vendor and product ID should be handled by the WinUSB driver.

On Linux Ctrl-C in the console lead to SIGINT and handling that signal is implemented in InterruptSignalHandler. An alternative implementation of that class using the Windows equivalents should be done.

requirements.name: Upgrade Wayland version to 1.7
requirements.text:
Many tasks are currently blocked due to outdated Wayland version in CI/testing.

Ubuntu 15.04 has Wayland 1.7, while 15.10 has Wayland 1.8. Both will work fine.

Update [2]: "Linux UbuntuTouch_15_04 (gcc-armv7)" has Wayland 1.6, but that is a cross compile build. We will need an x86 platform with 
Ubuntu 15.04 or later, since we want to run CI tests. (This work is ongoing)

Update [3]: OpenSUSE Leap 42.1 would be preferable to Ubuntu, since it makes sense to test Wayland on a distro where it will be used. Wayland >= 1.8 is also preferable so the protocol (wayland.xml) can be updated independently.

requirements.name: Wrong position of QTabletEvent from wacom device on windows
requirements.text:
When drawing on a wacom tablet, some of the tablet events have a position that is wrong, resulting in a jagged path. The related mouse events do not show the same behaviour.

I've modified the tablet example to also draw from the mouse events at a small offset.
 The red lines are from the tablet events:
 !Intuos Draw.jpg!
 The example shown above is from the Intuos Draw.

The higher resolution Intuos Pro, shows a similar effect, although it is less visible. The opacity at some of the points shows that there are actually multiple points close to each other, but not offset in the general direction of the stroke.
 On the last downward stroke the opacity reveals that a part of the stroke appears to be going backwards.
 !Intuos Pro M.jpg!

Both of the examples above have been done with Qt 5.9.3, but 5.6.3 shows similar behaviour.

The following is with 5.10.0 RC 2, but without the offset, suggesting that it is the majority of the points that have the wrong position.

!Intuos Draw No Offset.png!

requirements.name: Qt Safe Renderer communication component implementation
requirements.text:
There must be communication module for the Safe renderer.

Communication module takes care of communication between safe and non-safe partitions.

It shall be possible to create layout requests dynamically from the non-safe partition (from the QML directly).

 

DoD: Communication component is implemented according to software design and all patches are reviewed & approved in code review

requirements.name: [WinRT] Dispatcher memory corruption
requirements.text:
{{bool QEventDispatcherWinRT::event(QEvent *e)}} has a really bad memory corruption caused by copying into a dangling reference.

A reference varaible info taken from d->timerInfos:
{code}WinRTTimerInfo &info = d->timerInfos[id];{code}

The same reference later copy assigned even though it may be danging after d->timerInfos modifications.

{code}info = d->timerInfos[id];{code}

It has the right idea of getting a new "reference", but that's not how references work and this is just a balant copy assignment into potentally dangling reference.

And to top it most of the time the heap corruption causes random crashes elsewhere. There is more reckless reference usage that could use a review, but this is the biggest random heap corruptor that I have finally cought in the WinRT plugin.

Two simple fixes attached, I personally prefer the scoped with minor reordering apporach to prevent accidental usage of the first reference, but the last {{info.inEvent = false;}} after {{QCoreApplication::postEvent(this, new QTimerEvent(id));}} might still be toxic and neither solution solves that.

requirements.name: Resolution of source file for failed tests is invalid
requirements.text:
When a test fails, it shows the failure location (using {{__FILE__}} and {{__LINE__}})

This information is used by the parser to link to the source file.

Since __FILE__ is relative, a base directory is needed for resolving it to a full path.

The base directory that is used is the application path. This is wrong both for shadow and in-source build (at least on Windows).

The executable is placed in {{debug/test.exe}}, while the Makefile is one directory above it, and the reference is to {{../test/test.cpp}} for shadow build or just {{test.cpp}} for in-source.

The base directory should be the directory from which make was executed.

requirements.name: Crash when switching to a newly created session while debugging
requirements.text:
# Open a session
# Start debugging, receive message "The CDB process terminated." - the debugger will still be "active" (the toolbar reads "Starting debugger "QmlCppEngine" for ABI "x86-windows-msvc2015-pe-64bit"..." and the "Stop Application" button is enabled)
# Open the session manager
# Create a new session, and instead of hitting "Ok", hit "Switch to"
# A warning will come up saying that debugging is still occurring and asks if it should terminate it; hit "Yes" and it will crash

requirements.name: Zoom slider in the mapviewer example doesn't work on touchscreens
requirements.text: The zoom slider in the mapviewer example stops accepting touches after the first touch.

requirements.name: QWebEngineView::setFocus() does not work
requirements.text:
QWebEngineView::setFocus() does not work, it does not pass focus on to the underlying webkit widgets. This is most easily demonstrated by turning off FocusOnNavigationEnabled. With it off, if the html is loaded in a hidden QWebEngineView which is then shown with setVisbile(True), calling setFocus(True) does not actually pass focus to the web components. See minimal test case below. This test case loads some HTML in a hidden QWebView() and then makes it visible and calls setFocus() on it. The QLineEdit that had focus initially no longer has focus, but neither does the webview have focus. Pressing the up/down arrow keys does not scroll the page. One has to click inside the web view to actually transfer focus to it. The autofocus attribute on the HTML textarea does not work either in this scenario. If you remove the line that turns off FocusOnNavigationEnabled then everything works, presumably because that causes focusIfNeccessary() to call Focus() on load. So, the fix for this is probably to call webContents->Focus() in QWebEngineView::setFocus(). {code} from PyQt5.Qt import * def show_view(): v.setHtml('''{}'''.format( ''.join(f'

{i}

' for i in range(200)))) v.setVisible(True) v.setFocus() app = QApplication([]) d = QDialog() l = QVBoxLayout(d) b = QLineEdit() l.addWidget(b) v = QWebEngineView() s = v.page().settings() s.setAttribute(20, False) # FocusOnNavigationEnabled = 20 l.addWidget(v) d.resize(d.sizeHint()) v.setVisible(False) b.setFocus() QTimer.singleShot(100, show_view) d.exec_() {code}

requirements.name: Graphics driver fails to load
requirements.text:
The Kontron board doesn't boot completely to the demo launcher.
No other graphics application is able to run as well.

It seems the graphics driver "galcore.ko" doesn't load.
If the driver is loaded manually some missing symbols are reported:
{code}
galcore: Unknown symbol v7_dma_map_area (err 0)
galcore: Unknown symbol v7_dma_flush_range (err 0)
{code}

This looks like this: https://lists.yoctoproject.org/pipermail/meta-freescale/2015-August/015595.html

requirements.name: Provide a quick text filter to select IDE macro variables
requirements.text: It would be nice for QtCreator to provide a quick text filter in a lineedit, in the "variables" panel that is available in multiple text fields. \r\nFor instance, typing "comp" would only show variables with "comp" in their text (case insensitive).

requirements.name: QStringListModel comes from QtGui instead of QtCore
requirements.text: I see QStringListModel comes from the QtCore c++ library, but is exported from QtGui in the python bindings, can't the Python module reflect the lib ?

requirements.name: Passing TextFile service variable to JavascriptCommand in qbs crashes Qt Creator
[DataInput] Make editor side property control generic and enable multiple property control
requirements.text:
Currently Editor-side datainput functionality for binding a property to be controlled by datanode is limited to text element textstring. This is only due to code simplicity as this removes to need to get specific property handles for specific element types , not due to any design limitation in DataInput code.

Make binding generic i.e. allow setting "controlledproperty" property of any applicable element.

Also: make it possible to bind several properties in a single element to same, or different datainputs; 'controlledproperty="datainput1 propertyname1 datainput2 propertyname2 ..."'

requirements.name: very slow paint on mac retina
requirements.text: The attached program will show that painting is really slow, and this translates to an awful user experience for our customers when selecting and scrolling in our advanced custom interfaces.  If you right-click the app bundle "app.app" in macos Finder, click "Get Info", select "Open in Low Resolution", you will get good responsiveness with the ugly lowdpi.  The program has a macro to enable opengl to demonstrate an ideal experience, but our large codebase cannot just swap in opengl where qpainter is used due to other show stopper qt bugs (QTBUG-66717 QTBUG-67288).

requirements.name: [REG 5.7.0 -> 5.7.1] asset_catalogs.prf does not properly install files
requirements.text:
Leading whitespace in some file paths cause a corrupted Makefile which will not install the files properly.

This feature will initially appear in the 3 versions listed in the "affects versions" field and it's critical that it not be broken upon delivery.

Setting priority to P0 based on "tier 1 build issues". No workaround is possible.

requirements.name: [Reg 3.6->4.0-rc1] Import Existing Project doesn't filter files by type
requirements.text:
Here's how to reproduce the problem:

Go to File -> New File or Project ... -> Import Project -> Import Existing Project and follow the instructions until it comes to select files to be imported.

In Creator 3.6.1 files to be imported are filtered by default and this is what I see:

import-3.6png

In 4.0 RC1 the filtering no longer works and this is what I see:

import-4.0-RC.png

requirements.name: Specify runtime test case for rendering text with non-supported range
requirements.text:
See comment from Teemu Holappa in QSR-233:

Runtime tries to render text with the range that is not supported in the font file.

--> a new test case needs to be created for this use case.

Please add the test case into the QSR 1.1 Runtime test cases wiki page, under the following QSR 1.1 specific section:

https://intranet.qt.io/display/QTRD/QSR+Release+1.1+Runtime+Test+Cases#QSRRelease1.1RuntimeTestCases-RequirementQSR-257(safetyrequirement)

Test case id: R257_RT_2

Test condition: Requirement QSR-257

requirements.name: Wrong direction of QToolBar extension button icon when RTL interface used
Check that request has finished in desired order 3.0.2 installer
requirements.text:
1. API discovery finished
2. Precondition finished
3. Login finished
4. License download finished
5. Install validation finished 
6. Repository fetch finished

requirements.name: [REG 4.1->4.2] Array access is broken in dumpers
Add support for .ktx containers in the runtime
requirements.text:
Currently the code based on Qt 3D's original implementation provides support for .pkm and .dds containers. Add .ktx as well.

Long term (around or post-Qt 5.12?) all the compressed texture container parsing could likely be shared with Quick/Qt3D, once the implementations get moved to QtGui. For now we will live with separate implementations.

Note: the Qt Quick implementation of ktx support in 5.11 lacks support for mipmaps. This is not acceptable for 3D use cases and must be supported on our side. Therefore the code from Quick cannot be taken as-is.

requirements.name: Hitting QML breakpoint in .ui.qml file opens Design mode
requirements.text:
I added a mouse area in design mode, added a (ok, trivial) connection, set the break point on the onClicked in the .ui.qml file and went on debugging.

When the breakpoint was hit, the file was opened in Design mode, of course without any other indication of what happened.

This was also true after the .ui.qml was already visible in edit mode: It switched to Design mode again.

requirements.name: help viewer does not scroll to the right place
requirements.text:
Currently the scroll to functionality only seems to work when clicking links within a page. 
 Using F1 or double clicking an index entry (even repeatedly – which used to workaround this issue) just randomly jumps within the page. 
 This makes it incredibly frustrating to work with. 

This apparently concern the webengine based help viewer. 
 Mentioned in passing in QTCREATORBUG-17758
 referring to QTBUG-54172

I also see similar issues directly in chromium, that setting an anchor URL for the current page or refreshing an page with anchor doesn’t work for quite a while now. 

If the webengine bug isn’t fixed please consider disabling this backend by default or implementing a workaround.

requirements.name: R4.2 QSR: Single thread
QML Reformat - Comment after imports
R2.12 QSR: Maximum number of telltales
Text.NativeRendering on Linux/Freetype produces pixelated labels with non-integer QT_DEVICE_PIXEL_RATIO
requirements.text:
This is like QTBUG-42606, but for non-integer scale factors. It is reproducible in KDE Plasma by setting QT_DEVICE_PIXEL_RATIO via a systemwide scale factor (System Settings > Display & Monitor > Displays > Scale) and then viewing a piece of QML text that has `RenderType: Text.NativeRendering` set.

See the attachments, which are from QTBUG-42606. The same issue is visible, but for non-integer scale factors. With a scale factor or 1 or 2, all three lines of text look fine. With a non-integer scale factor, the middle puece of text looks blurry.

Switching to Text.QtRendering resolves the issue completely.

Failed open project after commit "Fix reparsing after switching build configurations"
requirements.text:
One of my projects stopped opening after the commit "QbsProjectManager: Fix reparsing after switching build configurations" / af62a9590c33dd9daec1bab49cc4a9494410aa62

When I open the project it freezes at the stage, see pict.1. Further no action occurs, no errors are displayed.
My project: https://github.com/hkarel/qTox
branch: qbs-build

Order reproduce the problem:
1. Create a session and open the project qTox
2. After configuring the build profile, a bunch of errors from Probe. But it is not important.
3. Close the QtC.
4. Run QtC and open session qTox.
5. We get the state on pict.1

The remaining projects open correctly.

requirements.name: Can't use Mapbox GL offline mapping
requirements.text:
**Platform: OSX**
**Mapbox SDK version: latest master branch, 5.1 beta...**

**Steps to trigger behavior**
Use: Qt SDK 5.9.2, 5.9.3,5.10
Or recompile the plugin using the latest branch
Compile the offline file
**Expected behavior**
Open and use the offline database
**Actual behavior**
Cached data are displayed, the offline one not.
Investigate the issue, I found this difference into the database (Top Cached information, bottom information retrieved by offline tool)
 !Screen Shot 2017-09-01 at 11.13.28.png!
I tried a lot until I found that difference. Using sqlite3 command line everything looks correctly, some standard database utility, the same. 
I hade by mistake the readonly version of a SQLite browser got from apple store ( [https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/sqlpro-for-sqlite-read-only/id635299994?mt=12] ) and found that information from SQLite is displayed different.
Looks like the Qt plugin is using the Qt SQLite library for inserting and reading data and the native MapBox is using is own method.

requirements.name: Add "Diff Against Current File" to file system view
[Reg: 5.8 -> 5.9 beta] LIBEGL_NAME variable name changed to LIBGLESV2_NAME
requirements.text:
The LIBEGL_NAME and LIBGLESV2_NAME variables have changed at 5.9.0 Beta which is a breaking backwards compatibility for software that looks for specific library names. 
This means that e.g. 3rd party SDKs depending on Qt will not be able to run against 5.9 Qt runtime libraries without a patch.

Prior to 5.9.0 Beta, LIBEGL_NAME=libEGL and LIBGLESV2_NAME=libGLESv2. 

Now at 5.9.0 Beta LIBEGL_NAME=QtANGLE and LIBGLESV2_NAME=QtANGLE.

requirements.name: Split Operators into two style categories
requirements.text:
*Background:*
 Qt Creator gives all C++ operator and punctuator tokens the same color. See cpphighlighter.cpp’s call to tk.isOperator().

*User story:*
 Having logical operators in a bright color makes long if-expressions a bit easier to read (as long as that bright color isn't used elsewhere because then the color looses its "bright" highlighting effect).

Many other editors, for instance Sublime, does not highlight {{() \{} [] ; ,}} as operators even tough they are C++ operator tokens in the strict sense.

*Solution:*
 Divide the C++ operator tokens into (two?) subcategories:

Arithmetic or logical operators: {{+ - * / & | ++ – < > <= >= == && || ?}} etc
 Enclosing or separating tokens: {{() \{} <> [] ; , : :: . ->}} etc

*Notes:*
 {{< >}} can both be used for comparisons and for templates so we will find them in both categories. Being able to color them differently allows users to "see" their semantics faster.

requirements.name: QQuickPaintedItem with FramebufferObject and HighDpiScaling does not scale properly
requirements.text: Having set {{setRenderTarget(Image)}} onto a {{QQuickPaintedItem}} results in having {{painter}}'s viewport in the {{QQuickPaintedItem::paint()}} pure virtual method as large as the content size, in pixels. It seems fine, as {{painter->device()->devicePixelRatio()}} returns 1. When I set render target to {{FramebufferObject}}, my item is painted in user-space pixels, meaning that my rendered image is scaled by the {{devicePixelRatio}}. As {{painter->device()->devicePixelRatio()}} still returns 1, I'd expect it to behave exactly the same as is does when rendering to image.\r\n{{QQuickPaintedItem::setTextureSize()}} does not help, as it always raises {{QOpenGLFramebufferObject: Framebuffer incomplete attachment.}} error.

requirements.name: Keyboard shortcuts for numeric keys on top row of French keyboard not handled correctly on Windows
requirements.text:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
1. Build and run the attached application on Windows.
2. Connect a French keyboard and switch to the French keyboard layout in the OS.
3. Observe that there are two menu entries, one with shortcut '6' and one with shortcut '-'.
4. Ensure the Application Output is visible in Qt Creator.
5. Press '-' on the French keyboard (which is unshifted).

EXPECTED: The shortcut for '-' is triggered.
ACTUAL: An ambiguous shortcut for '6' is reported in the app output.

I think this is caused by the fallback code in QWindowsKeyMapper::updatePossibleKeyCodes, which adds an unmodified key to the table using the virtual key from the event (in this case '6'), despite the fact that the OS has already correctly reported that the unmodified key is '&'. As a result, it will match against both '6' and '&' and will hence be ambiguous.

This is obviously a fairly serious problem for our French version as it renders any keyboard shortcuts using the top row of the keyboard unusable.

requirements.name: Custom user agent is not carried over when opening a new tab/page via HTML form button
requirements.text:
Very similar to QTBUG-48891 (which has been fixed): when opening a new page ({{ctrl+click}} or {{middle click}}) from HTML form button, the custom user agent of the source page is not kept. 

To reproduce this issue:
 * compile and run QtWebEngine demobrowser example,
 * setup a custom UA (Edit > Preferences > Advanced),
 * download and load the attached {{index.html}} in demobrowser,
 * ctrl+click on the link, the reported UA is correct,
 * ctrl+click on the button, the reported UA is wrong,
 * click (no new page) on the button, the UA is correct.

requirements.name: [Android] QQuickWindow::grabWindow() will return a black image
requirements.text:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Unpack & Run QTBUG-53083.tar.gz test application to reproduce the issue.
2. Black screenshot is shown with the devices suffering from this issue.

QQuickWindow::grabWindow() will return a black image on these devises:
* Samsung Galaxy Alpha: Android 5.0.2
* Samsung Galaxy Tab S:  Android 4.4.2
* Samsung Nexus 10: Android 5.0.2

Devices where QQuickWindow::grabWindow is working fine:
* Nexus 7 (Android 5.0.2)
* ASUS ZenPad 10 (Android 5.0.2)
* Samsung Tab SM-T560 (Android 4.4.4).

requirements.name: R2.8 QSR: Ensure telltales visibility
BlitFramebuffer broken on GLES
requirements.text: The BlitFramebuffer node uses glDrawBuffer. There is no such thing in OpenGL ES (3.0+). It should rather use glDrawBuffers.\r\n\r\n

requirements.name: qmake fails on macOS building for iOS when there's a space in a Qt Quick project path
requirements.text:
When creating a completely new Qt Quick application or Qt Quick Controls application with the project creation wizard, including an otherwise working ios kit, in a location that contains a space in the pathname (i.e. /Users/<username>/Documents/Project Code/<projectname>), qmake will fail and the run option will be greyed out.

Hitting "build" the first time will result in "Failed to parse qmlimportscanner output" and "[iphoneos-debug] Error 66", subsequent times result only in the 66. The same is true for [iphonesimulator-debug].

At the same time, compiling the exact same project for macOS or Android works fine. Also, putting the same project into a location without space in the path works fine and builds/runs for iOS.

This suggests the bug is not very recent, but of course might be unrelated: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26922104/error-failed-to-parse-qmlimportscanner-output/34638304#34638304

requirements.name: Using product id property vs context property in a base item has different values
Test VSP2 and V4L2 detection on incompatible devices
requirements.text: There is code in place to detect availability of V4L and VSP2 features, but they have not been tested on a non-compliant device, so whether they work as they should is an open question. They should be tested and if any changes are needed, these should be made.

requirements.name: Qt 5.6.0-beta package contains out-dated qml/1QtLocatoin/plugins.qml
requirements.text: Qt Location API has changed and the file still contains old property names which are no longer available. For example acceptedGestures is missing (old activeGestures).\r\n\r\n

requirements.name: Texture rendering issues in SceneLoader
requirements.text:
The first time dynamically changing source of SceneLoader to new scene (3d model), there is something wrong with rendering textures (of all or part of entities), they are black or gray (in another project sometimes colorful rubbish).

Changing source after that to something else, and then back to first model - everything is rendered as should. See video attached.

Example based on qgltf attached - there is two 3d models exchange each other as source for SceneLoader by timer.

It seemed that bug is only appear when there more than one object in a loaded scene. It can be seen in that texture of teeth of wolf model is rendered right for the first time.

I'm using almost the latest qt 5.7 commit: 50559ea3325c0215da155911836c0416d0027716

requirements.name: QWebengineview is black after suspend
requirements.text:
With an QWebengineview opened while suspend on Windows 7 64x, application got a black content after wakeup.

If we resize the windows, the black color staty, but we can see some element in background with the real view content.

If we connect the Chrome Developper Remote Debug console, there is no pb  to point elements but the forground stay black.

requirements.name: QWebEngineView crashes when clicking link openening a new window
requirements.text:
When instantiating a pure QWebEngineView and clicking on a link which opens a new window, e.g., the Facebook link on the bootom of qt.io, the application crashes.
Start of backtrace
{code}
#0  0xffffffff in QWebEnginePagePrivate::adoptNewWindow(QtWebEngineCore::WebContentsAdapter*, QtWebEngineCore::WebContentsAdapterClient::WindowOpenDisposition, bool, QRect const&) (this=0x8162970, newWebContents=newWebContents@entry=0xa66d6b0, disposition=disposition@entry=QtWebEngineCore::WebContentsAdapterClient::NewPopupDisposition, userGesture=userGesture@entry=true, initialGeometry=...)
    at /home/user/devel/qt5/qtwebengine/src/webenginewidgets/api/qwebenginepage.cpp:240
#1  0xffffffff in QtWebEngineCore::WebContentsDelegateQt::createWindow(content::WebContents*, WindowOpenDisposition, gfx::Rect const&, bool) (this=this@entry=0x81b68c8, new_contents=new_contents@entry=0x97e52b8, disposition=disposition@entry=NEW_POPUP, initial_pos=..., user_gesture=user_gesture@entry=true) at /home/user/devel/qt5/qtwebengine/src/core/web_contents_delegate_qt.cpp:347
{code}

This happens with a pretty new custom build. The qtwebengine version is cd1697f022063dafc59fb512b4a469fbe38729cc.

This can be reproduced for example with the test application from QTBUG-48969.

requirements.name: Precondition API: Email needs verification
requirements.text: Login fails due to error message "You need to verify your Qt account email address before continuing." using QtAccount <qtaccount> \r\n

requirements.name: QML MouseArea resumes dragging after external drag is finished.
requirements.text: I found this while investigating QTBUG-49876: when an external (inter-process) drag which was started from a QML MouseArea finishes, the MouseArea doesn't get the mouse release event and thinks that the drag is still active. The target item is being dragged around, even though no mouse buttons are pressed anylonger.\r\n\r\nI don't know why, but for some reason the QSimpleDrag::eventFilter() method is being called with the source object parameter set to the QShapedPixmapWindow, and forwarding the mouse release event to this window won't have any effect.

requirements.name: HTML Select controls open slowly / draws in wrong place
requirements.text:
ORIGINAL REPORT:
I'm building an application that makes extensive use of user input, including many select controls. In QWebView, select controls were very responsive. Under WebEngine, many things are vastly improved over QWebView, but opening select controls is strangely slow.

I found an example online that demonstrates the issue:
http://www.syntaxsuccess.com/angular-2-samples/#/demo/form

Additionally, in one of my QWebEngine views, I find that if I scroll down the page before clicking the select, the pop-up menu is not positioned correctly when it appears -- even showing up outside of Qt's window (!!). Screenshot attached. Scroll down the image and notice the menu -- floating in the middle of nowhere -- showing "Dan Berman" and "John Smith, MD". This is actually a result of clicking on the "Finalizing Study" pop-up menu much farther up the image.

This doesn't happen when the exact same web page is loaded into the QWebEngine view on the panel to the left of the same application. (I have 2 separate views.)

UPDATE:
See comments section for instructions on how to easily modify Qt's demobrowser example to demonstrate this issue in Qt 5.6.0 final. (Just add a QSplitter, and put the WebEngine view in the right side. Drag splitter left or right... HTML select will draw in wrong spot.)

requirements.name: OSX: QSystemTrayIcon menu doesn't appear
requirements.text:
Any use of context menu on a QSystemTrayIcon with Qt 5.8 beta or newer (old git clone of 5.8 doesn't have this issue) doesn't display any menu when clicking on the system tray icon on OS X 10.12.1 Sierra.

The system tray icon appears, but clicking it with left or right mouse button doesn't display the menu or the menu actions.

I tested with both Qt 5.8 branch from git and 5.8 beta. I didn't have this issue/bug with an earlier git clone of 5.8 branch (from a few months or so ago).

Since the systemtray demo/example doesn't put a context menu on the systemtray icon I've attached a small sample project that shows a QSystemTrayIcon with a menu. This works fine with Qt 5.7 (with patched qmake so it can build) and doesn't show the menu with Qt 5.8 bulit from git or 5.8.0 beta.

requirements.name: Files included by Qt.include() do not get passed to the engine's url interceptor
requirements.text:
JavaScript files loaded via QML import statements get passed through the QQmlEngine's URL interceptor (if one is set).

Files loaded through the Qt.include() functions do no.

See https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/127360 for an attempt to fix this.

requirements.text: The logic to look up the expected files assumes you're running the test in-source. We need to copy the expected results to the build dir, or otherwise make sure the files are referenced correctly. Same as with any other test data.

requirements.name: qmlproject ignores run environment
requirements.text:
1. Open examples/quick/demos/samegame/samegame.qmlproject from qtdeclarative in Qt Creator 

2. add the environment variable QSG_VISUALIZE=overdraw.

3. Start the application in normal mode. Notice that overdrawing doesn't happen.

4. Start the application in debug mode and notice that the overdraw variable does take effect and a 3d representation of the scene is overlaid on top of the application.

Environment variables should be passed to the application, no matter what run mode is chosen.

The same also happens with other environment variables, most notably LD_LIBRARY_PATH, which gives more severe problems, but is not as easily reproducible.

requirements.name: Android Debug on Pixel 2 not working
requirements.text:
Hello,

I'm working on a Qt app for Android. Debugging it in its current state on a Nexus 9 with Android 7.1 works fine. Debugging a Qt example on the Pixel 2 x86 simulator also works.

Debugging on the real device (Pixel 2 Android 8.0 Security Patch November 2017) does not work. The debugger seems to come up on the device but then the log is spammed with "Qt JAVA: DEBUGGER: Waiting for debug socket connect" until a timeout exception occurs. Very rarely (~1%) the debug start succeeds but 
 mainly it fails like explained. The last thing I can see in the log output is "Debug socket accepted", then the log is just spammed with the above mentioned message. I suspect the debug start gets stuck somewhere between lines 680-686 in QtActivityDelegate.java.

Any suggestions what I could do? Already tried turning off mixed debugging and other devices/emulators work as well. Seems to be limited to this particular device.

Regards

requirements.name: Forum footer too high
requirements.text:
I currently seem to get a ~50pixel high footer display on e.g. https://forum.qt.io/category/13/tools displaying some  x/y (x pages out of y) "progress".

For me this is useless information occuping more than 5% real screen estate on my laptop, making my occasional visits of the forum more difficult than it needs to be. The information how much of a page I already read is already accessible by looking at the normal scrollbar.

Please consider removing the bar again.

requirements.name: PSQL_LIBS= is ignored when specified in the configure command, but it is respected when defined as Environment variable before calling configure
requirements.text:
Configuring Qt for custom Postgres libs via PSQL_LIBS does not work when PSQL_LIBS=xx ist specified in the configure command:
configure.bat [...] -sql-psql -I C:\Path\to\libpq\include -L C:\Path\to\libpq\lib PSQL_LIBS=-llibpqdll

In contrast, It works if PSQL-LIBS is set as environment variable before configure is called:
set PSQL_LIBS=-llibpqdll
configure.bat [...] -sql-psql -I C:\Path\to\libpq\include -L C:\Path\to\libpq\lib

requirements.name: Investigate the performance overhead of the JS interpreter on the WASM VM
requirements.text:
h1. Objective

The port of QML to the WASM VM defaults to the use of QML byte code interpreter to run JavaScript binding expressions and code in .js files.

The port does not utilize a Just-in-time compiler. It is conceivable to generate a WASM module on the fly, but due to high frequency of function calls in and out of the JS VM, the extra overhead of function calls across WASM modules may not be worth it.

Instead the objective of this task is to investigate what overhead the QML byte code interpreter has when running in the WASM VM.
 * The QML interpreter uses a computed goto on the traditional target architectures to speed up jumping between different byte code instructions. This is supported when using clang and gcc.
 The WASM MVP specification does not support such a control flow and consequently the byte code interpreter for QML uses a traditional switch statement to direct between different byte code instruction implementations. This makes the interpreter running in the WASM VM slower than on other architectures.

 * The byte code instructions involve a step of decoding parameters. This applies to all target architectures.

h1. Prototype

A prototype was written to translate the byte code instructions directly to WASM expressions, to eliminate the cost of the old-style switch statement as well as the instruction decoding. In a straight-forward manner, the prototype compiles a .qml or .js file to a relocatable WASM module. Every JavaScript function or binding expressions is mapped to a WASM function, with a parameter structure suitable for the JavaScript virtual machine. The QML binary data structure is embedded as a data segment in the WASM module and along with the individual functions made visible to the LLD linker via a symbol table in the linking section. The byte code instructions in the function code are decoded and translated to WASM expressions and control flow structures.

Here is a simple example of how this translation can look like. Assuming the presence of a function local called $acc (i64) that represents the byte code VM's accumulator, $enginePtr for the address (i32) of the V4 engine and $jsStack (i32) for the address of the JavaScript stack, the "loadName" instruction that looks up a property in the activation and stores the result in the JS stack can be encoded as follows:
{code:java}
(set_local $acc
    (call $qv4runtime_method_loadName
        (get_local $enginePtr)
        (i32.const 5) // index in compilation unit's string table for the name
    )
)
(i64.store offset=16
    (get_local $jsStack)
    (get_local $acc)
)
{code}

As the above example also shows, function calls into the JS run-time can be resolved directly by the linker and require no extra indirection. 

h1. Results

The prototype work was developed to the point where a simple factorial calculation test-case could run and be used to measure the switch and decoding overhead. The following example was measured:
{code:java}
var d1 = +new Date

for (var x = 0; x < 1000000; ++x) {
    var res = 1;
    for (var i = 2; i <= 12; i=i+1)
        res = res * i;

    if (res != 479001600) {
        console.log("KO", res)
    }
}

var d2 = +new Date
console.log("done in", d2 - d1)
{code}
The generated code involves a large amount of calls into the JS runtime as well as reasonably complex control flow due to the loops as well as exception checking after run-time calls.

*The above example runs ~35% faster when compiled directly to WASM compared to the traditional byte code interpreter.*
h1. Implementation caveats

The prototype uses binaryen for the code generation as well as llvm's
 WASM back-end as well as WASM enabled lld to link the traditional Qt
 code together with the ahead-of-time generated WASM module. This imposes
 a requirement on a bleeding edge toolchain that even required
 modifications.

There are two possible ways of productizing this, if desired:
 * Pursue the path of relocatable WASM module generation by upstreaming
 changes to binaryen and emscripten as well as putting together an SDK
 with the latest set of tools for use with the Qt port.
 The downsides of this approach are the dependency to a toolchain and spec that is
 still in development as well as the work required to upstream
 changes to allow for embedding relocatable wasm objects in archives
 and "passing" them through to emscripten. The upside of this approach
 is that the code generator can be fully tested against the entire
 test suite of Ecmascript as well as QML through embedding of the
 binaryen interpreter. This was used for prototype development.

 * Replace the generation of WASM code with generation of C++ code.
 The downside of this approach is that it is harder to test the code
 generator for correctness. The upside is that it does not require any
 changes to the SDK or toolchain. The approach itself is also not
 validated yet with a prototype.

requirements.name: Qt build system ignores compiler flags
requirements.text: I can not pass compiler options to build system when compiling Qt. Neither environment variables CFLAGS/CXXFLAGS nor QMAKE_CXXFLAGS works. ./configure QMAKE_CXXFLAGS+=<blah-blah-blah> as suggested by the ./configure -help does not work either, but if I supply there an incorrect compiler flag, configure reports "ERROR: Cannot compile a minimal program. The toolchain or QMakeSpec is broken."\r\n\r\nThe only way I found to pass compiler flags is to edit a mkspec file.

requirements.name: Regression from 5.7.1: Race condition with texture updates
requirements.text: When changing the texture assigned to a material's Parameter, there is a race condition between the load texture job (executing on a threadpool thread) setting the dirty flag on the corresponding GLTexture object, and the OpenGL submission thread clearing the dirty flag when processing textures.\r\n\r\nPatch coming up to fix this.

requirements.name: Values of qint8 type are shown erroneously in "Locals and expressions"
requirements.text: Creator doesn't display qint8 variables' values correctly in the "Locals and expressions" view.  It does properly detect the type but presents the value as unsigned.\r\n\r\nThe screenshot is illustrating the issue (the last line is the relevant one).

requirements.name: QMLEngine is not compatible with QAbstractFileEngine on unix
[REG] Cannot attach QML profiler to waiting application started manually
requirements.text: When starting application from command line with parameters -qmljsdebugger=port:3768,block and then trying to connect QML profiler (Analyze -> QML Profiler (Attach to waiting application)) to it connection fails. With QtCreator 4.4.1 it does work so this is regression.

requirements.name: Chinese and Georgian label underline problem
requirements.text: When underlining Chinese or Georgian text the underline stops at space. The example to demonstrate will be attached.

requirements.name: QDBusTrayIcon does not support 2 QSystemTrayIcon
Filesystem view position not set on startup
requirements.text: When a previously used QtCreator session is opened, QtCreator opens the last open document in the editor. However, the filesystem view does not get positioned on the open file in the filesystem tree. Instead its position is the top of the filesystem tree. The "Synchronize with Editor" option is enabled and if I switch between open files the position gets updated as expected. It would be convenient if the filesystem view position was at the currently open file from the start (if "Synchronize with Editor" is enabled).\r\n

Add c++17

requirements.name: [REG] QMenu checks missing on Mac with stylesheet
requirements.text: The issue occurs when a simple stylesheet with background is set on QWidget. Checkmarks are only shown for the active item (not the other items - see screenshot and example)\r\n\r\nThis worked in 5.8.1 but not in 5.9.0

requirements.name: Add a virtual CAN bus plugin
requirements.text:
A virtual CAN plugin allows to send CAN frames from one app and receive them in another app with no CAN hardware involved.

While this is already possible with SocketCAN along with the SocketCAN plugin, this is limited to Linux.

A virtual plugin would allow to test under Windows or macOS also.

The virtual plugins could communicate over a local or internet socket (that would by the way show how to create a CAN-Ethernet gateway).

It has to be checked, if this new plugin could also replace the generic plugin which is used for the auto tests.

requirements.name: Preventing WebRTC IP leaks
requirements.text:
WebRTC can [leak|https://www.bestvpn.com/blog/31048/the-webrtc-vpn-bug-and-how-to-fix-it/] user's private IPs when they're using a proxy.

Chromium exposes a {{webRTCIPHandlingPolicy}} [property|https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/lkcr/chrome/common/extensions/api/privacy.json#40] to control that behavior via its extension API.

If this is also easily accessible via the content API somehow, it'd be great if it could be exposed via {{QWebEngineSettings}}.

Alternatively, a way to disable WebRTC completely at runtime would work too.

requirements.name: Add qt.pro.user to .gitignore in qt5 repository
requirements.text: When opening qt.pro in Qt Creator, a qt.pro.user file is created in the repository root. This should be added to .gitignore.

requirements.name: Deselecting objects in viewport
requirements.text: Allow users to deselect objects when clicking outside any object.\r\n\r\nCurrently if you have object selected, you can't deselect it by clicking to empty space, which causes lot's of pain, and accidentally moving objects.

requirements.name: Music Progress should use Progress Bar instead
requirements.text: As a developer, I should have Music Progress use Progress Bar from QtQuickControls 2 instead. Currently it is just done as a custom control in Music Application. That control should have a pre-defined style as other controls.

requirements.text: Check with Mike for the properties currently there. Do we need subclasses?\r\n\r\nDon't return const references.

requirements.name: stuck on »wait« cursor after any fragment link is selected
requirements.text:
see https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTCREATORBUG-17758?focusedCommentId=384918&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-384918

Clicking any help link with a fragment identifier, as well as F1 on anything but a class name results in an indefinitely lasting wait cursor. 

Fortunately the cursor can oftentimes be reset via navigation (or F1) to a non-fragment link.

requirements.name: Cmake integration is still having some blocking issues
requirements.text:
To start let's point QtCreator with clang integration is full of promises.
And when it works, it's really great.

I moved from Qt Creator 4.0.0 to 4.0.3 mainly because of bugs on CMake integration and clang performance / locking files issues.
Templates usage (like in ITK library) is also giving difficulties (freeze of UI while parsing code).

I have two different projects in the same session, they have dependencies. 
When rebuilding from scratch I have scripts to restore cmake environment from command line.
When I try to open the project afterwards Qt Creator cannot import existing environment correctly. Having Cmake automatically lauched on startup is not helping. It is prompting modified cmake files from outside but even if I accet the changes it's not completely taken into account.

Right now I ended with ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.

I would strongly suggest to let the user choose to user integrated cmake handling or not, to automatically launch cmake on triggers or not.

Actually I'm back on 4.0.0 as cmake integration is even worse on 4.0.3 from my point of view. I could not manage to make my projects compile again.
``` 

requirements.name: Clang-cl compiler feature detection causes QImage compile to fail
requirements.text:
It is not possible to use the QImage header with clang-cl and Qt 5.8.0.

{code}
$ type ..\rref.cpp

#include <QtGui/QImage>

int main()
{
        return 0;
}

$ C:\dev\src\llvm\build\releaseprefix\msbuild-bin\CL.exe -Ic:\path\to\Qt\5.8.0\include  -Xclang -fcxx-exceptions -Wno-microsoft-enum-value -fms-compatibility-version=19 ..\rref.cpp
rref.cpp
In file included from ..\rref.cpp:2:
In file included from c:\path\to\include\QtGui/QImage:1:
c:\path\to\QtGui/qimage.h(280,62):  error: rvalue reference to type 'QImage' cannot bind to lvalue of type 'QImage'
        { mirrored_inplace(horizontally, vertically); return qMove(*this); }
                                                             ^~~~~~~~~~~~
c:\path\to\QtCore/qcompilerdetection.h(1334,18):  note: expanded from macro 'qMove'
#define qMove(x) (x)
                 ^~~
In file included from ..\rref.cpp:2:
In file included from c:\path\to\QtGui/QImage:1:
c:\path\to\QtGui/qimage.h(284,40):  error: rvalue reference to type 'QImage' cannot bind to lvalue of type 'QImage'
        { rgbSwapped_inplace(); return qMove(*this); }
                                       ^~~~~~~~~~~~
c:\path\to\QtCore/qcompilerdetection.h(1334,18):  note: expanded from macro 'qMove'
#define qMove(x) (x)
                 ^~~
2 errors generated.

{code}

The problem is that `qMove` is not defined as `std::move` for clang-cl after "Windows: Disable unsupported C++11 features with Clang-cl and ICC" b5153d5bfab63da811b7a4615238d9e50198b412 https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/165502/ (see "Inplace versions of QImage rgbSwapped() and mirrored() for rvalue refs" b28764c641e4fef19d5e800b7537439fb2054914 https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/74636/ ). Reviewing that change now, I notice that the disabling of features is not versioned, and I don't understand why they are disabled. As far as I know, they should be enabled (note that with clang-cl you should probably always pass `-fms-compatibility-version=19`).

It is not clear to me where the `_HAS_RVALUE_REFERENCES` etc should be defined. Perhaps the user is to define them as a workaround for this kind of issue, so for now I will do that.
