>~"\n"
>~"bridgemessage={msg=\" File $C:/Qt/Tools/QtCreator/share/qtcreator/debugger/dumper.py$, line 2680, in putItem\n self.putItemX(value)\n\"},"
>~"\n"
>~"bridgemessage={msg=\" File $C:/Qt/Tools/QtCreator/share/qtcreator/debugger/dumper.py$, line 2702, in putItemX\n if self.tryPutPrettyItem(typeName, value):\n\"},"
>~"\n"
>~"bridgemessage={msg=\" File $C:/Qt/Tools/QtCreator/share/qtcreator/debugger/dumper.py$, line 1233, in tryPutPrettyItem\n dumper(self, value)\n\"},"
>~"\n"
>~"bridgemessage={msg=\" File $C:/Qt/Tools/QtCreator/share/qtcreator/debugger/qttypes.py$, line 825, in qdump__QList\n return qdumpHelper_QList(d, value, value.type[0])\n\"},"
>~"\n"
>~"bridgemessage={msg=\" File $C:/Qt/Tools/QtCreator/share/qtcreator/debugger/qttypes.py$, line 832, in qdumpHelper_QList\n (ref, alloc, begin, end) = d.split('IIII', base)\n\"},"
>~"\n"
>~"bridgemessage={msg=\" File $C:/Qt/Tools/QtCreator/share/qtcreator/debugger/dumper.py$, line 1713, in split\n return val.split(pattern)\n\"},"
>~"\n"
>~"bridgemessage={msg=\" File $C:/Qt/Tools/QtCreator/share/qtcreator/debugger/dumper.py$, line 3330, in split\n result = struct.unpack_from(self.dumper.packCode + pp, self.data(size))\n\"},"
>~"\n"
>~"bridgemessage={msg=\" File $C:/Qt/Tools/QtCreator/share/qtcreator/debugger/dumper.py$, line 3285, in data\n res = self.dumper.readRawMemory(self.laddress, size)\n\"},"

How can it be fixed? is it even possible?

requirements.name: Shiboken does not know how to wrap QMap<int, QList<QList<float>>> anymore
QTextCodec should be able to be implemented in a user made plugin
requirements.text: Currently Qt manages the lifetime of QTextCodecs, according to the documentation. If user wants to implement his own codec and that implementation is located in a plugin, when the application is shutting down and plugin is unloaded before the codecs are deleted, it causes a crash.\r\n\r\nUnloading the plugin could count as a deleting the QTextCodec by user which is against the documentation, but there are cases where the main application's code should not be bloated with plugin specific code that the QTextCodec could be. Maybe there could be a way to unregister the specific codecs?

# Build > Run Without Deployment, or click the run button in application output pane

requirements.name: SpinBox: when range is changed the buttons won't get enabled/disabled accordingly
requirements.text:
If the SpinBox value is in the end of the range and the range is increased the respective button won't get enabled. Similarly, when the range is decreased and the value is the new to/from value, then the respective button is not disabled (clicking it has no effect though).

See the attached example. When the SpinBox value is 0 and after -100...100 range button is clicked, the down indicator is not enabled (as it should). Similarly when the range is -100...100 and the value is 0, then when you press 0...100 range button, the down indicator isn't disabled.

The up/down indicators can be enabled/disabled manually, but in this use case they should work automatically.

Tested on Windows 7 & 10.

requirements.name: jetson-tx1: Wrong JPEG library version: library is 62, caller expects 80
Change build button to cancel build button while building
requirements.text: When you click build run or debug buttons (bottom left corner) the bulid progress indicator pops up in the (bottom right corner). it would be better if the indicator is not far away from the button that started it. I thing early versions of qt creator had indicator replace the build button, so that you can build and cancel on the same place, no need to search across the screen where is the indicator. On big screen that indicator is really far away.

requirements.name: QBoundingVolumeSpecifier API
requirements.text: Turn it into a simple property on QGeometry

requirements.name: Qt Designer: Crash when using `Morph into` with buddy property set
requirements.text:
`Morph into` crashes QtCreator when object to be morphed has QLabel buddy.

 

Steps to reproduce:
 # Create new .ui file. -> File -> New file or project

requirements.name: TypeError when static library depends on static library
requirements.text:
The attached test project has the following structure:

Project
 * App [CPP Application] (depends on Shared / Base)
 * Shared [CPP StaticLibrary] (depends on Base)
 * Base [CPP StaticLibrary]

 

Building the project results in the following error:

{{/usr/share/qbs/modules/cpp/GenericGCC.qbs:382: error: TypeError: Result of expression 'inputs["obj"]' [undefined] is not an object.}}

 

When removing the line:

{{Depends \{ name: "Base" }}}

from the Shared.qbs file outside the Export section, the project builds. Syntax highlighting within Shared, however, is then broken.

requirements.name: Clean up test suites
requirements.text: There are some tests which are skipped. Investigate these tests and assess whether they are still valid.

requirements.name: typo in qalsaaudioinput.cpp
requirements.text:
There is a typo at line 315 of file qalsaaudioinput.cpp.

One must change « QAudio::AudioOutput » for « QAudio::AudioInput ».

I'll push a patch for review referring to this bug ASAP.

Typo was introduced by patch 5473621bde2be226f2f3687a80b4bfc93bbbe572.

requirements.name: QDB integrations no longer include RHEL 7.2
requirements.text:
src/modules.py line 1290 says: StaticHostOnlyQMakeModule('qt-apps/qdb', [(OS.Linux, OSVersion.RHEL_7_2), (OS.Windows, OSVersion.Windows_10)]),

Previously it led to QDB being built on RHEL 7.2 and Windows 10.

But for example [http://10.212.3.36:8080/coin/integration/qt-apps/qdb/tasks/1518085864] only includes Windows.

It should still include RHEL as well.

requirements.name: Regression: QCocoaBackingStore detaches and copies on paint.
requirements.text: Regression from 5.9.\r\n\r\nSet a breakpoint or add a qDebug() in QImage::copy(). Run attached program which repaints on mouse over. On 5.10 this will break or print in the QImage copy function. Resizing the window works as expected, with no copy.

requirements.name: ComboBox text errors after modifications of underlying list model
requirements.text:
When using the ComboBox with a list model (for instance a QAbstractListModel) then modifications of the underlying model do not correctly reflect in the combo box. Modifications can be append, remove, and also renaming of elements (see example code).

Problems: 
- When removing the selected element then the text does not update.
- When removing an element then there is some wired drawing of the first element (it looks like the deleted element's text is drawn as well).
- When renaming a selected element then the text is not updated.

requirements.name: Android: wrong intent package name
requirements.text: In Android the wrong package name is set for the service intent. The correct one is: serviceIntent.setPackage("com.android.vending");

requirements.name: Add Squish msvc14 (x86) installation to win7 x86
requirements.text: squish-6.3.0-qt59x-win32-msvc14.exe needs to be installed on win7 x86 to C:\\utils\\squish\\msvc14.\r\n\r\nBranches 5.9, 5.10 and 5.11

requirements.name: WinRT/Desktop: QToolTip issues
requirements.text:
Creating a ToolTip does not show the text. Latest after closing the tooltip test applications crash.

It seems that close() does not actually remove the tooltip-window from the stack, even though it doesn't show anything, which then causes focus handling to become invalid and cause crashes.

This can be reproduced with 
qt5\qtbase\examples\widgets\widgets\charactermap\
qt5\qtbase\examples\widgets\widgets\tooltips\

requirements.name: Linux Copy-on-Write file cloning support
requirements.text:
Commit [db0064b7|https://github.com/qt/qtbase/commit/db0064b767474a89bc72ea4374f477682983c5f4] has brought CoW file cloning for APFS on Darwin. Linux starting from 4.5 has file systems, that support CoW file cloning, too (btrfs, for example) using [FICLONE ioctl|http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/ioctl_ficlonerange.2.html].
It would be very easy to add this capability into qfilesystemengine_unix.cpp.

I could help with this issue, but I am not very familiar with gerrit.

Qml TextField is covered by system keyboard
requirements.text: On iOS and Android the whole Qml screen is moved upwards so that text input fields are visible when the system keyboard pops up. On Windows Phone this does not happen and text fields are eventually covered.

requirements.name: [REG 5.7.1 -> 5.8.0] QProcess::startDetached starts cmd.exe without window
[REG]: Memory leak in video player on Android
requirements.text:
In Android video player there is QAndroidTextureVideoOutput class that renders java MediaPlayer output to GL texture. As a backend it uses Android's SurfaceTexture.

On android SDK version >= 16 java SurfaceTexture's attachToGLContext method is used for texture initialization.

When changing player source, QAndroidTextureVideoOutput::reset() method is called, that calls QAndroidTextureVideoOutput::clearSurfaceTexture(), where current GL texture is silently reset without actual deletion (http://code.qt.io/cgit/qt/qtmultimedia.git/tree/src/plugins/android/src/common/qandroidvideooutput.cpp?id=ba8127639857232d8a37e953c5cda84203360d97#n255). This causes out of memory error in android's hardware video decoder when continuously playing two or more videos by changing player's source.

Seems like SurfaceTexture's destruction does not cause texture deletion when it is used with attachToGLContext method, so, ether detachFromGLContext should be used, or texture id should not be reset.

requirements.name: Unable to disable back face culling in QML
requirements.text:
There is no way to disable the default back face culling in QML.

One way to solve this could be by adding CullFace.None enum. If "CullFace { mode: CullFace.None }" is added to the RenderPass.renderStates list it could override any already set CullFace objects.

This is preferable to the alternative solution of allowing an empty RenderPass.renderStates list to disable face culling. Currently, setting renderStates to an empty list does nothing, which I believe is fine. In the case of a RenderPass being inherited from another, it would be unfortunate that the user would have to replicate the contents of this list, except for the CullFace object, to achieve the wanted behavior.

requirements.name: Qt 3D fails to initialize on Raspberry Pi 3
requirements.text:
Qt 3D doesn't get past initializing stage when run in Raspberry Pi 3. Instead the following error comes:

QEGLPlatformContext: eglMakeCurrent failed: 3009
Qt3D.Renderer.Backend: bool Qt3DRender::Render::GraphicsContext::makeCurrent(QSurface*) makeCurrent failed
Failed to make OpenGL context current on surface

Steps to reproduce:
Compile and run Qt 3D: Simple C++ Example on Raspberry pi 3
-> The output starts printing the error mentioned above

requirements.name: QML crashes when value of property becomes NaN
requirements.text:
Our application displays data send by backend that we do not control.

We have encountered a crash when the data contains a specific value that should be interpreted as NaN. I have created a small example that demonstrates the issue.

On Qt 5.6.2 (used in production) the output is:
{noformat}
returning:  42
qml: changing
returning:  nan
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
{noformat}

On Qt 5.9.3 the output is:
{noformat}
returning:  42
qml: changing
returning:  nan
file:///.../qmldoublecrash/Test.qml:11:28: Unable to assign QJSValue to double
{noformat}

Both behaviors are not acceptable, because the value change cannot be processed in QML.

Please provide fixes for both 5.6 and 5.9.

requirements.name: Licensing documentation simplification and cross linking
requirements.text:
Qt Licensing documentation has been structured into several separate document which seems to cause confusion for users doing a license compliance analysis.

Also in some occasions users land into e.g. http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/3rdparty.html document which is only part of the picture and doesn't even have a link to the main licensing page (http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/licensing.html).

In the long run we need to evaluate the whole licensing documentation structure but as an immediate step we should modify the 3rd party licensing document first paragraph:

"Qt includes a number of third-party libraries that are used to provide certain features. Unlike the code described in the code used in Qt document, these libraries are supplied alongside the Qt modules. For overview of Qt Licensing and list of all 3rd party code in Qt please refer to Qt Licensing [http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/licensing.html]"

Link to the Chromium project (http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qtwebenginewidgets-index.html#license-information) licensing information is also missing from the 3rd party document.

Webkit is no longer part of official Qt releases so it should be removed from (http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/3rdparty.html#webcore-webkit) and table in (http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/licensing.html

After adding a breakpoint with a custom condition, an extra breakpoint is added when debugging starts
requirements.text:
As demonstrated in the attached video, an extra breakpoint is created, and it gets hit once before my actual breakpoint gets hit.

Debugger log:

{noformat}
453show version
454show debug-file-directory

requirements.name: Rotation and multiline text in chart axis
requirements.text: The axis in a qtchart don't allow to change the rotatión of the labels. Also in a QDateTimeAxis it's so common to find charts with multiline labels. For example time\\ndate 10:00:00\\n22/03/2017

requirements.name: Generated texture do not update automatically with OnDemand render policy
requirements.text:
I generate textures using Qt3DRender::QTextureImageDataGenerator. These textures can be changed interactively by manipulating some widgets. But the scene is not updated automatically, I have to click in the 3D window and maybe rotate the scene before the texture is updated.

I have attached a small example that demonstrates the problem.

Is there a workaround for forcing a few frames to be rendered until the texture is updated?

requirements.name: QQmlComponent can no longer load local, relative URLs
QGraphicsEffects in High dpi mode with clipped children
requirements.text:
Using QGraphicsEffects with high dpi mode can lead to a wrong clip being used.

The two attached example projects both set Qt::AA_EnableHighDpiScaling, add a QGraphisEffect on a parent widget that has a clipped child widget.

The first test case is the minimal test case, reduced to only what is necessary.

In the second test case is a bit bigger, since it uses a QScrollArea.

In the first test case, the parent widget has a height of 400px, and button is placed at y = 300 px with height 200px. Thus the top 100px of the button should be visible and the bottom 100px of the button should be clipped away by the parent.

A yellow QGraphicsDropShadow effect is applied to the parent widget.

The attached screenshot shows how this test case looks with:
(From left to right)
1) No high dpi scaling + no graphics effect
2) No high dpi scaling + graphics effect
3) High dpi scaling + no graphics effect
4) High dpi scaling + graphics efect

I've upload a patch for this issue to codereview: https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/177407/ 

That patch also fixes https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-55698, and thus I've assigned this bug to you, too.

requirements.name: Update Qt 5.10.0 Alpha content to Boot2Qt 5.10
requirements.text: Update meta-boot2qt (pyro) & meta-qt5 (5.10) with 5.10 Alpha content.

requirements.name: Offline installer hangs for a long time (OS X)
requirements.text:
Installing version 5.6 hangs up (qt-enterprise-mac-x64-android-ios-5.6.0.dmg) on mac mini in directory /opt/Qt5.6.0/. Several times tried, but the installer freezes every time at a different step. The process remained at 100% CPU for more then 2 hours. 7th attempt was successful.
 
- The machine has enought free space (> 500GB free)
- 5.5 installed successfully on the first try
- We selected the default component selection

requirements.name: Qt InApp Purchasing SDK should expose the NSError in errorString
requirements.text: {{SKPaymentTransaction}} has an {{error}} property returning an {{NSError}} with a description of the error. This is much more precise than the hardcoded "Unknown error" and the like Qt has hardcoded in {{QMacInAppPurchaseTransaction}}, so it should use that if available.

requirements.name: Document clearly required OpenGL ES (and OpenGL) versions Qt 3D Studio supports
requirements.text: Create a new document "supported target HW operating systems and HW requirements" that documents clearly what OpenGL and OpenGL ES versions we have tested to work and what TARGET operating systems we support in 1.0.

requirements.name: components removed without reason
requirements.text:
Some of the automotive components are removed by maintenance tool seemingly without a valid reason.

Steps to reproduce.

  Qt Automotive Suite

      Components

2. Start maintenance tool, and install some other new components

3. Some of the automotive components are selected for uninstallation

{code:java}
Components about to be removed.

automotive.10.sources.neptuneui 
automotive.10.sources.multiscreendemo 
qt.qt5.5100.qtvirtualkeyboard.gcc_64 
automotive.10.sources.qtwebbrowser 
qt.qt5.5100.qtwebengine 
qt.qt5.5100.gcc_64 
automotive.10.sources 
Selected components without dependencies:

Components that have resolved dependencies:

requirements.name: Enable 64 bit QEMU tests in COIN
Crash in RenderStateNode when material is deleted and recreated
requirements.text:
The crash can be reproduced with attached program, which creates and deletes a sphere in a timer loop. The material is owned by the sphere entity, so it also gets deleted. The attached application needs to be in examples folder of qt3d to work, as it is a modified example.

The end cause for the crash is the null RenderStateNodes inside the collection parameter given to addToRenderStateSet(). RenderStateCollection::removeRenderState() is never called for destroyed materials, so the states for deleted nodes are retained.

Qt3D SHA: faf56f50608f9391d2a73ed7c61bfdd9c2afab78

Same crash can be also seen in scene editor e.g. when resetting the scene (File/New). Scene editor SHA: 8342887bba58cf3e43d70441ba5435c3a76e9aca

The call stack:
{code}
1	Qt3DRender::Render::RenderStateNode::impl	renderstatenode_p.h	69	0x7fee9fc2c5a	
2	Qt3DRender::Render::addToRenderStateSet	renderviewjobutils.cpp	400	0x7feea17e1e2	
3	Qt3DRender::Render::RenderView::buildDrawRenderCommands	renderview.cpp	574	0x7feea033605	
4	Qt3DRender::Render::RenderView::buildRenderCommands	renderview.cpp	535	0x7feea0332fc	
5	Qt3DRender::Render::RenderViewJob::run	renderviewjob.cpp	137	0x7feea17ca4a	
6	Qt3DCore::AspectTaskRunnable::run	task.cpp	91	0x7feec2b5785	
7	QThreadPoolThread::run	qthreadpool.cpp	99	0x66b8eaeb	
8	QThreadPrivate::start	qthread_win.cpp	393	0x66b97ab8	
9	_callthreadstartex	threadex.c	376	0x7feead8a105	
10	_threadstartex	threadex.c	359	0x7feead8a357	
11	BaseThreadInitThunk	kernel32		0x76f559bd	
12	RtlUserThreadStart	ntdll		0x7718a2e1	
{code}

requirements.name: CMake: server mode doesn't handle cmake errors
requirements.text:
Qt Creator 4.3 when run with CMake 3.7.2 using server mode is not handling CMake errors.

Given the following CMake project:
{code:java}
project(oh-my!)

cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.2)

message(FATAL_ERROR "This message should popup in the issues list!")
{code}
The line with *message* should have an error icon next to it and in the Issues list there should be the text *This message should popup in the issues list!*

Qt Creator 4.3 with CMake 3.5 does handle the CMake errors as expected.

Screenshots here: [http://imgur.com/a/yYlei|http://imgur.com/a/yYlei] (for some reason attaching screenshots to this ticket results in "JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again.")

requirements.name: A string of multiple ampersands treated unexpectedly by menubar/menu on macOS
requirements.text:
On macOS: If the text of a QAction contains multiple ampersands in a row only the first ampersand is removed as the text appears in the main menu. This behavior differs from how Windows handles ampersand in the same situation. On windows every other ampersand is removed. This is also how other widgets that utilize QActions and shortcuts, such as tabs, buttons etc., handle a string of multiple ampersands.

For example, this is how a string containing six ampersands in a row is handled:

Shortcut-utilizing widgets generally: &&&&&& -> &&&
QMenuBar/QMenu on Windows: &&&&&& -> &&&
QMenubar/QMenu on macOS: &&&&&& -> &&&&&

Steps to reproduce:
- Run the sample attached
- Click on the 'Test Menu' in the menu bar
- Look at the menu item revealed and compare the ampersand handling across the different widgets. (See the image attached)
EXPECTED: The menu item reads "One & , two && , three &&& , four , &&&& stop"
ACTUAL: The menu item reads "One & , two &&& , three &&&&& , four , &&&&&&& stop"

requirements.name: Windows: QGuiApplication::setOverrideCursor does not work properly in QML application
requirements.text:
I have a quite complex QML application where I need to change the application cursor shape. 
 Because of the complexity, I do not have the possibility to handle the cursor shape by using only MouseAreas.

I tried to find a solution by checking the Qt documentation but it seems that there is no way to do it directly in QML. 
 Anyway I read that it is possible to use setOverrideCursor() and restoreOverrideCursor() QGuiApplication methods.
 I tried to use them in my application but I found two problems happening after calling setOverrideCursor():

1) When I move the mouse cursor over a QML MouseArea that changes the cursor shape when it is hovered on, the cursor shape does not change.
 This is annoying especially in case of resize handles, but it is not blocking like problem #2.

2) When I move the mouse cursor outside the Window and come back inside it, the override cursor shape is not restored.

In the attached example call setOverrideCursor() by clicking on the upper button. 
 After that, try to move the cursor on the red rectangle and notice that Qt.SizeHorCursor is not shown (problem #1). 
 Now try to move cursor outside the window, move back inside it and notice the override cursor is not restored (problem #2).

requirements.name: QRectF::operator==() and QPointF::operator==() disagree for sufficiently high x/y coordinates
requirements.text:
QRectF::operator==() uses qFuzzyCompare(), while QPointF::operator==() uses qFuzzyIsNull(), but the two methods yield different comparison results for sufficiently high floating point values (but as low as 200.0, see attached test program)

This creates interesting situations where 
{code:java}
rect1 == rect2 && rect1.topLeft() != rect2.topLeft(){code}
 :)

 

See attached test program, which shows exactly where things start breaking (at least on a machine with sizeof(qreal)==sizeof(double)).

 

I would have provided a change request with a fix to switch QPointF::operator==() to use qFuzzyCompare, but I'm not 100% sure this is the right fix. Maybe qFuzzyIsNull() itself needs to be fixed instead, or something else. So I'm opening this issue first for feedback on the preferred fix, then I'll be happy to provide a change request with the fix if needed.

requirements.name: Take image loading into our own hands
requirements.text:
Revise how we create textures from image files.

The entire asynchronous smartness makes little sense in practice considering the typical 3D Studio use cases. (Qt Quick app starts up, shows a splash screen via Quick (could even animate with Animators since we have the Quick render thread), then kicks of Studio3D by setting the source, this can block as much as it wants)

Therefore, to avoid the mess described in QTBUG-65775, load stuff on our own synchronously and provide the data via custom image data generators.

This also allows to expose additional valuable data (is the underlying image data shared? how much time did we spend on image I/O?).

Eventually extend it to generating mipmaps for lightmaps. There loading the data ourselves is required anyway since we need to inspect and further process the actual image data (for .hdr images at least) before letting it go to Qt3D.

requirements.name: Generate qbs module files from Export items
requirements.text:
Random thoughts:
    - The target artifact(s) should (by default) be listed in the generated module. Users must be able to opt out (e.g. via a file tag filter). There should be reasonable defaults for well-known product types (e.g. do not export dynamiclibrary_symbols, but do export dynamiclibrary_import).
    - Most properties set in an Export item should be pulled into the module with the literal value, but some of them should not: In particular, expressions in top-level properties which refer to "product" (i.e. the exporting product) need to be evaluated. It may or may not be necessary to make that configurable per property. Simple approach: If users want their value to go into the module evaluated, then they need to make it a product property and refer to it via the product variable in the Export item. Good enough?
    - The user needs to be able to opt out of certain properties and/or dependencies (example: internal modules that are only needed for the properties to appear on the right-hand side of expressions). It remains to be seen how flexible we want to make this: E.g. should the user be able to see and transform the entire AST?
    - Imports: We can scan for the use of built-in services such as qbs.TextFile, and add the respective imports to the generated module automatically. What about user-provided JS imports? Should we try to be super-smart and auto-deploy them, or even unfold the functions in them? It probably suffices to let the user be responsible for that, at least for the first implementation.

requirements.name: [REG Qt 4 -> Qt 5] It's not possible to use a keyboard shortcut in a Qt app that coincides with a 'dead' key on the current keyboard layout, even outside of a text input context (OS X)
requirements.text:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
1. Build and run the attached application on the Mac.
2. Ensure the 'Application Output' tab is visible in Qt Creator.
3. Open the 'Menu' menu and observe there are two shortcuts registered.
4. Press Alt-W.

EXPECTED: The command runs and outputs "QKeySequence("Alt+W")".
ACTUAL: As expected.

5. Press Alt-E.

EXPECTED: The command runs and outputs "QKeySequence("Alt+E")".
ACTUAL: Nothing happens.

The same thing happens for any 'dead' key, that is a key that gives a combining character during text input. I could understand that these keys may be unavailable for use as shortcuts if there is a text input context active, such as a QLineEdit, but surely if there is no active text input, they should work as normal shortcuts? This seems to be the behaviour in other Mac applications; I tried creating an Alt-E shortcut in Xcode, for example, and it worked fine, even with the caret in the text editor.

This is a major problem in our application as it greatly limits the available keyboard shortcuts, particularly with non-English keyboard layouts.

requirements.name: Plugins in QtWayland do not set PLUGIN_CLASS_NAME

requirements.name: Complete documentation Control QML Type
QTextEdit takes longer and longer to draw text
requirements.text:
I am using a {{QTextEdit}}, and I update the text with a call to sethtml(Qstring);

the text is a simple tables that changes every second. Initially the {{setHtml}} method is fast (0 ms); but after time (depending on rate) it takes longer for {{setHTML}} to return.

I am calling sethtml at 1Hz rate. After 12 hours it takes over 350 ms to call sethtml

This increase continues the longer the program runs.

 

{{I created a simple test program that show this }}[my test project|https://github.com/jmussemann/qtDrawIssue]; at 100 hz the problem  shows in about 5-10 minutes. at 10 hz it takes a 30-60 minutes, and at 1 hz 10 hours or so.

I want my application to run for days, I this is causing a major issue.

I did not have this issue while running Qt 4.8.7

requirements.name: Qt Quick Table View: can’t scroll to the bottom right of the content
requirements.text: On the new {{TableView}} QML component, it is not possible to reach the bottom right corner of the content. Instead, we are blocked before, as if we had already reached the bottom right corner.\r\n\r\nIt appears that the {{contentWidth}} and {{contentHeight}} properties are not computed properly: on my sample project, they both should be set to {{25000}} (500 cells that are 50 pixels wide) but they are set to about {{24002}} instead.

requirements.name: Combination of QTextStream and QFile doesn't save the file contents
requirements.text:
- With https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/164371/ applied:
- Launch examples/mainwindows/application/application.py
- Write something in the textarea
- Invoke save action, choose a name, and save the file
- Try to open with another text editor the file, and see that it is empty.

Opening an existing file with existing content (using the example), and saving it, will also clear the content of the file.

I've seen another example which used QFile.save() explicitly, and it worked properly.

But it seems that a combination of QFile and QTextStream, does not work.

requirements.name: Qt Quick Designer does not work with embedded kits
requirements.text:
When trying to edit the ui.qml files from this example:

[http://code.qt.io/cgit/qt/qtdoc.git/tree/doc/src/snippets/qtcluster?h=dev]

and when using a different embedded kit (for example Toradex Apalis iMX6), editing doesn't work because QML dependencies to QtGraphicalEffects cannot be resolved.
The actual QML files are actually deployed in the sysroots however.

Happens both on Windows and Linux.

requirements.name: WebEngine should print an error and exit cleanly if not initialized
requirements.text:
See QTBUG-51945 for previous details.

Using WebEngineView without prior calling `QtWebEngine::initialize()` always causes a segmentation fault.

This should probably be detected, and the application should print an appropriate error and terminate cleanly, without a segfault.

This also affects the bundled `qml` utility — anyone who tries to open the WebEngineView example from the docs with it will see a segfault atm.

WebView is very similar in this aspect (it also has an ::initialize() method that should be called), so it also may need a patch.

requirements.name: QtWebEngine fails to build with Vulkan SDK installed
requirements.text:
The Gn generator generates include_dirs like this: http://code.qt.io/cgit/qt/qtwebengine.git/tree/mkspecs/features/gn_generator.prf?h=dev#n177

Starting with Qt 5.10, INCLUDEPATH can also contain things like $(VULKAN_SDK)/include which means the value of the VULKAN_SDK environment variable is picked up and substituted at some point by qmake.

In case of the Gn generator script, this does not happen whe evaluating $$path, resulting in for example this:

{code}
  include_dirs += [
    "C:/work/qtwebengine/src/core",
    "C:/work/qtwebengine/src/core/api",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtQuick",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtGui",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtWebChannel",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtQml",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtNetwork",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtCore",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtQuick/5.10.0",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtQuick/5.10.0/QtQuick",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtGui/5.10.0",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtGui/5.10.0/QtGui",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtQml/5.10.0",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtQml/5.10.0/QtQml",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtCore/5.10.0",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtCore/5.10.0/QtCore",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtWebEngineCore",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtWebEngineCore/5.10.0",
    "C:/work/qtbase/include/QtWebEngineCore/5.10.0/QtWebEngineCore",
    "C:/work/qtwebengine/src/core/Debug_x64/.moc/debug",
    "$(VULKAN_SDK)\include",
    "$(VULKAN_SDK)\include",
    rebase_path("$target_gen_dir/.moc/")
  ]
{code}

This means QtWebEngine will not build on any Windows system that has the Vulkan SDK installed.

We are in the process of changing some CI configs to include the Vulkan SDK for dev (5.10), but this cannot go through until qtwebengine fails to build. See https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/197990/ and QTQAINFRA-1186.

I tried to get the variable substitution to work but failed miserably. Something like 

{code}
for (path, INCLUDEPATH): message($$path)
{code}

works as expected, but

{code}
for (path, INCLUDEPATH): GN_CONTENTS += "    \"$$path\","
{code}

does not.

Note: this has nothing to do with the actual Vulkan support of Chromium. We do not care about that at this point.

requirements.name: Fix tests so that they work in all screen sizes and resolutions.
requirements.text: Some tests in B2Qt RTA test suite don't work well when screen size and resolution are radically different. The biggest culprit is the way Squish accesses elements: on occasion, Squish can't find the elements and instead taps on a specific location specified in pixels. This leads to different results when the screen resolution is changed. This shuld be fixed so that tests always refer to elements by their name and not by their pixel offset.

requirements.name: Temp save functionality for viewer
requirements.text:
Studio should create a temp save when launching the viewer, instead of overwriting the original file.

If user plays around in the project, and watches the changes in viewer, studio currently overwrites original .uip file without telling it to the user.

requirements.name: Add timeline shortcuts
Crash when app changes screen while scene graph updating
requirements.text:
Have an application which uses NodeInstanciator to create number of entities, which may change at run time

On macOS, clicking the fullscreen (in new space) window icon causes a crash in Entity::sceneChangeEvent (type is PropertyValueAdded, crashes when calling inherits on the metaObject).

Dragging from one screen to another doesn't seem to affect it.
Unplugging a screen sometimes causes the crash.

Might be related to the QPA needing a new surface while all the other things are being updated?

Tested on 5.7.1 and 5.8.0  (pre-release)

requirements.name: ComboBox text errors after modifications of underlying list model
requirements.text:
When using the ComboBox with a list model (for instance a QAbstractListModel) then modifications of the underlying model do not correctly reflect in the combo box. Modifications can be append, remove, and also renaming of elements (see example code).

Problems: 
- When removing the selected element then the text does not update.
- When removing an element then there is some wired drawing of the first element (it looks like the deleted element's text is drawn as well).
- When renaming a selected element then the text is not updated.

requirements.name: moduleloader.cpp:1976 ASSERT: found
requirements.text:
Qbs fails with assert in a given project configuration.

In attachment you can find a simplified version of my real project showing the problem.

Please note that filenames matter, probably because different sorting makes the algorithm taking different paths. I've kept the original starting letter for all qbs files in order to reproduce the issue in the simplified version.

requirements.name: Boot2Qt 5.9.1 Release
requirements.text: Qt for Device Creation / Boot2Qt 5.9.0 Release

requirements.name: Wrong example.pro file installed in Examples/Qt-5.x
requirements.text: Ever since examples was installed as 'flat' structure, the installed top level examples.pro file belongs to the component that got installed last (which is different in each installation).\r\n\r\nOne could assume that the examples.pro (in /Examples/Qt-5.x/) would build all examples in Examples/Qt-5.x/, but now it will build only the examples belonging to the component which examples were installed last (examples.pro will get overwritten during installation every time a new examples are installed). If there is no need to have top level examples.pro, the file should be removed.

requirements.name: Boot2Qt 5.9.0 Beta 3 content integration & updates
requirements.text: - Qt 5.9.0 Beta 3 content updated to meta-qt5 layer\r\n- Morty branches of Yocto meta-layers updated as necessary to fix build and image creation errors & to get possible security fixes  etc.\r\n- Build & image creation errors fixed (meta-boot2qt layer updates)

requirements.name: [DOC] documentation should mention, that QLoggingCategory is thread safe
requirements.text: QLoggingCategory is using internally QLoggingRegistry and that is using mutexes for thread safety, [http://code.qt.io/cgit/qt/qtbase.git/tree/src/corelib/io/qloggingregistry.cpp] , so the documentation should mention, that it is thread safe.

requirements.name: Add QNX 6.6 configurations for Qt 5.10.1
WebView fails to load OAuth Pages with Qt5.9.3
Use http to download artifacts, source archives and provisioning scripts
requirements.text:
By using a standard protocol for downloading we reduce complexity in the
agent, have the option of switching to https/http2 at some point, reduce
the load of the storage.py process and get the option of resuming
downloads (not implemented yet on the client side).
 
It also opens up the possibility of using a HTTP proxy on the compute
node side to improve locality of artifacts.

requirements.name: Repository API: Check the insallation content
requirements.text: The installation content should be exactly the same as using 'old' insaller

requirements.name: Run button disabled, executables not set (FreeBSD 10.3/11-current only)
requirements.text:
https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/146769/7//ALL

introduced a change that leads to the following error on starting the program (pressing run): 

SOFT ASSERT: "runConfiguration->runnable().is<StandardRunnable>()" in file ../../../../qt-creator/src/plugins/projectexplorer/localapplicationruncontrol.cpp, line 58

together with an empty messagebox displayed using a black cross on a red dot.

On pressing the debug-run button, the debug session can't be started because of a missing excecutable.

Commit 4ea8caccf24451ab70db3bc4aa5ee36859e41684
is the last known working version.

The problem appears on FreeBSD systems using clang as compiler (10.3: clang-3.4, 11-current: clang-3.8), it does NOT appear on FreeBSD 9.3 which used gcc 48.

requirements.name: Editor split scrolls to end of file when inserting one line in another split
requirements.text:
# Open a source file.
 # Move the cursor to the middle of the file.
 # Press Ctrl+E,2 to split the editor.
 # Press Ctrl+Home to jump to the beginning of the file.
 # Press Enter to insert a new line.
 In the moment this line is inserted in the one split, the other split scrolls to the end of the file.
 # Press Ctrl+E,0 to close the current split.
 # Press an error key to move the cursor.
 The editor scrolls back to the middle of the file because the cursor stayed there all the time.

An editor split should not move when doing anything in another split. An editor split should not scroll to a location other than the cursor's position (unless the user requested it).

requirements.name: QCameraImageCapture isn't working without QCameraViewfinder
requirements.text:
I try capture image from camera with QCamera and QCameraImageCapture.
On Linux and Windows its works correctly (without QCameraViewfinder) but on OS X it's required QCameraViewfinder for capturing images from camera.

If you want I can attach example but its very simple to reproduce bug.

requirements.name: iOS support demands iOS 9.x capabilities preventing builds for older 8.x devices
Clean up unnecessary 'Packaging' flag from configurations where we don't deliver binaries
requirements.text: We shouldn't have 'Packaging' flag in any build from which we aren't delivering binaries.

requirements.name: qt-enterprise-linux-x64-5.6.0-rc_326: Cross-module documentation links are broken
requirements.text:
-All- Many of the cross-module links in the packaged documentation seem to be broken.

In practice, what this means is that qdoc does not have access to the .index files for other modules when building the docs. For example, when building Qt Core docs, the Qt Reference Documentation (qtdoc repo) docs (and others) should already have been built in prepare mode (make prepare_docs), as that generates the index file.

In the attached image (Qt Quick landing page), two links are broken: Dialogs (Qt Quick Dialogs module) and 'QML Applications' (Qt Doc) are broken.

This issue cannot be reproduced when building the documentation locally using 'make docs' on the top-level qt5 repository.

requirements.name: Links in "Qt XXX Reference Documentation" switch versions
requirements.text:
When navigating to another help page that is located in another qch file, only the latest version is opened. Instead, it should use the corresponding version.

How to reproduce

* Install e.g. Qt 5.6.2, Qt 5.8.0 in online installer.
* Open Qt Creator > Help, navigate to "Qt 5.6.2 Reference Documentation > Classes"
* Click on QAbstractAnimation

The target for the link is "qthelp://org.qt-project.qtdoc.562/qtcore/qabstractanimation.html" . Still, when opened it shows up as "Qt 5.8.0 Reference Documentation".

This is arguably unexpected. While we should aim that the latest documentation is also valid for older ones, this is confusing.

requirements.name: QFuture<T>::result() dumps core if QtConcurrent::run() uses current thread and functor throws an exception
Unexplained, mysterious purple region in editor
requirements.text: There's a purple region in the editor. Whatever this feature is, it's not discoverable, since I have no idea what I've done to cause it. More importantly, I don't know how to remove it: if I edit inside the region, it gets extended.

requirements.name: Mixed C++/QML debugging is broken on Android
requirements.text:
There are several issues with it:
1. When starting a debugging session the "start" button in the debugger toolbar goes into the "continue" state (|>). It should rather enter the "pause" state (||),
2. When pressing the button, the application stops and QtCreator complains:
{code}
Application process could not be stopped:
Remote connection closed
{code}
3. The QML object structure is not shown in the locals and expressions view. The l&e view seems to remain in the "C++" state.

It seems we don't connect to the QML debug server, either because that is not started or because the connection fails.

requirements.name: Add Candlestick chart to Qt Charts module
Subtract layer blend mode not functional
requirements.text:
Open a scene with 2 layers and change the Blend Mode for one of them to Add and then Subtract. There is apparently no difference which cannot be right.

Running the viewer through RenderDoc shows that it uses a blend equation of Add which is likely wrong (should be ReverseSubtract, which is what Qt3DSRendererImplLayerRenderData.cpp sets, not sure what happens afterwards.

Screenshots below: Runtime 1.0 Add, 1.0 Subtract (looks same as Add...), Runtime 2.0 Add, 2.0 Subtract

 !image-2017-12-08-12-05-59-425.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2017-12-08-12-06-23-078.png|thumbnail!

requirements.name: Add a "Git branches" side panel
requirements.text:
The Git branches dialog is nice, but often comes in my way when I need to move commits around, resolve merge conflicts, compile again, etc. It is in fact the dialog I have open most of the time working in Creator.

Given that we now also have a right side panel, it would be nice to have this function integrated there.

Maybe there could be an option "dock" and "undock" to switch between the two implementations, so the needs of all users are satisfied.

requirements.text:
Detected by qmlbench on TX1.

The creation benchmark for allocating a large JavaScript array of qobjects has regressed about 18% since Qt 5.6 to Qt 5.9: [Graph|https://testresults.qt.io/grafana/dashboard/db/qmlbench-branches?var-suite=All&var-benchmark=delegates_qobject_large_array.qml&var-branch=5.9&var-branch=5.6&var-hardwareId=eskil_linux_tx1&from=1494843858447&to=1495448668559]

requirements.name: Qt Quick Local Storage:  (JS) null (passed as bound parameter) to executeSql() converts to empty string instead of NULL
requirements.text:
When calling executeSql() which includes arguments marked with ?, passing null to that argument converts to empty string instead of being NULL in database.

Steps to reproduce:
- Run attached sample
- EXPECTED: Two entries are created in database, with second string being NULL for both entries
- ACTUAL: Two entries are created, with second string of first entry being empty string

When using any KDE QtWebEngine app, on Linux with the window manager KWin-Wayland, a crash occurs quickly after startup due to "stack smashing."

requirements.name: Compiler and Debugger paths of a QBSP package are misconfigured
unsigned char * shown incorrectly in locals and expressions
[Regression] fitViewportToMapItems() fails to scale and position map correctly
requirements.text:
Using the following QML the fitViewportToMapItems() method fails to correctly scale the map to show only the present map items. Testing with Qt 5.7.1 shows that this functionality used to work correctly, so this appears to be a regression.

Test code:

[^main.qml]

 

Expected result (from Qt 5.7.1):

!qt-fit-to-map-test-5.7.1.png!

 

Actual result (in Qt 5.9.0 and Qt 5.9.1):

!image-2017-09-08-13-13-42-266.png!

 

The map actually starts at zoomLevel 10, so the fitViewportToMapItems() method is actively zooming out to an incorrect level (rather than just having no effect at all).

I tested with both MapPolylines and MapQuickItems both giving the same results.

Adding a MouseArea and calling fitViewportToMapItems() when clicked results in very inconsistent behaviour, with it sometimes fitting correctly to the path, sometimes zooming all the way out as seen when called on component completion and sometimes only displaying part of the path.

 

Thanks!

Mike

requirements.name: QPainterPath::addPolygon(): forces a re-allocation on every call
requirements.text:
Hello,

We noticed that using nice convenience methods to build up {{QPainterPath}} takes an unproportionally long time when the number of shapes grows, making them practically unusable for drawing some complex paths. Going back to basic {{QPainterPath::lineTo()}} and {{QPainterPath::moveTo()}} fixes the issue.

According to the source [1], the issue is likely that code forces the underlying vector to allocate exact number of elements as it would be after the addition of a shape, and that destroys the vector's exponential re-allocation strategy.

The similar issue is likely present also for {{QPainterPath::addRegion()}}, {{QPainterPath::addEllipse()}}, {{QPainterPath::addRect()}} and {{QPainterPath::addRegion()}}.

A test case is attached for {{QPainterPath::addPolygon()}}. On Linux, executing {{run.sh}} prints the following:
{code:java}
./run.sh 
 + cmake .
 - Configuring done
 - Generating done
 - Build files have been written to: [...]
 + make
 [ 25%] Automatic moc for target aexe
 [ 25%] Built target aexe_automoc
 [100%] Built target aexe
 + echo '--- built-in ---'
 — built-in —
 + ./aexe builtin 5000
real 0m0,260s
 user 0m0,068s
 sys 0m0,188s
 + ./aexe builtin 10000
real 0m1,001s
 user 0m0,236s
 sys 0m0,764s
 + ./aexe builtin 20000
real 0m4,395s
 user 0m1,196s
 sys 0m3,196s
 + echo '--- workaround ---'
 — workaround —
 + ./aexe workaround 5000
real 0m0,006s
 user 0m0,008s
 sys 0m0,000s
 + ./aexe workaround 10000
real 0m0,007s
 user 0m0,000s
 sys 0m0,004s
 + ./aexe workaround 20000
real 0m0,010s
 user 0m0,004s
 sys 0m0,004s
 + ./aexe workaround 10000000
real 0m3,072s
 user 0m2,268s
 sys 0m0,800s
{code}
We can see that, when adding thousands of polygons using the built-in method, the time grows quadractically. It makes a dramatic difference when adding many polygons to a single {{QPainterPath}} - adding 10 million polygons is faster using the workaround than adding 20 thousand polygons using the built-in method.

 [1]https://code.qt.io/cgit/qt/qtbase.git/tree/src/gui/painting/qpainterpath.cpp#n1074

requirements.name: qbs warnings are not linked
requirements.text:
Open qtcreator-super.qbs in Creator.
In General Messages view you can see lots of warnings:
"WARNING: qbs.getEnv is deprecated and will be removed in Qbs 1.6. Use Environment.getEnv instead."
These are plain text and not linked to the lines causing them.

The warnings should appear in Creator's "Issues" view and show their respective code line when being clicked.

2) drag one of them somewhere inside the list so that small black bar does not appear

WIN64: 'too few arguments in function call ... return Callback<TDelegateInterface>' errors for builds using ICC
requirements.text:
Hello, everyone,

 

For builds using Windows ICC got errors:
{code:java}

requirements.name: WebP: animations don't respect alpha
QComboBox doesn't change the item by using mouse wheel
requirements.text:
I used Qt4 in my application for a long time. In Qt4 QComboBox has a great feature that facilitates work with it:
when my mouse pointer enters some combobox (become focused on it) I can change combobox item by using mouse wheel.
After switching to Qt5.6 I noticed that this feature is broken down on MAC OS.
And when I try to change combobox item by mouse wheel this has no effect.
It can be easily reproduced on any Qt example on window with QComboBox.
NOTE: On Linux and Windows this feature is still working .

requirements.name: [REG 3.6->4.0] Watches are severely broken
multiple linking of qt libs
requirements.text:
Let's assume I have product App, that depends on LibA.
LibA depends on LibB and LibC.
LibB depends on LibD.
LibC depends on LibD.

And all these libraries depend on different Qt submodules.

QBS correctly handle multiple including of LibD. But if you will look to linker string it will contain 6 libQt5Core.a, 4 libQt5Network.a and so on.

This looks like not big problem, but for my project (which includes dozens of libraries with multiple cross-dependencies) it makes linker string too long and hit "g++.exe: error: CreateProcess: No such file or directory"

requirements.name: Regression issue regarding QTabBar: tab icons are not properly rendered anymore
requirements.text:
Using Qt 5.6.x LTS, a QTabBar object properly renders the icon associated with a given tab. However, using Qt 5.9.x LTS, the icon is not rendered in the right place anymore and may, in fact, even overlap with the tab title itself (if that one is too long).

Attached is a small project that illustrates the issue, as well as a couple of screenshots when building the project with Qt 5.6.2 LTS and Qt 5.9.1 LTS, respectively.

Note that the close button also disappears using Qt 5.9.x LTS, but this is already being addressed in QTBUG-61092.

Broken customization
Qt Quick Controls 2 Gallery Example gives error: "icon" does not have members (M17)
requirements.text:
When running the Qt Quick Controls 2 Gallery Example, line 92 and line 114 of gallery.qml give error: "icon" does not have members (M17), and forbids me from using design mode with a dialog saying:"Cannot open this QML document because of an error in the QML file" etc.

But the example application compiles and works fine, seems it's just Qt Creator's problem.

I searched internet and found a relative post:

[https://forum.qt.io/topic/87118/syntax-to-assign-multiple-icon-properties]

The OP said using "group notation" instead of "dot notation" and there was no error anymore, but it didn't work for me. I have another simple application using "group notation" but still get the error.

In Qt 5.6.2 the pdb files for ActiveQt are no longer build.

The makefile generated has changed a bit in this regard between these versions, for example:
5.6.1: /FdC:\qt\qt5.6.1test\qtbase\lib\Qt5AxBased.pdb
5.6.2: /Fd.obj\debug\Qt5AxBased.vc.pdb

The make install does not copy this .vc.pdb file over to install directory, and the 5.6.2 prebuilt binaries do not contain the pdb files anymore.

requirements.name: Document how to build and use Windows toolchain with yocto
requirements.text:
Documentation doesn't have instructions how to use yocto to build a Windows toolchain.

To build Windows version of meta-toolchain-b2qt-embedded-qt5-sdk toolchain, you need to use extra environment variable SDKMACHINE=i686-mingw32.
The resulting .7z file in tmp/deploy/sdk/ contains the toolchain, which then can be extracted in Windows.

Manual patch after extracting to toolchain on Windows:
qt.conf file used by qmake in Windows yocto SDK needs to be patched when the toolchain is manually built.

By default, qt.conf has paths that point to the default (linux) installation path (/opt/b2qt/x.x.x/), which need to be changed to point to the actual location in Windows using forward slash as path separator (C:/Qt/Boot2Qt/device/toolchain/)

requirements.name: gstrip does corrupt ELF
requirements.text:
This is an old error of the gstrip binutils. The bug has been corrected and re-introduced.

The command *elfdump -d xxx* on the ELF does bring lines like those :
.SUNW_syminfo: invalid sh_info: 0

We need to move from gstrip to strip for the solaris mkspecs.

requirements.name: Does scene/master slide change need to be notifiable?
requirements.text: Probably not. Once set, the master slide and scene ptrs are not expected to change during the lifetime of the Q3DSUipPresentation.\r\n

requirements.name: WebUI: Add filter search box to filter the configurations
requirements.text: Filter search box with would make it faster to pre-select configurations.

requirements.name: Qt5.7 RC: VKB binaries installed to not supported target msvc2013 winphone_x86
requirements.text:
qt-enterprise-windows-x86-winrt-msvc2013-5.7.0-rc_454.exe
qt-opensource-windows-x86-winrt-msvc2013-5.7.0-rc_456.exe

According to wikipage (https://intranet.qt.io/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1278849) VKB is not supported on winrt/winphone targets, bu they are installed to msvc2013 winphone_x86.

requirements.name: BTLE MTU not reset between connections
requirements.text:
I have an Qt application which acts as an BLE peripheral/server and I noticed issues which seem to be related to MTU handling in Qt. The scenario I have looks like this:
 * Client A connects and sends an Exchange MTU Request which increases ATT_MTU from the default.
 ** Client A reads/writes some data.
 ** Client A disconnects.
 * Client B connects.
 ** Client B performs a service discovery.
 ** Service discovery reaches a point where an attribute list of length 8 (frame length 67 bytes) is sent even if nu MTU exchange has been performed with Client B
 * Communication seem to stop.

I have tried applying a simple patch (see below) which seemingly fixes the issue. While I have only tested with 5.7.1, I haven't found any changes in the code in this area for newer versions which indicate that the same problem probably exists in newer Qt versions as well.
{code:java}
diff --git a/src/bluetooth/qlowenergycontroller_bluez.cpp b/src/bluetooth/qlowenergycontroller_bluez.cpp
index e85fcb34..7634334c 100644
--- a/src/bluetooth/qlowenergycontroller_bluez.cpp
+++ b/src/bluetooth/qlowenergycontroller_bluez.cpp
@@ -535,6 +535,7 @@ void QLowEnergyControllerPrivate::resetController()
     requestPending = false;
     encryptionChangePending = false;
     receivedMtuExchangeRequest = false;
+    mtuSize = ATT_DEFAULT_LE_MTU;
     securityLevelValue = -1;
     connectionHandle = 0;
 }
{code}
For reference I initially reported the issue to the BlueZ mailing list as I thought that BlueZ was being used for this functionality (see thread at [https://www.spinics.net/lists/linux-bluetooth/msg73968.html]).

I have tested on three different Linux kernels and I +don't+ encounter the issue on an +older+ kernel (3.13). On this older kernel it seems BlueZ is handling MTU exchange instead of Qt. I would be interested in understanding what decides if Qt or BlueZ handles connections.

Below is a btmon log which show the problem:
{code:java}

requirements.name: Pressing backspace key in html input box will delete front character
requirements.text:
When i pressing backspace key to delete uncompleted character of HTML input box, it will delete front character under Chinese and Japanese IME.  it's work fine on chromium and not compatible with others browsers.  

How to reproduce as attachment image:
1. run demo browser and open https://login.qt.io/login
2. typing 'a' into input box, then just typing 'b' and do not pressing others keys.
3. pressing backspace to delete uncompleted character, it's ok but it still has remaining placeholder in input box.  it will delete front character 'a' when i pressing backspace again.

I guess that should once delete uncompleted character and placeholder of HTML input box. The best way is keeping pace with chromium browsers.

requirements.name: Android ARM hardloat was removed
requirements.text:
HardFloatAbi was removed in r12 (it seems it was never used), therefore QBS should removed it too.

Check https://github.com/android-ndk/ndk/blob/master/docs/HardFloatAbi.md for more info on this matter

requirements.name: Bare 'Ctrl' / 'Command' keypresses are swapped
Creating reverse animations must be easier
requirements.text:
As a designer I want to be able to design an animation between two UI states once and then use that animation for both state change direction. This means that the editor should support creating these type of animations.

Some ideas how this could be done:
* Allow artist to create a "slide clip" or "referenced slide" that only refers to another slides content and modifies the playback in some way (e.g. slow down to 50%, reverse direction etc.). This is similar to how digital audio workstations abstract an actual audio file on the disk as audio clip that you see in the editing timeline. One audio file can be referenced by multiple audio clips in the editor and different clips can refer to different time stamps of the file and have different directions for playback.
* Add to slide properties an option to play a slide in reverse.
* Allow doing this with duplicate slide and then have Edit-Reverse Timeline function.

requirements.name: shiboken2 executable does not start on Linux 5.11.0 official packages
Provide a way to disable automatic CMake invokation
requirements.text:
With QtCreator 4.0 beta1, QtCreator automatically invokes CMake to re-generate makefiles whenever I edit one of CMakeLists.txt in my project. This can be inconvenient because if I need to edit multiple CMakeLists.txt files, QtCreator invokes CMake after each modification. When the changes are supposed to be synchronized, these attempts to re-generate makefiles are often unsuccessful.

Furthermore, whenever CMake is invoked the lower panel with its output is opened, which is inconvenient as I have to close it every time.

In my workflow I usually edit one or multiple CMakeLists.txt and maybe some code and then build the project. Makefiles are automatically re-generated as part of the build process and that is the most convenient way for me.

requirements.name: Support native MapCircle items in Mapbox GL plugin
requirements.text:
Qt QML [MapCircle radius|http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qml-qtlocation-mapcircle.html#radius-prop] property is measured in meters, while Mapbox GL's equivalent [circle layer radius|https://www.mapbox.com/mapbox-gl-js/style-spec/#paint-circle-radius] property is measured in pixels.

An [open issue|https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-gl-native/issues/2167] in Mapbox GL native discusses this parity issue, not only with Qt but also other vendors.

Currently we can workaround it by either rendering the circle as a polygon, or update each and every circle radius upon every zoom change, applying a conversion between projected meters and viewport pixels.

requirements.name: WheelEvents get set with a pixelDelta even when using a physical mouse wheel under new libinput
requirements.text:
Scrolling has two modes, moving by n pixels or by n "ticks" normally for trackpads and traditional scroll wheels respectively.

In QWheelEvent terms:
 - pixelDelta and angleDelta

A libinput change has meant that Qt's detection of "is it a scroll wheel or not" is broken. 

If I put debug in QXcbConnection::xi2HandleScrollEvent I can see my scrollingDevice.verticalIncrement is 15 .

We then go into the

              // We do not set "pixel" delta if it is only measured in ticks.
                    if (scrollingDevice.horizontalIncrement > 1)
                        rawDelta.setX(delta);

This matches what I see in xinput list which shows:
    Class originated from: 11. Type: XIScrollClass
                Scroll info for Valuator 2
                  type: 2 (horizontal)
                  increment: 15.000000
                  flags: 0x0

So QXcbConnection has the "right" value, but now that check doesn't work. I think libinput seems to trying to artificially say how far things should scroll at an input level rather than it being up to the application.

Though this is the root cause of the breakage, it is only a minor problem except in one place. 

In QtQuickControls QtQuickWheelArea as we now have valid pixelDelta we go into a different code path that ignores the user scrollspeed. It then also randomly divides things by 2 to match some OS X trackpad behaviour. See comment on the static pixelDeltaAdjustment. 

Instead of the scroll moving content at the correct rate of 60px (15x user set scrollSpeed) per tick, we only move 7.5 (15/2) pixels. This leads to very slow scrolling with bug reports downstream (KDE) and in some cases text corruption as it's not pixel aligned anymore.

To see the bug in action run ListPage.qml in QtQuickControls example with a proper mouse wheel.

requirements.name: Support XDG Shell stable in the wayland platform plugin
requirements.text:
A stable version of xdg shell has now been released.

https://cgit.freedesktop.org/wayland/wayland-protocols/plain/stable/xdg-shell/xdg-shell.xml

It's not very different from xdg-shell unstable v6, but it's not backwards compatible, so we need to create another shell extension for it.

It may have some naming conflicts with xdg-shell unstable v5, due to how qwaylandscanner works, but at least the global interface name is different ("xdg_wm_base"), so it's possible to know which version(s) a compositor provides.

requirements.name: Assigning Keyboard Shortcut to "Collapse All" doesn't work

It looks like it _should_ work, but doesn't in practice. I have tried a number of different key combinations, but to no avail.

 

(Where I work, we have a a large source tree with many branches, and expanding and collapsing contributes a significant part of my working day.

Being able to Collapse everything in Project Explorer via the keyboard would be very welcome functionality indeed.)

 

Thank You.

requirements.name: ClangStaticAnalyzer: Fails with Clang toolchain due to wrong/mulitiple instrinsics path
requirements.text:
# Set up a Kit with a clang exectuable as toolchain
# Set up a clang executable for the ClangStaticAnalyzer that is different from step 1
# Open ${QTCREATOR_SOURCE}/src/plugins/clangstaticanalyzer/unit-tests/stdc++11-includes/stdc++11-includes.pro with the Kit from the step before
# Run the analyzer

The very first error is:

{noformat}
In file included from /home/nik/dev/creator/creator-4.2/src/plugins/clangstaticanalyzer/unit-tests/stdc++11-includes/main.cpp:3:
In file included from /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5.4.0/../../../../include/c++/5.4.0/algorithm:62:
In file included from /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5.4.0/../../../../include/c++/5.4.0/bits/stl_algo.h:66:
In file included from /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5.4.0/../../../../include/c++/5.4.0/random:50:
In file included from /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5.4.0/../../../../include/x86_64-linux-gnu/c++/5.4.0/bits/opt_random.h:33:
In file included from /usr/lib/llvm-3.8/bin/../lib/clang/3.8.0/include/x86intrin.h:29:
In file included from /usr/lib/llvm-3.8/bin/../lib/clang/3.8.0/include/immintrin.h:29:
/usr/lib/llvm-3.8/bin/../lib/clang/3.8.0/include/xmmintrin.h:646:3: error: use of undeclared identifier '__builtin_ia32_storeups'
  __builtin_ia32_storeups(__p, __a);
  ^
{noformat}

This is due to the following include paths that are used:

{noformat}
#include "..." search starts here:
#include <...> search starts here:
 /home/nik/work/csaTestSessionProjects/stdc++11-includes
 /home/nik/work/csaTestSessionProjects/build-stdc++11-includes-Qt_5_6_1_gcc_64_with_Clang_x86_64bit_in_usr_bin-Debug
 /home/nik/usr/qt-5.6.1-1/5.6/gcc_64/mkspecs/linux-clang
 /usr/lib/llvm-3.8/bin/../lib/clang/3.8.0/include
 /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5.4.0/../../../../include/c++/5.4.0
 /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5.4.0/../../../../include/x86_64-linux-gnu/c++/5.4.0
 /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5.4.0/../../../../include/c++/5.4.0/backward
 /usr/local/include
 /home/nik/dev/llvm/3.9/installs/gcc54_rtti/bin/../lib/clang/3.9.1/include
 /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu
 /usr/include
End of search list.
{noformat}

Note that there are two include paths to the intrinsics - path /usr/lib/llvm-3.8/bin/../lib/clang/3.8.0/include and /home/nik/dev/llvm/3.9/installs/gcc54_rtti/bin/../lib/clang/3.9.1/include.

The first one comes from the toolchain, the second one from the clang static analyzer executable. The clang static analyzer executable is confronted with the instrinsics include path to another clang version.

There should be only one include path to instrinsics. It should be the one from the clang static analyzer executable.

When a texture is sub-sample - hen fewer pixels are displayed than are present in the origina - ou may see undesirable artifacts based on which pixels are chosen.

requirements.name: Cannot load styles on iOS

requirements.name: Create bindings for QUrlQuery in Qt 5
New Qt5 signal/slot syntax not working with Intel Compiler 16
requirements.text:
The new style signal/slots seem to be broken i.c.w. the intel 16 compiler.

The issue can be observed in a.o the widgets examples shipped with qt. For example, running {{examples/widgets/mainwindows/dockwidgets}} results in the following messages:

{noformat}
QObject::connect: signal not found in QAction
QObject::connect: signal not found in QAction
QObject::connect: signal not found in QAction
QObject::connect: signal not found in QAction
QObject::connect: signal not found in QAction
QObject::connect: signal not found in QAction
QObject::connect: signal not found in QAction
QObject::connect: signal not found in QListWidget
QObject::connect: signal not found in QListWidget
{noformat}

Qt was configured as follows:
{noformat}
configure -platform linux-icc -commercial -confirm-license -c++std c++98 \
          -skip qtquickcontrols2 -skip qt3d -skip qtwayland \
          -skip qtserialbus -qt-xcb -no-pch -no-dbus
{noformat}

Issues [QTBUG-48286|https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-48286] and [QTBUG-40281|https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-40281] look related.

After some investigation, I rebuilt Qt and added the {{-no-reduce-relocations}} configuration flag. This seems to workaround the issue. Apparently, the {{-Bsymbolic}} and/or {{-Bsymbolic_functions}} flags are not added when the {{-no-reduce-relocations}} configure flag is specified.

It's not clear to me if this is a compiler issue or not. If it is, it would still be nice if the Qt configure process opts for the {{-no-reduce-relocations}} option by default for broken compilers.

requirements.name: Combine b2qt flasherscript and automotive flasherscript
ar MRI scripts with Link time optimization breaks Qt build
requirements.text:
As a developer, i want to build a mingw windows cross-compiled Qt version with the same build configuration as i use for my Linux build. I use as much optimized build settings as possible, with at least as possible enabled dependencies. This is the reason why i use the Qt configure -ltcg flag to enable link time optimization.

Using the gcc 7.1.1 and no cross-compilation builds fine. Using the mingw and cross-compilation does break the build, because of missing symbols in pcre2. Details are shown in the attached build log.

*Update:*

rename ticket "Mingw Link time optimization breaks Qt build" to "ar MRI scripts with link time optimization breaks Qt build"

As explained by Martin Schulze, the problem affects a broader range. Everyone who wants to build Qt with:
 * (current) compiler stack producing slim lto objects
 * using a make spec where qmake generates mri scripts for ar (e.g. based on QMAKE_LINK_OBJECT_MAX)

We think it should be reevaluated if this ticket is out of scope of the Qt build system. We think that at least the Linux to Windows cross compilation should generate the same ar calls as the native Linux compilation does.

requirements.name: Add Control::focusPolicy property
requirements.text: We had 'activeFocusOnPress' in controls 1. That was a mistake, because on touch platforms nothing should take active focus on press, but on release instead. In controls 2, we could call it 'focusPolicy' instead.

requirements.name: Repaint issue
requirements.text:
I am running Linux Mint 18.01 x64 in Parallels 12 on Mac Sierra.
I noticed that only Qt Creator has problem with occasional repaints
All other linux apps are working correct. 
This is best reproduced after opening Qt Creator maximized. Then open file manager in front and try to move it around. This does not happens right away from me. After few hours editing in Qt I noticed this becomes more and more visible. Moving some window does not repaint Qt creator in back. Sometimes it does repaint when I stop moving sometimes does not. It varies. Please see attache screen shot.

Did try changing to various compositors. It happens on all of them and only to Qt Creator app

requirements.name: Python 3.6 Support
requirements.text: I was curious if the PySide 2 project was looking into support for Python 3.6. I see it currently only supports up to 3.5 which means it should be relatively compatible. I also tried building everything and running it in a Python 3.6 environment and everything seemed to work correctly. Is this safe to include in the supported versions list?

requirements.name: print dialog cups "advanced tab" missing in qt5/kf5 based applications
requirements.text:
We're currently running 10 desktops with kde in our business.

We've been planning to switch from kde4 to kf5/plasma with the now released kubuntu 16.04 lts. A test-run did bring up an unexpected "printing issue" though. The "advanced tab" seems to be missing from the print dialog in kf5/qt5-based applications. 

After some investigation I got a reply from Christoph Feck <cfeck@kde.org>
> The job options were moved to the Qt 5 printer properties dialog. If some
> option is missing there, please report this directly.

Using the "advanced tab" we have been able to control extra printer 
functionality like stitching or stapling through "cups printer options".

How to regain this functionality with kf5/qt5 based applications? Any help is appreciated.

best regards,
  Thomas Kleindienst

requirements.name: [b2qt] custom build should support building of commercial Qt

requirements.name: Organize qmlbench into benchmarking infrastructure
requirements.text:
The first step is to get qmlbench running regularly on a Ubuntu desktop machine and posting results to a server that tracks it over time (separate issue).

Once this is working we can get a dedicated machine for it and also consider adding other desktop platforms.

Unfortunately, qmlbench does not give stable results on any embedded or mobile hardware we have tested, so we will have to be content with benchmark results from desktop platforms for this.

requirements.name: SwipeDelegate not working on iOS
Export tool: Finalize debug symbol files export
requirements.text:
https://codereview.qt-project.org/177343 introduces option for collecting debug symbol files to a separate archives. Debug symbol files are included to normal binary export .7z archives when available and by default separate debug symbol archives are not exported. With --export-debug-archives option debug symbols are also exported to additional *-debug-symbols.7z files. Currently this option is used for exporting Windows *.pdb -files only
in order to provide those alongside Windows offline installer and keep installer file size under 4 GB. Although exporting debug symbol archives is implemented for Linux and macOS hosts executing is intentionally limited to Windows host builds. At the moment patch is used on semi-automated fashion. macOS debug symbols export should be relatively easy to take into use.

To achieve fully automated build flow https://codereview.qt-project.org/177343 patch should be finalised and taken part of regular build flow.

requirements.name: [WinRT/WASAPI] Not honoring thread affinity
requirements.text:
WASAPI is the only audio backend that completely ignores the QObject thread affinity and makes callbacks read to the QIODevice on a different thread from QAudioOutput::thread() / QIODevice::thread() causing heaps of potential thread corruption issues.

The documentation makes no mention of this having thread safety issues nor do any of the other implementation.

This could easily be fixed by using QWinEventNotifier to run the callbacks on the same thread as the QAudioOutput, but WinRT doesn't implement QWinEventNotifier even though it already watches events for timers.

See suggestion [QTBUG-55893|https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-55893].

requirements.name: Cannot change RenderSettings.activeFrameGraph property at runtime
requirements.text: According to the Qt 3D Render Framegraph documentation (https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qt3drender-framegraph.html#setting-the-framegraph) the active framegraph (or parts of it) can be changed on the fly at runtime. But this doesn't work as expected. When updating activeFrameGraph the old framegraph is still rendered. In addition, if there is an animation, the animation is stopped. Changing only a part of a framegraph (e.g. the camera of a ForwardRenderer) works correctly.\r\n\r\nSee the attached example. It contains two framegraphs with different cameras, and two switches. The first switch binds new active framegraph (the old framegraph is still visible: animation stopped, camera position unchanged). The second switch changes only the camera of the framegraphs (works as expected).

requirements.name: Crash when accessing a null pex->shaderManager
requirements.text:
I regularly get crashes with the following stack trace. The crash is due to {{QOpenGLTextureGlyphCache::resizeTextureData}} trying to use {{pex->shaderManager}} (on the line {{pex->shaderManager->useBlitProgram();}}), where {{shaderManager}} is null. I cannot share the code, and I have no idea how to recreate this with a minimal example. However, I think there is enough information in the stack trace to show that something is wrong:

From what I can tell, the {{shaderManager}} should only be not null between calls to {{QOpenGL2PaintEngineEx::begin}} and {{QOpenGL2PaintEngineEx::end}}, but there is no sign of those functions intentionally being called anywhere in this stack.
 I have experienced this problem with the precompiled Qt 5.11 release, and with the Qt 5.11.1 release compiled from source (this is on Linux).

requirements.name: Wrong qmake lib/include detection from gcc on MSYS2
requirements.text:
The change https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/157817/ is not OK on MSYS2.

While MSYS2 uses GCC (details below), it's still a Windows platform and the patch results in detecting wrong paths for QMAKE_DEFAULT_LIBDIRS and/or QMAKE_DEFAULT_INCDIRS.

qmake builds correctly, but every time it is run, it prints "unable to access the specified path". Multiple times if creating a Makefile.

Conditioning the gcc block like this "!win32:gcc {" fixes the error, so basically the patch is a regression that wasn't there on 5.6.x.

When applying patches like this, please try to consider also the MSYS2 case, cause a few people relies on it (and cause it took me a week to figure this out...). Thanks

{code}
$ gcc -v
Using built-in specs.
COLLECT_GCC=C:\msys64\mingw32\bin\gcc.exe
COLLECT_LTO_WRAPPER=C:/msys64/mingw32/bin/../lib/gcc/i686-w64-mingw32/5.3.0/lto-wrapper.exe
Target: i686-w64-mingw32
Configured with: ../gcc-5.3.0/configure --prefix=/mingw32 --with-local-prefix=/mingw32/local --build=i686-w64-mingw32 --host=i686-w64-mingw32 --target=i686-w64-mingw32 --with-native-system-header-dir=/mingw32/i686-w64-mingw32/include --libexecdir=/mingw32/lib --with-gxx-include-dir=/mingw32/include/c++/5.3.0 --enable-bootstrap --with-arch=i686 --with-tune=generic --enable-languages=c,lto,c++,objc,obj-c++,fortran,ada --enable-shared --enable-static --enable-libatomic --enable-threads=posix --enable-graphite --enable-fully-dynamic-string --enable-libstdcxx-time=yes --disable-libstdcxx-pch --disable-libstdcxx-debug --enable-version-specific-runtime-libs --disable-isl-version-check --enable-lto --enable-libgomp --disable-multilib --enable-checking=release --disable-rpath --disable-win32-registry --disable-nls --disable-werror --disable-symvers --with-libiconv --with-system-zlib --with-gmp=/mingw32 --with-mpfr=/mingw32 --with-mpc=/mingw32 --with-isl=/mingw32 --with-pkgversion='Rev5, Built by MSYS2 project' --with-bugurl=https://sourceforge.net/projects/msys2 --with-gnu-as --with-gnu-ld --disable-sjlj-exceptions --with-dwarf2
Thread model: posix
gcc version 5.3.0 (Rev5, Built by MSYS2 project)
{code}

If it helps, the command run by default_pre.prf ( g++ -xc++ -E -v - ) gives this output:
{code}
COLLECT_GCC_OPTIONS='-E' '-v' '-shared-libgcc' '-mtune=generic' '-march=i686'
 C:/msys64/mingw32/bin/../lib/gcc/i686-w64-mingw32/5.3.0/cc1plus.exe -E -quiet -v -iprefix C:/msys64/mingw32/bin/../lib/gcc/i686-w64-mingw32/5.3.0/ -D_REENTRANT - -mtune=generic -march=i686
