requirements.name: 'unresolved external symbol' errors for 'Debugger' plugin builds using ICC on Windows
requirements.text:
Hi, Everyone,

Got errors while building Qt Creator:
{noformat}
configure -prefix "%CD%\..\ICC64d\dll" -debug -opensource -c++std c++11 -shared -plugin-sql-sqlite -opengl dynamic -openvg -platform win32-icc -iconv -qt-zlib -qt-pcre -icu -I "%CD%\..\..\libICU-57.1\ICC64d\include" -L "%CD%\..\..\libICU-57.1\ICC64d\lib" -qt-libpng -qt-libjpeg -avx -openssl -I "%CD%\..\..\libOPENSSL-1.1.0-dev\ICC64d\dll\include" -L "%CD%\..\..\libOPENSSL-1.1.0-dev\ICC64d\dll\lib" -dbus-runtime -confirm-license -skip qtscript && jom

[snip]

cd <Qt Creator DIR> && qmake QTC_PREFIX="%ProgramData%\QtCreator\ICC64d\dll" && jom

[snip]

        xilink /NOLOGO /DYNAMICBASE /NXCOMPAT /DEBUG /DLL /SUBSYSTEM:CONSOLE /OUT:..\..\..\lib\qtcreator\plugins\Debuggerd.dll @C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\Temp\nmA10C.tmp
   Creating library ..\..\..\lib\qtcreator\plugins\Debuggerd.lib and object ..\..\..\lib\qtcreator\plugins\Debuggerd.exp
registryaccess.obj : error LNK2019: unresolved external symbol __imp_RegQueryValueExW referenced in function "bool __cdecl RegistryAccess::registryReadBinaryKey(struct HKEY__ *,wchar_t const *,class QByteArray *,class QString *)" (?registryReadBinaryKey@RegistryAccess@@YA_NPEAUHKEY__@@PEB_WPEAVQByteArray@@PEAVQString@@@Z)
registryaccess.obj : error LNK2019: unresolved external symbol __imp_RegOpenKeyExW referenced in function "bool __cdecl RegistryAccess::openRegistryKey(struct HKEY__ *,wchar_t const *,bool,struct HKEY__ * *,class QString *)" (?openRegistryKey@RegistryAccess@@YA_NPEAUHKEY__@@PEB_W_NPEAPEAU2@PEAVQString@@@Z)
registerpostmortemaction.obj : error LNK2019: unresolved external symbol __imp_RegCloseKey referenced in function "public: virtual void __cdecl Debugger::Internal::RegisterPostMortemAction::readSettings(class QSettings const *)" (?readSettings@RegisterPostMortemAction@Internal@Debugger@@UEAAXPEBVQSettings@@@Z)
..\..\..\lib\qtcreator\plugins\Debuggerd.dll : fatal error LNK1120: 3 unresolved externals
NMAKE : fatal error U1077: '"C:\Program Files (x86)\IntelSWTools\compilers_and_libraries\windows\bin\intel64\xilink.EXE"' : return code '0x460'
Stop.
NMAKE : fatal error U1077: '"C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\BIN\amd64\nmake.exe"' : return code '0x2'
Stop.
NMAKE : fatal error U1077: 'cd' : return code '0x2'
Stop.
NMAKE : fatal error U1077: 'cd' : return code '0x2'
Stop.
NMAKE : fatal error U1077: 'cd' : return code '0x2'
Stop.
{noformat}

Inherent to *ICC* builds only.

Could be fixed by replacing in file
{noformat}
<QtCreator-4.0.0-dev>\src\shared\registryaccess\registryaccess.pri
{noformat}
string {{win32-msvc*}} with {{win32-msvc* | win32-icc}} (or even with {{msvc}}, as [Oswald Buddenhagen|https://bugreports.qt.io/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=buddenha] mentioned in [patch 155151|https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/155151/1//ALL,unified]).


More common solution would be applying this patch to all {{\*.pri}} and {{\*.pro}} files of Qt Creator sources, which contain strings {{win32-msvc*}}. In addition it fixes ICC warnings:
{noformat}
icl: command line warning #10159: invalid argument for option '/fp'
icl: command line warning #10006: ignoring unknown option '/finline-functions'
{noformat}
while building Qt Creator (see file {{<QtCreator-4.0.0-dev>\src\libs\3rdparty\botan\botan.pri}}).
Same could be done to *Qt Build Suite* and *Qt Installer Framework* sources, but that's another story.


Regards,
Alexander

requirements.name: QtWidgets based examples are rendered at half viewport size with latest QtBase 5.6
requirements.text:
When compiling latest QtWebEngine 5.6 with latest QtBase 5.6, and running demobrowser example, the widgets are rendered at half the window size, but the web page is rendered normally within the half window viewport.

QML based quicknanobrowser works fine.

Note that when you hover the mouse where content should actually be, it changes the cursor, so coordinates computing seem to work ok.

See attached screenshot.

requirements.name: Update applications to support any pixel density
requirements.text: All applications should support any pixel density. Previously we used to have, .hspan / .vspan to make sure each UI components are placed correctly but it is difficult for developer to specify such alignment. We have now .dp() function that will make sure each UI component get scaled accordingly to the UI window to keep the aspect ratio. Developers just need to put the pixel number as specified on the specification, and the UI will calculate it by itself.

requirements.name: Adding an Objective-C source to an iOS project on Simulator fails with bitcode error
QQuickWebEngineView: drag 'n drop does not update the mouse cursor
requirements.text:
When dragging an item within a web page the mouse cursor is not updated.

For example on http://gaearon.github.io/react-dnd/examples-chessboard-tutorial-app.html the mouse cursor should be {{Qt::ForbiddenCursor}} on forbidden chess board fields, but it always is {{Qt::DragMoveCursor}}.

Even when {{QQuickWebEngineView::dragMoveEvent}} ignores the event properly (see https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/182641/1) the cursor is always {{Qt::DragMoveCursor}}.

This is due to code in {{QQuickWindowPrivate::deliverDragEvent}} which creates a "translated" copy of the event object but ignores its accepted flag after being handled by {{QQuickItem::dragMoveEvent}}.

requirements.name: Make all WebEngine examples high-dpi aware
requirements.text:
Set 

  QCoreAppliation::setAttribute(Qt::AA_EnableHighDpiScaling)

in all examples. Maybe also add scaled images to the resources where necessary.

Reasoning: Without this attribute, the 100% default scaling factor will be not adjusted to high dpi screens.

requirements.name: [REG 5.9 -> 5.10] File browser shows $i18n{...} texts
requirements.text:
On the current dev branch (with the newest 5.10 merged), when opening e.g. `[file:///]`, titles like {{$i18n\{header}}} are shown where there was nothing with 5.9.

I think either those texts should be shown localized if possible, or English at least, or not at all like in 5.9 (I never noticed they were missing).

Qt 5.9:

!qt59.png!

Qt 5.10:

!qt510.png!

requirements.name: qtenv2.bat is missing initialization of PATH to mingw toolchain
requirements.text:
qtenv2.bat looks a bit suspicious:
{code}
echo off
echo Setting up environment for Qt usage...
set PATH=C:\Qt\Qt5.7.0-rc\5.7\mingw53_32\bin;\bin;%PATH%
cd /D C:\Qt\Qt5.7.0-rc\5.7\mingw53_32
{code}

Notice that it is appending two paths, one to the qt binaries folder (which is correct), the other one is to a "\bin" folder. I suspect that part should refer to the mingw tools path.

The consequence is that the "Qt 5.7 for Desktop (MinGW)" shortcut that is supposed to launch a command line shell with the environment ready for compiling Qt applications, will now launch a command line shell with an incomplete environment for compiling Qt applications (its missing the environment for the compiler etc).

For experienced users this should not be a big hurdle, but for newcomers for Qt this might be a problem and does not exactly contribute to "love at first sight".

We should try to use the same approach to generate in qdoc. In addition, we should also support chrome://licenses URL.

requirements.name: [REG 5.6->5.7] Performance drop for QIODevice::peek
requirements.text:
h3. Problem
Qt 5.7 changed how QIODevice::peek works internally. For a use case presented here, this leads to a big performance drop.

h3. Related to
"QIODevice: handle incomplete reads
" (7d257aab8175f3d4fd3b838d4f47457a8d868885) https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/114792/
https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-44418

h3. Use Case
In my particular use case, I am parsing a file with variable length encoded data (always peeking maximum theoretical size of a field and after parsing incrementing read pointer by a lesser amount). This could also be done in other ways avoiding the problem described here (using map() or ungetChar()). Still, this reveals a performance problem which not existed before.

h3. How to reproduce
{quote}
    char readBuf\[20\];
while(!testFile.atEnd()) {
  testFile.peek(readBuf, 20);
  testFile.read(readBuf, 15);
}
{quote}

Compile the attached MWE "qiodevice-peek-performance.zip" on Qt 5.6 and 5.7 and run it with a file as argument with size at least 1gb.

For a 1.6GB file on SSD drive, run on the same system, output is following:
{quote}
Time: 0m 5s 914ms (Qt 5.6.0)
Time: 4m 19s 682ms (Qt 5.7.0)
{quote}

I'm happy to provide any more data you might need.

h3. Qt 5.6 vs. Qt 5.7 technical details
For the presented case, here is what 5.6 and 5.7 does:

h4. Qt 5.6
* peek() issues qfiledevice read
* peek() immediately writes the read data back into the linear buffer with ungetBlock()
* a followup call to read() will read the peek'ed data from the linear buffer, the qfiledevice is only read for new data
* from perspective of qfiledevice, it is read sequentially (because peek'ed data is buffered for the second access)

h4. Qt 5.7
* peek() makes sure a transaction is started
* peek() issues qfiledevice read
* peek() will always clear the qringbuffer before returning (either through seekBuffer() within a previous transaction or through roolBackTransaction() calling seekBuffer(), seekBuffer clears the qringbuffer when going 'back' on random access devices)
* a follow up call to read() will invoke a seek of qfiledevice and a second read of same data on the qfiledevice, because the qringbuffer was cleared by peek()
* effectively from perspective of qfiledevice, it is not a sequential read, but jumping around and reading data twice

h3. Thoughts on improvement
These are loosely thoughts from different angles to improve current situation.

h4. Put peek'ed data back into buffer
Does peek() really need a transaction? Within an active transaction or not, the iodevice is expected to keep the internal read and transaction positions. This should be possible with just reading the device and putting everything back into the qringbuffer (as qt 5.6 does it with linear buffer). Similar like ungetChar, but for a whole block.

h4. Avoid deallocation of memory
Clearing a classical ring buffer should be as fast as writing two pointers. I'm not sure, but I think seekBuffer() calling qringbuffer::clear deallocates memory which is slow when done often (currently for every peek!).

h4. Support rewinding of qringbuffer
When seeking back, currently everyting is cleard. For a ring buffer, it could potentially be possible to rewind the read pointer. Instead of clearing, the buffer could provide the contents without a device-read as long it was not overwritten by the write pointer in the mean time.

h4. Implement custom read-like function for peek
peek() could be implemented to always read directly into the qringbuffer. First it would try the qringbuffer::peek if enough data is already available and if an underlying device read is necessary, it would read into qringbuffer and copy data to the user's buffer. This could be faster than using ::read() (incrementing the data position with freeing memory of qringbuffer) and than writing it back to the internal buffer again.

h4. Documentation change
If proposed improvements are not suiteable (e.g. because of other use cases I did not think of or any misguided thoughts on my part), a note could be included in documentation of QIODevice::peek saying that from 5.7 performance is compareable of doing a device read+backseek for random access devices.

requirements.name: Incorrect aapt tool path on windows.
Update copyright footer to 2016
After switching from/to Airplay all newly created QWebEngineView are rendered black
requirements.text:
Enabling/Disabling Airplay to show the screen content on a large screen using an Apple TV affects the creation of QWebEngineView. The effect is that the content is rendered all black.

Reproduction Steps 1:

1. Turn OFF any Airplay if active
2. Run the attached example
3. Create one or more QWebEngineView using the button
=> everything ok
4. turn ON Airplay
5. try to create more windows
=> all windows created before switch still work
=> all windows created after switch are black

Reproduction Steps 2:
(Close the example app if still open)
1. Turn ON any Airplay if not-active
2. Run the attached example
3. Create one or more QWebEngineView using the button
=> everyhing ok
4. turn OFF Airplay
5. try to create more windows
=> all windows created before switch still work
=> all windows created after switch are black

It does not matter on which screen the windows are rendered. It also does not seem to matter whether one of the screens is in HiDpi mode or not. The problem also happens if the screens are mirrored.

requirements.name: Includes of moc_*.cpp files in Objective-C++ source files are not detected

requirements.name: Android Target SDK options in Qt Creator is limited to 9-23.
requirements.text:
The drop down menu for Target SDK in the AndroidManifest.xml general view is limited to SDK's 9-23. The latest SDK is 26.

SDK 26 is correctly detected in the Projects build options, Build Android APK>Android build SDK

 

The SDK can be set by editing the XML source directly but viewing again in General display causes the setting to be removed and Target SDK reported as Not Set.

requirements.name: Upgrade Wayland version to 1.7
requirements.text:
Many tasks are currently blocked due to outdated Wayland version in CI/testing.

Ubuntu 15.04 has Wayland 1.7, while 15.10 has Wayland 1.8. Both will work fine.

Update [2]: "Linux UbuntuTouch_15_04 (gcc-armv7)" has Wayland 1.6, but that is a cross compile build. We will need an x86 platform with 
Ubuntu 15.04 or later, since we want to run CI tests. (This work is ongoing)

Update [3]: OpenSUSE Leap 42.1 would be preferable to Ubuntu, since it makes sense to test Wayland on a distro where it will be used. Wayland >= 1.8 is also preferable so the protocol (wayland.xml) can be updated independently.

requirements.name: Update the frontend generator template to generate better struct classes
requirements.text:
The generated structs should make use of QSharedData similar to the structs implemented in QtIviMedia.

By default they should inherit QIviSearchAndBrowseItem to support using these in QIviSearchAndBrowseModel.

Making it possible to define what type it should inherit from in the qface file, would be nice to have.

requirements.name: Qt Quick Profiler does not adapt to the theme
requirements.text: The Qt Quick Profiler does not use the colors of the current theme. Also, it has low-resolution icons which look bad on High-DPI displays.

requirements.name: REG: Qt now using separate index and vertex buffer in Qt Quick
requirements.text: In 2c2e7f27426cb4381f2dcaa36affe55719619753, we removed the shared index/vertex buffer from the Qt Quick scenegraph because of missing support on WebGL. This causes a regression in performance and should be reverted. \r\n\r\nIdeally it should be detected at runtime, but if that is not feasible, we should disable WebGL by default in the builds and then only use separate buffers when we are explicitly building for WebGL support.

requirements.name: VertexBlendAnimation is missing qml registration
requirements.text: The class is missing qml metatype registration is not able to use it from within qml.

requirements.name: In QMap class docs Key redirects to Key QML Type
requirements.text:
In the documentation of QMap Key class redirects to Key QML type.
It points this address: http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qml-qtquick-virtualkeyboard-key.html which has nothing to do with QMap.

This problem occurs for example here: http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qmap.html#find

requirements.name: Create 32-bit and 64-bit yocto toolchains for CI usage
requirements.text: Need to create toolchains for arm (32-bit) and arm64 (64-bit) architectures that can be used for CI testing all Qt modules.\r\n\r\nToolchains should to be available locally in ci-files01-hki and externally in download.qt.io

requirements.name: QtAutomation: MinGW 64 binaries missing
requirements.text: See the Qt for Automation binaries on windows, staging server. Qt5.12.0 for Automation has MinGW 32 bit(no version info provided, should there be? Missing from Qt5.11.2 also..). Should have MinGW(7.3) 64 bit binaries.

requirements.name: Widgets not drawn when using official Python on macOS + Qt 5.12 (dev)
Font rendering broken with shared OpenGL contexts
requirements.text:
To reproduce, run attached example.

After couple of seconds, all texts disappear. glBindFramebuffer() call in QOpenGLTextureGlyphCache::resizeTextureData seems to fail, which might be the reason this is happening.

requirements.name: Add "Rename..." to file system view
requirements.text: The issue to solve here is nicely handling the case where the file is part of an open project.

requirements.name: [Windows][cdb]: When debugging then at times it can take a lot longer to step over code
requirements.text: [Windows][cdb]: When debugging then at times it can take a lot longer to step over code. It is not always possible to reproduce this, but if the pdb files (such as for QtWebEngineCore) are really big then it can make it much more visible. When debugging in the same way in Visual Studio then it is fine.

requirements.name: QtQuick apps crash when font antialiasing is disabled (developer build)

{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0"?><!DOCTYPE fontconfig SYSTEM "fonts.dtd">
<fontconfig>
 <match target="font">
  <edit name="antialias" mode="assign">
   <bool>false</bool>
  </edit>
 </match>
</fontconfig>

requirements.name: failing assert in memory manager
requirements.text:
There are 2 tests that end up with the same failing assert in {{MemorySegment::allocate}}. 

First is a test case originally reported for bug -QTBUG-61356-. The original issue for that bug has been fixed, but it now also runs into the assert both on qt5.9 *and* 5.11. The example code for that bug is attached here too.

Then there is a second test, reported for -QTBUG-62087-. Again, the original issue of that bug is fixed, but now it runs into the assert when using qt5.9 (but *not* qt5.11). Code:
{code:java}
import QtQuick 2.0
Item {
  Component.onCompleted: {
    var foo, chars;
    foo = new Array(250000 + 1).join('x');
    foo = new Array(264000 + 1).join('x');
    chars = foo.split('');
    chars = foo.split('');
    chars = foo.split('');

}

requirements.name: the root CmakeLists.txt should be shown, even if there is an error in it
Verify programmatic localisation of text in Qt 3D Studio presentations
requirements.text:
At the moment only way to do localised text in Qt 3D Studio presentations is to localise the strings on Qt QML side and then set the localised text programmatically to Qt 3D Studio presentation. Verify that this works as inteded for more complex languages:

# Languages with extended characters beyond 8-bit ASCII
# Languages with NOT left-to-right text flow

Report issues as bugs and link those as "resulted in" from this task.

requirements.name: Restoring history clears web channel
5.6: Invalid global header generated from PySide2/global.h.in
requirements.text:
It seems the CMake variables  Qt5X11Extras_FOUND,  t5WinExtras_FOUND,
 Qt5MacExtras_FOUND are not initialized on the other platforms, causing:
{code}
#if 0
#  include <QtScript/QtScript>
#endif

#if 0
#  include <QtScriptTools/QtScriptTools>
#endif

#if 
#  include <QtWinExtras/QtWinExtras>
#endif

#if 
#  include <QtMacExtras/QtMacExtras>
#endif
{code}
This prevents a merge 5.6->5.9 since Clang fails on this.

requirements.name: Indicate that a function is Q_INVOKABLE in the documentation
requirements.text:
There is no indication that a function is Q_INVOKABLE in the documentation.

When interacting with a c++ class in QML, we can access its properties, signals, slots and Q_INVOKABLE member functions but the latter are not documented as such so we are not aware of the possibility to call them.
The only way to know that a function is Q_INVOKABLE is to read the header of the class.
Classes that are made specifically for QML generally document those Q_INVOKABLE with a {{/qmlmethod}} documentation, but this is not the case for classes that have been around for a long time, before QML was created.
This can be useful even for non-QML code, to know which methods you can call with {{QMetaObject::invokeMethod()}}.

requirements.name: Qt Creator doesn't stop target app running on remote machine in some cases
requirements.text: An built app isn't stopped when "Same build directory" is selected for preference "Stop applications before building:" is selected.\r\nIn this case I obviously have an error trying to rewrite running file on the target machine.\r\nHowever, when "Same project" option is selected it stops the app. Unfortunately I can't stay with the option because at the same time I'm running another project for 2 build configurations and it requires "Same build directory" in order to run another app for both targets.

requirements.name: exit with a return code from QML
requirements.text:
QML language has a global object called Qt which provides many useful enums and functions. Probably the most common used function of this object is quit(). This function causes to emit QQmlEngine::quit() signal, connected to QCoreApplication::quit() slot by the application developer.

But the problem is, this function calls QCoreApplication::exit() with return code 0.

My suggestion is to having another ancestor function in Qt Object with a parameter for exit code and for analogy call it 'exit'. So that after event loop returns this code, application developer can process any other logic depending on this specified return code.

example prototype:
quit()
exit(int returnCode)

I asked this question on stackoverflow, here is the link for it, http://stackoverflow.com/questions/34329875/exit-with-a-return-code-from-qml

requirements.name: Default Button colors
Add possibility to include "feature files" for each module to meta-boot2qt
requirements.text:
There should be a feature file for each module.

The feature files include the -feature and -no-feature flags belonging to that module. They should be added to the qmake call when building.

If there's no feature file, no extra arguments are passed to the qmake call.

requirements.name: C++ debugging fails to start on Android >= 7 emulator (Connection reset by peer)
requirements.text:
My production app cannot be debugged on Android 7.0.0 and 7.1.1 x86 emulator images (I cannot test on Android 8 due to other issues not relevant here). Application is built, deployed, launched, but  I get {{Remote communication error.  Target disconnected.: Connection reset by peer}} message box, and a lot of {{DEBUGGER: Waiting for debug socket connect}} lines.

There is no such problem with Android 6 emulator, nor I can reproduce it with simple new "Qt Quick Controls 2" project.

There are no such errors when uncheck {{Enable C++}} option in {{Debugger Settings}}.

I tried to start debugging in different way:
 * Deploy
 * Launch app manually on emulator
 * Start Debugging Without Deployment

But I got same unsuccessful result.

Here's full output when C++ debugging fails to start:
{code:java}
Debugging starts
I art     : Not late-enabling -Xcheck:jni (already on)
W art     : Unexpected CPU variant for X86 using defaults: x86
W System  : ClassLoader referenced unknown path:
I QtCore  : Start
W linker  : /data/app/com.myapp-1/lib/x86/libQt5Network.so: unsupported flags DT_FLAGS_1=0x81
W linker  : /data/app/com.myapp-1/lib/x86/libQt5Qml.so: unsupported flags DT_FLAGS_1=0x81

requirements.name: Picture preview not visible in Qt Quick Designer
requirements.text: Using the [ISO icon browser|http://doc.qt.io/qtcreator/qtquick-iso-icon-browser.html], there is no preview for a Picture item that has a valid icon set.

requirements.name: WebEngine 5.10.0 alpha does not build with glibc >= 2.26
QSqlQuery doesn't respect mysql USIGNED flag and breaks on ::next()
requirements.text: It seems that since Qt 5.6 QSqlQuery doesn't play well with mysql UNSIGNED datatype flag. Well here's an exmaple.  We have mysql table table with following definition: CREATE TABLE sql_test(id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY, \r\ntest_number TINYINT(3) UNSIGNED); . Field test_number can hold 0-255 since it's TINYINT and UNSIGNED. But since QSqlQuery doesn't care for UNSIGNED flag it breaks when field value reaches 128. What's worring me is that it breaks out of while loop w/o crashing or throwing any exceptions and end result is incomplete without us knowing it. Attached screenshot has example application with sql data and output.

The first step is to update the header picture.

requirements.name: Add pretty-printer for std::function
requirements.text: It would be nice if the debugger was able to pretty print std::function objects.\r\n\r\nE.g. it could print whether or not a std::function can be called or not (and maybe even what will be called:-).

requirements.name: QWidget::frameGeometry() does not match WM_NCCALCSIZE
requirements.text: I am implementing a custom window decoration for a project on Windows 10 by handling WM_NCCALCSIZE (and WM_NCPAINT, WM_NCHITTEST, ..) message. The custom border and caption sizes I return upon WM_NCCALCSIZE never match the values returned by QWidget::frameGeometry(). Looking into Qt code, the problem is because QWidget::frameGeometry() uses AdjustWindowRectEx().\r\n

requirements.name: QQuickWidget within a QTabWidget is invalidated when switching tabs
requirements.text:
Our Qt application embeds Qml using QQuickWidget.

Not strictly related to the issue, we also use a QQuickFramebufferObject to do OpenGL rendering (using OpenSceneGraph).

This means that at some point we need to release GL resources.
According to the documentation, a proper time to do it when receiving a QQuickWindow::sceneGraphInvalidated signal.

This signal is fired when:
1. switching tabs and the QQuickWidget becomes invisible (but not when minimizing the application window or when obscuring it with another app)
2. when disposing the QQuickWidget

Problem is that it is not possible to distinguish the two cases.
This forces us to release our OpenGL scene when closing *and* when switching tabs. The later is bad because rebuilding the scene is expensive (and potentially slow) and some state is lost unless persisted somewhere (which is not the case).

We understand that the above behavior is documented (http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qquickitem.html#graphics-resource-handling) but we did not find any workaround.

We tried to use QQuickWindow::scheduleRenderJob() from QQuickItem::releaseResources() but the jobs don't run, probably because it is too late.

We tried to change both setPersistentOpenGLContext / setPersistentSceneGraph to false.

Other places to release resources (destructors, ...) either exhibit the same problem or are inappropriate (gl context not active anymore or destroyed).

To resume, a QQuickWidget within a QTabWidget should respect the setPersistentOpenGLContext / setPersistentSceneGraph settings.

requirements.name: "String" type is missing from AdditionalMetaDataTypes
requirements.text: "String" type is now handled as "None". It should have it's own metadata type and handlers, as it can be added to behavior scripts as a visible type, for example.\r\n\r\ndateAndTime.qml from SampleProject can be used as reference when starting implementation.

requirements.name: Qt5.6.0 x11 QNX: QtScript gets installed when not checked
requirements.text: qt-enterprise-linux-x64-qnx-5.6.0-rc_343.run\r\n\r\nRun installer, on component selection page click deselect all and then select just the QNX binaries, finish installation. QtScript binaries are installed even though the component is not selected on component selection page.

requirements.name: CMake: server mode doesn't handle cmake errors
requirements.text:
Qt Creator 4.3 when run with CMake 3.7.2 using server mode is not handling CMake errors.

Given the following CMake project:
{code:java}
project(oh-my!)

cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.2)

message(FATAL_ERROR "This message should popup in the issues list!")
{code}
The line with *message* should have an error icon next to it and in the Issues list there should be the text *This message should popup in the issues list!*

Qt Creator 4.3 with CMake 3.5 does handle the CMake errors as expected.

Screenshots here: [http://imgur.com/a/yYlei|http://imgur.com/a/yYlei] (for some reason attaching screenshots to this ticket results in "JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again.")

Lambdas are copied at emission time
requirements.text:
As [mentioned in the mailing list|http://lists.qt-project.org/pipermail/interest/2015-April/016602.html]:

If you pass a mutable lambda (or function object) to QObject::connect, each time the signal is emitted, the values captured are the ones passed at the time when connect was called. This is due to the object being copied each time the signal is emitted.

requirements.name: Shortcut stops triggering Action when the Action is assigned to a Button in a Repeater
requirements.text:
Shortcut stops triggering Action when the Action is assigned to a Button in a Repeater.

This affects QtQuick applications using Controls2.

 

How to reproduce:

1) Create an Action and assign a shortcut to it, do some action on the trigger

2) Create a Repeater (with only one repetition) with a Button delegate

3) Assign the Action to the Button delegate

4) Start application, hit the shortcut -> BUG -> nothing happens

5) Observation - if the shortcut is reassigned to the Action it starts working again

 

Desired behavior of course is that the Action triggers. When removing the Repeater the Action triggers. When including it in a simple Button (outside of a Repeater) the Action triggers.

 

Real use cases include creating multiple buttons in a Repeater and assigning them Actions from an ActionGroup based on their index.

 

I'm including a minimal example as an attachment.

It's not about multiple instances of WebView, you can create as many WebViews as you want on the first screen you push into StackView and it will work on iOS, so something else is broken.

requirements.name: Standalone macOS wheel naming do not respect explicitly defined deployment target
requirements.text:
When building standalone wheels for macOS and defining the deployment target explicitly, the resulting wheel filenames are e.g.:

PySide2-5.9-cp27-cp27m-macosx_10_6_intel.whl
PySide2-5.9-cp35-cp35m-macosx_10_6_intel.whl
PySide2-5.9-cp36-cp36m-macosx_10_6_intel.whl

In this case, I used Python from python.org (built on macOS 10.6) but I defined the deployment target to be macOS 10.10 ({{--osx-deployment-target=10.10}}).

So the filenames inherit the platform used when building Python, not the deployment target platform. I would propose the built wheels should instead be named (or renamed) into saying the following in my particular scenario described here:

PySide2-5.9-cp27-cp27m-macosx_10_10_intel.whl
PySide2-5.9-cp35-cp35m-macosx_10_10_intel.whl
PySide2-5.9-cp36-cp36m-macosx_10_10_intel.whl

requirements.name: Qbs plugin always overwrites qbs.buildVariant, which interferes with multiplexing
requirements.text: Qt Creator always puts its value for qbs.buildVariant in the config when building Qbs projects. This overwrites values applied by the multiplexing mechanism or by the project files, which is undesired. Instead, Qt Creator should use the qbs.defaultBuildVariant property, which is provided for this reason.

requirements.name: Install an font which supports arabic characters in the Light weight
requirements.text:
The neptune-ui is using the Font.Light weight everywhere in the UI. This works fine for normal latin characters as they are included in the "Source Sans Pro" font.

For arabic glyhps, the system needs to find a font which supports arabic characters using the "light" weight, which currently doesn't exist and it falls back to render invalid glyphs.

This is currently the case in the virtual keyboard and the i18ndemo.

To fix this we need to install an font into the system which supports this e.g.  FreeMono.ttf

requirements.name: Resolution of source file for failed tests is invalid
requirements.text:
When a test fails, it shows the failure location (using {{__FILE__}} and {{__LINE__}})

This information is used by the parser to link to the source file.

Since __FILE__ is relative, a base directory is needed for resolving it to a full path.

The base directory that is used is the application path. This is wrong both for shadow and in-source build (at least on Windows).

The executable is placed in {{debug/test.exe}}, while the Makefile is one directory above it, and the reference is to {{../test/test.cpp}} for shadow build or just {{test.cpp}} for in-source.

The base directory should be the directory from which make was executed.

requirements.name: QFileDialog causes segmentation faults of programs linked to libKF5XmlGui
requirements.text:
When writing a program based on the class KXmlGuiWindow of KF5, I observed segmentation faults at termination of the program, if static methods of the QFileDialog class were called.

The segfaults already occur with a minimum program consisting of an instantiation of QApplication and a call to QFileDialog::getExistingDirectory() (see attached example).

The segfaults also occur when, instead of calling QFileDialog::getExistingDirectory(), an instance of QFileDialog is created (see line commented out in the example main.cpp).

The segfaults do not occur if the program is not linked to libKF5XmlGui (by commenting out the line containing "KF5::XmlGui" in the CMakeLists.txt file of the attached example). Then the program terminates normally.

The segfaults are not observed when using the older version Qt 5.4.2 on
openSUSE 13.2.

requirements.name: [REG 5.6->5.7] Performance drop for QIODevice::peek
requirements.text:
h3. Problem
Qt 5.7 changed how QIODevice::peek works internally. For a use case presented here, this leads to a big performance drop.

h3. Related to
"QIODevice: handle incomplete reads
" (7d257aab8175f3d4fd3b838d4f47457a8d868885) https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/114792/
https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-44418

h3. Use Case
In my particular use case, I am parsing a file with variable length encoded data (always peeking maximum theoretical size of a field and after parsing incrementing read pointer by a lesser amount). This could also be done in other ways avoiding the problem described here (using map() or ungetChar()). Still, this reveals a performance problem which not existed before.

h3. How to reproduce
{quote}
    char readBuf\[20\];
while(!testFile.atEnd()) {
  testFile.peek(readBuf, 20);
  testFile.read(readBuf, 15);
}
{quote}

Compile the attached MWE "qiodevice-peek-performance.zip" on Qt 5.6 and 5.7 and run it with a file as argument with size at least 1gb.

For a 1.6GB file on SSD drive, run on the same system, output is following:
{quote}
Time: 0m 5s 914ms (Qt 5.6.0)
Time: 4m 19s 682ms (Qt 5.7.0)
{quote}

I'm happy to provide any more data you might need.

h3. Qt 5.6 vs. Qt 5.7 technical details
For the presented case, here is what 5.6 and 5.7 does:

h4. Qt 5.6
* peek() issues qfiledevice read
* peek() immediately writes the read data back into the linear buffer with ungetBlock()
* a followup call to read() will read the peek'ed data from the linear buffer, the qfiledevice is only read for new data
* from perspective of qfiledevice, it is read sequentially (because peek'ed data is buffered for the second access)

h4. Qt 5.7
* peek() makes sure a transaction is started
* peek() issues qfiledevice read
* peek() will always clear the qringbuffer before returning (either through seekBuffer() within a previous transaction or through roolBackTransaction() calling seekBuffer(), seekBuffer clears the qringbuffer when going 'back' on random access devices)
* a follow up call to read() will invoke a seek of qfiledevice and a second read of same data on the qfiledevice, because the qringbuffer was cleared by peek()
* effectively from perspective of qfiledevice, it is not a sequential read, but jumping around and reading data twice

h3. Thoughts on improvement
These are loosely thoughts from different angles to improve current situation.

h4. Put peek'ed data back into buffer
Does peek() really need a transaction? Within an active transaction or not, the iodevice is expected to keep the internal read and transaction positions. This should be possible with just reading the device and putting everything back into the qringbuffer (as qt 5.6 does it with linear buffer). Similar like ungetChar, but for a whole block.

h4. Avoid deallocation of memory
Clearing a classical ring buffer should be as fast as writing two pointers. I'm not sure, but I think seekBuffer() calling qringbuffer::clear deallocates memory which is slow when done often (currently for every peek!).

h4. Support rewinding of qringbuffer
When seeking back, currently everyting is cleard. For a ring buffer, it could potentially be possible to rewind the read pointer. Instead of clearing, the buffer could provide the contents without a device-read as long it was not overwritten by the write pointer in the mean time.

h4. Implement custom read-like function for peek
peek() could be implemented to always read directly into the qringbuffer. First it would try the qringbuffer::peek if enough data is already available and if an underlying device read is necessary, it would read into qringbuffer and copy data to the user's buffer. This could be faster than using ::read() (incrementing the data position with freeing memory of qringbuffer) and than writing it back to the internal buffer again.

h4. Documentation change
If proposed improvements are not suiteable (e.g. because of other use cases I did not think of or any misguided thoughts on my part), a note could be included in documentation of QIODevice::peek saying that from 5.7 performance is compareable of doing a device read+backseek for random access devices.

requirements.name: QT Creator doesn't list any available Android Build SDKs
requirements.text:
Qt Creator 4.3.0 installed during Qt  5.9 installation (open source under Ubuntu 17.04) doesn't list any available Android SDKs in the drop-down list.

This is the same situation brought up in [stackoverflow|https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42754878/qt-creator-wont-list-any-available-android-build-sdks] The fix provided in stackoverflow (manually editing the .user.pro file) indeed works and then the application is build and deployed properly in an Android device.

This issue was also reported previously in:
[Don't detect Android SDK's|https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTCREATORBUG-14223]
[Android build SDK dropdown not populated|https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTCREATORBUG-16280]
[Building Android projects with Qt 5.8: SDK & build.xml|https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTCREATORBUG-17852]
[Can't see Android SDK|https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTCREATORBUG-14906]
[Qt can't use latest Android SDK|https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-59236]

All of those issues are already closed but some of them appear as not even evaluated.

(e.g. try jumping to 5000 ms in a default 10 sec timeline multiple times - the first attempt will succeed, the others will get ignored until the animation (if looping) restarts)

Can be tested with tests/scenes/behaviors/actionevent.uip for example. (just hit the Jump cone a couple of times)

{code:java}

Alexander

requirements.name: Tumbler's animation accelerates slowly with large scrolling distances
requirements.text:
Tumbler's animation has an easing curve which causes an accelerating motion. This acceleration is relative to the distance to be scrolled, the distance between the old current index and the new target index that is. This can become problematic with large amount of items (large distances) as the acceleration becomes painfully slow. This can affect at least use cases where the Tumbler is used as a display and not as an input control, use cases where the property current index is set programmatically. 

Steps to reproduce:
- Run the sample attached.
- Press "Scroll to end".
- Wait until the Tumbler value reaches 10 and press "Scroll to start".
- Observe the difference between the scrolling animations. distance of 1000 vs distance of ~10
EXPECTED: There isn't too much of a difference and both animation are user-friendly.
ACTUAL: The first animation ("Scroll to end") has a really slow acceleration phase.

requirements.name: QWaitCondition::wait with large timeout immediately returns
jom /k runs dependants after failed dependency
requirements.text:
jom /k runs dependant targets after a failed dependency. This does not match what gmake -k or nmake /k are doing and it does not make sense: in the best case, the dependant target will also fail, in the worst case, it will produce a corrupt result.

Consider the following makefile:

{noformat}
foo:
	echo foo
	cmd /c exit 1

bar: foo
	echo bar
{noformat}

{noformat}
>nmake /F test.make /K bar

Microsoft (R) Program Maintenance Utility Version 14.00.23918.0
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation.  All rights reserved.

        echo foo
foo
        cmd /c exit 1
NMAKE : warning U4010: 'foo' : build failed; /K specified, continuing ...
NMAKE : warning U4011: 'bar' : not all dependents available; target not built
{noformat}

This is what I expect.

{noformat}
>jom /F test.make /K bar

jom 1.1.1 - empower your cores

        echo foo
foo
        cmd /c exit 1
jom: E:\brunodf\jom\test.make [foo] Error 1
        echo bar
bar
{noformat}

Running target bar is unexpected here.

requirements.name: Improve the memory consumption of AOT built cache files for 5.12
requirements.text:
The QML engine creates cache files that contain a dump of internal data structures on the fly when loading a .qml or .js file at run-time. These files are be mmap'ed and used right away. The only data structure that needs to be created from these are property caches.

The qmlcachegen command line tool as well as CONFIG+=qtquickcompiler (or the cmake equivalent) make it possible to build these cache files ahead of time.

Unfortunately at the time this step happens, the generator for these caches does not have the same degree of visibility into the type system as the QML engine at run-time. For example for signal handlers we cannot determine the names of the parameters yet. These limitations lead to a staged approach of using ahead-of-time generated cache files that skips the entire byte code generation - that has been done offline and can be re-used - but otherwise reconstructs the internal data structures. Those are subsequently used to perform a full type compilation and that also involves creating new data structures from the CompiledData name space.

In 5.12 we can reduce the memory consumption when using such ahead-of-time generated cache files with two relatively unintrusive changes:

    (1) Avoid the re-creation of the indexed string table for the in-memory generated compilation unit and instead fall back to the memory mapped string table provided from the cache file.
    (2) Reduce the size of data structures in the CompiledData namespace so that their duplication reduces the size of the files as well as their memory consumption.

requirements.name: Using ComboBox makes SwipeView animation unsmooth
requirements.text:
When clicking on a combobox, the swipe animation is unsmooth afterwards, i.e. approximately after half of the animation there is a little break. See attached code for an example. It happens only on the first swipe animation, the next swipe animations are ok again.

Using the method "forceActiveFocus()" on another item seems to be a workaround for the reported problem, see attached code line 82.

This happens only on iOS (especially iPad 3 and to a lesser extend iPhone 4s), not on OS X, nor Android, nor Windows.

requirements.name: duplicating of 'EGL' and 'GLESv2' binaries for static builds on Windows
requirements.text:
Hi, Everyone,

For Qt-5.7.0 {{-static -opengl dynamic}} builds using Mingw-w64, ICC and MSVC found, that {{libEGL.dll}} and {{libGLESv2.dll}} binaries exist in both {{bin}} and {{lib}} directories of installation folder. While for {{-shared -opengl dynamic}} builds they exist only in {{bin}} directory.

I can't see the full scope of this in case of Qt (could be a reason of such file layout).
But since duplicating and inconsistencies does not please in general, could this be fixed?


Regards,
Alexander

On http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qkeysequence.html#toString there is noted that:

requirements.name: Code model does not know about sysroot that is used by default by build system
requirements.text:
QMake, CMake and Qbs all automatically set a {{-isysroot}} when building (on macOS at least). 
But the code model does not get this sysroot set.

This is especially problematic if the compiler is clang from a Xcode installation, i.e. when using {{/Applications/Xcode.app/......./clang\+\+}} because that actually requires a sysroot setting to find system headers. ({{/usr/bin/clang\+\+}} seems to automatically assume a sysroot from the MacOS SDK.)

In 4.4 we even have autodetected tool chains (Apple Clang (<arch>)) which are affected by this.

requirements.name: Qt 5.6 ABI incompatibility due to qt_handleMouseEvent
requirements.text:
Qt 5.6 removed the following overload from qtestmouse.h:

{code}
qt_handleMouseEvent ( QWindow* w, QPointF const& local, QPointF const& global, Qt::MouseButtons b, Qt::KeyboardModifiers mods )
{code}

See http://abi-laboratory.pro/tracker/compat_report/qt/5.5.1/5.6.0/8f965/abi_compat_report.html#Removed

This broke PyQt binary compatibility on Archlinux, as it's probably inlined from {{QTest::mouseEvent}}: https://bugs.archlinux.org/task/48734

Also see this mail by Thiago: https://www.mail-archive.com/development@qt-project.org/msg23663.html

It'd be nice if it could be brought back in 5.6.1.

requirements.name: Update MinGW to 64 bit in Qt 5.11
Installing files using SFTP fails due to wildcard
requirements.text:
According to http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qmake-advanced-usage.html#installing-files
(extra) files can be installed using something like:
documentation.path = /usr/local/program/doc
documentation.files = docs/*
INSTALLS += documentation.
This works in QtCreator 4.0.2 and QtCreator 4.1.0. With QtCreator 4.2.1 however, uploading fails with a read error:
Uploading files failed '/home/ruud/MyApp/Application/arm/*'. Could not open file for reading.
Also the "Files to deploy:" list box shows a single entry (the one with the wildcard).

requirements.name: Rewrite the QIviSearchAndBrowseModel backend interface
requirements.text:
The QIviSearchAndBrowseModel backend interface currently doesn't work as smoothly as intended.
 * Split the backend into multiple classes
 * The backend should have a way to decide which signals are intended for which frotenend, or whether they are intended for all frontends
 * The backend needs a way to know when a new frontend got added and also when it gets removed, to manage the local cache and free data.

virtualkeyboard crash
requirements.text:
use inputpanel in dialog, if current input mode is chinese when close dialog, then the reload dialog will result in crash.

after dig into the code, I found it is caused by the relation of inputmethod and engine.  when close and destroy dialog, the inputmethod will also destroy, but the selectionListModels in engine is still keeping datasource pointing to the destroyed inputmethod.

requirements.name: Qt5WebEngineCore fails to link due to libatomic dependency
requirements.text:
When building Qt WebEngine with a Qt build with -platform linux-clang

Qt5WebEngineCore.so fails to link with error:
{code}
/usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5.3.1/../../../../include/c++/5.3.1/bits/atomic_base.h:362: error: undefined reference to '__atomic_is_lock_free'
/usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/5.3.1/../../../../include/c++/5.3.1/bits/atomic_base.h:354: error: undefined reference to '__atomic_is_lock_free'
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
Makefile.core_module:161: recipe for target '/home/nezticle/Code/build/qt5-5.8-nogl/qtbase/lib/libQt5WebEngineCore.so.5.8.0' failed
{code} 

This seems to be because of a missing -latomic , which appears to be assumed when building with clang.  However when building with clang without libc++, you still need to use -latomic.

requirements.name: UX Improvements for Qt 3D Studio 1.0
requirements.text:
This Epic includes following overarching UX work items for Qt 3D Studio 1.0:
* Small usability improvements can be done easily by changing placement of some tools, like adding layers, playback controls etc. Tooltips, keyboard navigation and shortcuts should be fully working too.
* Re-design panels and menuitems, menubars etc. functions for 3D Studio so that it more closely matches Qt common tool guidelines and improves the UX with "low hanging fruits".

requirements.name: change content in locals & watchers broken during js debug
requirements.text:
1.  Open qtdeclarative/examples/quick/demos/samegame/samegame.qmlproject from Qt5's repository.
2. Place a breakpoint at the first line of the startNewGame() function (samegame.js) which contains executable code (i.e. not (only) a comment).
3. Start debugging app
4. Enter cleanUp function , try to add expression evaluation i == 10
5. Try to change value ( type 10 -> shows "cleanUp" in value field)
6. Run debug content in expression evaluation not visible.

Please note debug console works correctly.

requirements.name: Compilation fails for qtwayland if QT_NO_OPENGL is defined
Handle multi-pass, multi-buffer effects
Qt Platform Menu QML Type cannot create sub menus on Windows
Support the Subscription and the MonitoredItem services in our API
requirements.text:
OPC-UA has two services - subscriptions and monitoredItems - which together provide the ability to monitor attributes on the server for value changes.

For a first iteration we will ignore Events. We will also ignore aggregate filters. Deadband filters would be nice to have.

The current vision is to offer a convenience API which completely hides the fact that there are subscriptions and monitored items. In addition to that we plan to offer an advanced API which gives access to both API elements.

Both implementations need to be async.

requirements.name: Add QtWebEngine to support ADFS authentication
requirements.text:
Current Chromium has the following issue:
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/2709891

There's some bugs reported related to this in https://bugs.chromium.org:
https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=596388
https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=270219

Last comment is that fix is available in the Chromium version 52.0.2717.0.

Task is to make sure that QtWebEngine supports Chromium ADFS when new version is integrated.

requirements.name: Adjustable line width for QQuickMaterialBusyIndicator
requirements.text:
The BusyIndicator with Material style does not look well when sized down.

Unfortunately the line size is a fixed value in qquickmaterialbusyindicator.cpp.

It would be great if it would be a property that we could change from QML side.

A workaround is of course to just use the "scale" property :)

requirements.name: Reuse debug symbol groups in CDB for faster performance when switching between stack frames
requirements.text:
In the pre-python cdb extension, there was code that took care to re-use the debug symbol groups when possible, making switching between stack frames snappy.
With the new python-cdb extension, that does not seem to be the case, and thus debug symbols are always re-queried when switching between stack frames, which causes the locals view to take very long to update, especially with libraries that have many debug symbols like WebEngineCore.

It would be nice if the new extension would reuse and cache as much as possible, to make the debugging experience more fluid (switching stack frames in Chromium code can take up to 2-5 minutes).

requirements.name: WebP: animations don't loop
QtQuickControls2: StackView eats all touch events
requirements.text:
StackView eats all touch events and doesn't propagate unhandled events to parent items.

This only happens with touch events, with mouse events everything works correctly. Please see attached testcase (works fine on desktop with mouse, but fails on iOS).

This is a regression from Qt 5.8

Please fix this bug as soon as possible and release a bug fix update because this currently makes qtcreator unsuitable as a CMake IDE.

Thank you very much.

requirements.name: Creator crashes on Windows when creating a project for Android
requirements.text:
Creating any kind of Qt application via the wizard (e.g. Qt console, Qt widgets) crashes Creator on finishing the wizard if the chosen Kit is an Android Kit.
Note: Choosing the Desktop Kit does not crash, and neither does switching an open project to an Android Kit. But closing and re-opening such a project that was switched to an Android Kit also crashes.
I don't have Windows debugging foo, so I can't show a stack trace.
I used the beta snapshots of Creator.

requirements.name: Qt 5.7 Warnings Xcode 8 (Final) Sierra (Final)
requirements.text:
Pesky warnings can sometimes hide potential bugs/issues.  
I never ignore them...

Compiling open source qt 5.7 on Sierra/Xcode 8 generates quite a few new warnings and *deprecation* notices.

This warning is the most frequent offender (over 500 mentions):

{code:title=runtime/UIString.h|borderStyle=solid}
In file included from ../3rdparty/javascriptcore/JavaScriptCore/runtime/UString.h:27:
../3rdparty/javascriptcore/JavaScriptCore/runtime/UStringImpl.h:82:20: warning: comparison of constant 9223372036854775791 with expression of type 'unsigned int' is always false [-Wtautological-constant-out-of-range-compare]
        if (length > ((std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max() - sizeof(UStringImpl)) / sizeof(UChar)))
            ~~~~~~ ^ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
{code}

I have attached some relevant files (and a summarized analysis of warnings in the output file)

Are any of these serious enough to merit attention?

Regards, Patrice

requirements.name: Android: Builds for arm64 default to incompatible Android 16 platform
requirements.text: When building for arm64-v8a, Android 21 is the minimum requirement in the NDK, but Qt will default to Android 16 (which is the minimum for 32-bit builds in Qt). \r\n\r\nThis causes very confusing build errors and is bound to cause a lot of problems, though the workaround is fairly simple: Just add -android-ndk-platform android-21 to the configure options.

requirements.name: DemoBrowser ignores system proxy
requirements.text:
Qt 5.8.0 seems to ignore KDE systemsettings proxy settings.

When invoked in a proxied environment, where DNS does only resolve internal addresses, WebEngine reports the error ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED starting with Qt 5.8 (Linux).
Proxy configuration had been done via KDE (systemsettings > network > proxy > use proxy auto configuration url)

This may be reproduced with the "demo browser" example.

Qt 5.7 version asks for proxy password and after that displays the page of http://qt.io/ . 
Qt 5.8 version just shows error page.

(After entering a single working proxy in the local settings of demobrowser, it works, but this is not the intended way when needing to use a complex proxy script with different proxies)

requirements.name: Add "stop build" function to big build button

requirements.name: QFile::rename crashes on UWP
requirements.text:
After upgrading from Qt 5.9.1 to 5.9.2, QFile::rename makes the application crash on UWP.

To reproduce, create a new Qt Quick project and try to rename a file located in a writable directory using QStandardPaths. See the attached project that works with 5.9.1.

[REG Qt 5.7.0 -> Qt 5.8] Menu of ComboBox in Welcome mode does not react to input until/including first mouse click
requirements.text:
This looks like a bug in Qt but I couldn't create a minimal example. If you can, please forward the bug to Qt.

# Install a Qt 5.8 package.
# Run Creator from this package.
# Make sure you have at least two Qt versions containing examples configured in "Tools" -> "Options..." -> "Build & Run" -> "Qt versions".
# Go to Welcome mode, Examples tab.
# Try to select a different Qt version using the ComboBox.
The ComboBox' popup menu appears, but then does not do anything until you click on it. This first mouse click is ignored, too. After clicking, it seems to behave correctly.

The ComboBox should be responsive all the time. In Qt 5.7.0, this used to work correctly.

[Sorry my english]

Hi. Syntax highlighting does not work properly with functions signatures in implementation. I configure the editor to show functions calls with regular dark blue colored font, so prototypes and signatures should have the same color sheme but in bold font. Well, he does not do that, instead it colored signatures in bold black font. I think there is another rule overriding this setting. This also happens in the implementation. But after https://codereview.qt-project.org/155593 it is broken again.

{{DebuggerPluginPrivate::updateActiveLanguages()}} activates the languages according to {{dd->m_currentEngine->runParameters().languages}}, but it is called before the currentEngine is set.

requirements.name: eglfs mouse cursor rendered incorrectly
requirements.text:
Launch an app with eglfs on any device (or even X11) with the mouse enabled. The pointer image looks slightly incorrect, it's as if the cursor image was slightly skewed or scaled. (texture coordinate problem?)

Reproducible both on DRIVE CX with eglfs_kms_egldevice and on desktop using eglfs_x11.

The cursor is nice and clear with the current 5.6 branch.

requirements.name: Gerrit dialog uses wrong repository
requirements.text:
# Start Creator.
# Open a file from a git repository with a Gerrit remote.
# Open the dialog from "Tools" -> "Git" -> "Remote Repository" -> "Gerrit..."
In the top left corner, the dialog displays the repository of the file.
# Close the dialog.
# Open a file from a different git repository with a Gerrit remote.
# Open the dialog from "Tools" -> "Git" -> "Remote Repository" -> "Gerrit..." again.
In the top left corner, the dialog still displays the repository of the first file. Checkouts and cherry-picks will be done in the wrong directory.
# Open the dialog from "Tools" -> "Git" -> "Local Repository" -> "Branches..."
This dialog displays the correct repository.
To change the repository used by the Gerrit dialog, you'll need to restart Creator.

In any situation, all git-related dialogs should use the same repository. This should be chosen depending on the currently open projects and files.

requirements.name: UX Review
requirements.text: Usability check for 1.1. Check consistency, general usability, UI components´  behaviour in different states, documentation needs.\r\n\r\nLight usability testing with Teemu Tamminen to get end user feedback.

requirements.name: The first character of a line is cut off in QTextBrowser if the first space is non-breaking.
requirements.text:
There is html shown in QTextBrowser. The html contains nbsp entities and span tags to apply styles (bold/normal font). Now, when there is 'bold text, nbsp, and bold text' in the beginning of a line the first character is cut off. The text is shown correctly if the line break is anywhere else than before that bold text.

This error showed up after change https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/88644/4 was applied.

Also one curiosity is that the nbsp in the middle of bold text is using "normal font" (due to html layout issues), which is set with span tag. If the span tag is removed and the nbsp is bold, the problem is not reproducible.

See the attached example. The 4th line says "4.8% een havo diploma" when it should be "64.8% een havo diploma". Resize the window to see the correct text.

Tested on Windows 7 and Ubuntu 16.04.

requirements.name: Use known version of the b2qt toolchain when building Qt in Coin
requirements.text: Currently COIN always takes the latest b2qt toolchain from dev and that has already proven to be problematic. This should be changed so that a tested and working toolchain is used in CI

requirements.name: effect not updating when no keyframes are present
requirements.text: If you run attached example project with runtime 1.X, effect, which uses AppFrame uniform is being updated, but with runtime 2.X it is not.

requirements.name: Demo Launcher Graphical Effects app menu overlayed with title bar
requirements.text: Demo Launcher Graphical Effects title bar overlays with app itself. The app is full screen under the title bar, see attached video. Instead, the app should be full screen under the title bar, or the app layout needs to be adjusted to leave room for the title bar.

requirements.name: Android: Qt-5.9 Breaks Build of 3-rd Party JARs
requirements.text:
My project requires adding licensing of Google Play.

To do that, to the directory android/libs was added

support-v4-24.1.1-sources.jar with its dependencies:

internal_impl-24.1.1.jar org.apache.http.legacy.jar support-annotations-24.1.1.jar

The project var ANDROID_PACKAGE_SOURCE_DIR = $$PWD/android

properly points to the android files.

 

QtCreator 4.3.1 as well as previous duly build correctly when using Qt-5.7.1

(see the build-log attached).

However, the build fails when using Qt-5.9.1 (see the build-log attached  as well).

The 3-rd party jar files were copied, but not used for build.

 

Further, I've tried to follow the instructions at page:

[http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/android3rdpartylibs.html]

and created

{{$PROJECT_ROOT/android/project.properties}} file

with the following content:

android.library.reference.1=libs

However, it was not helpful

 

There are two verbose logs attached:
 # Successful build with Qt-5.7.1
 # Failed build with Qt-5.9.1

requirements.name: Qt Quick WebEngineView gets focus when enabled is set to false
requirements.text:
Whenever a url set on a Qt Quick WebEngineView, and the enabled property is set to false, the view automatically gets focus, but you can not interact with the view.
For instance if google.com is loaded, the search text field is focused, and the text cursor is blinking, but you can not interact with the field.

The view should not get focus if enabled is set to false.

requirements.name: MouseArea stops working after OS steals release event
requirements.text:
Using a QtQuick MouseArea on iOS, whenever the user presses the area (touch down) and the release (touch up) happens in a system context (if we press home on iOS or recent apps on Android, for instance) mouse area is stuck in pressed state forever, and stops responding to any touch events.

I recorded this bug on a small 20s video, attached to this bug report.
Also attached is the code I used for the test.

What seems to happen is that, whenever MouseArea detects a pressed event (or touch down), it waits for the corresponding release event, but as we go out of the app context when doing a gesture on iOS, the release event is never received by mouseArea, and it remains forever waiting for the release event, in pressed state.

requirements.name: The documentation for Intel NUC (and NVidia Jetson) should describe how to connect via network and not talk about USB
requirements.text: Intel NUC doesn't have a USB OTG; to deploy to it and to debug on it, a network connection must be used. The documentation is unclear about that, and gives the impression that USB is the way to connect all Boot2Qt devices. Apparently the same goes for NVidia Jetson.

requirements.name: Webengine doesn't allow to open local content from html files in qrc file
requirements.text:
To reproduce the problem, please unzip the file and change the index.html's image tag's src to point to the same directory's Qt.png file.
Build and run.
*Result:* the application doesn't show any image
*Expected result:* the application should show Qt logo.

*Summary:* qrc content is apparently not treated as local content  despite of *LocalContentCanAccessRemoteUrls* is set.

*Continuation of:* QTBUG-51867

requirements.name: neptune3-ui should allow documentation builds without appman dependency
requirements.text: To make online documentation builds simpler, neptune3 should allow making documentation builds without needing appman.

requirements.name: [REG: 5.3-5.6] Many shortcuts don't work on OSX when Japanese input sources are used
requirements.text:
To reproduce:
1) Add the language support as on the picture. But you can use a standard US/EU keyboard.
2) Select the Romaji language as active input
3) Run the attached sample.

It won't work because of step #2
Note: this worked in Qt 5.3.0

The root of the problem lies in QCocoaKeyMapper::updateKeyMap
(qcocoakeymapper.mm)

UCKeyTranslate returns "error" and qt_mac_get_key is called with "unicodeKey" as argument. The problem is that this value is *not* an unicode value but a Qt virtual key code, and this clashes with the table lookup 'qt_mac_keyboard_symbols'.

To solve the problem, I had to do several things:
* in qt_mac_get_key, check qt_mac_keyvkey_symbols before the rest, if UCKeyTranslate  failed.
* Complement the table qt_mac_keyvkey_symbols with:
{code}
    { kVK_Delete, QT_MAC_MAP_ENUM(Qt::Key_Backspace) },
    { kVK_ForwardDelete, QT_MAC_MAP_ENUM(Qt::Key_Delete) },
    { kVK_Home, QT_MAC_MAP_ENUM(Qt::Key_Home) },
    { kVK_End, QT_MAC_MAP_ENUM(Qt::Key_End) },
    { kVK_F17, QT_MAC_MAP_ENUM(Qt::Key_F17) },
    { kVK_F18, QT_MAC_MAP_ENUM(Qt::Key_F18) },
    { kVK_F19, QT_MAC_MAP_ENUM(Qt::Key_F19) },
    { kVK_F20, QT_MAC_MAP_ENUM(Qt::Key_F20) },
{code}

requirements.name: Build/Run/Debug disabled after changing build configuration in a CMake project
requirements.text:
# Open a CMake project.
 # Switch to another build configuration (with Build > Open Build and Run Kit Selector).
 # It automatically executes CMake in the background which finishes with success. Despite this the Run/Debug/Build icons remain disabled as well as their Menu action counterparts.
 # Build > Run CMake manually. This again enables the actions.

CMake version: 3.5.1 under Ubuntu 16.04.

requirements.name: QNetworkRequest POST requests using FollowRedirectsAttribute
requirements.text:
I have found a potential bug/issue when making requests with QNetworkAccessManager and QNetworkRequest with the FollowRedirectsAttribute set to True. I was having two issues that I was scratching my head over, then found out they are likely related. 

The first problem I was having is trying to make a POST request to my webserver that returns a 302 Redirect. However, when I do so with FollowRedirectsAttribute enabled. The first POST goes through, but the redirect never gets handled. Usually in browsers these types of redirects are converted to GET before being requested again. 

So then I decided to toss the idea of FollowRedirectsAttribute, and just handle the redirects the old fashioned way manually. So in the finished() slot in the redirect handling portion, I was using new_request = QNetworkRequest(reply->request()) to get a copy of my old request that I had setup with custom headers to just reuse it. I then do new_request->setUrl('NewRedirectedUrl') to change the old URL to the new one to be requested. I then call manager->get(new_request). And nothing happened! After hours of scratching my head I figured out what was going on. It turns out the headers in the original POST request that get added behind the scene are: Content-Type, Content-Length, and MIME-Version. So I was passing these POST only headers to get() and Qt doesn't seem to complain about it, but doesn't tell you it's wrong either and just doesn't make the request.

So back to the original bug, I think this exact thing is happening with POST redirects with FollowRedirectsAttribute. Qt is likely trying to do the same by passing the POST specific headers to a GET request and then doesn't know what to do.

*EDIT :* I have attached an example demonstrating the problem.

requirements.name: When a user cancels the dialog requesting admin rights then it should go back to the page it was originally on instead of moving forward
requirements.text: When a user cancels the dialog requesting admin rights then it should go back to the page it was originally on instead of moving forward. That way it would not show an error dialog but still make it possible to re-request.

requirements.name: QPrinter not defined anymore on Android (regression from Qt 5.6)
requirements.text:
I'm having a problem with QPrinter class when building for Linux and Android targets. I've created a new project in QtCreator to avoid issues with my curent project.

It's a simple project with QT += printsupport and one include:

#include <QPrinter>

a single line with declaration:

QPrinter printer

requirements.name:
[ { "id" : "344621", "body" : "QPrinter is not supported on Android.

On Linux, it depends on how Qt was configured. Have you built Qt yourself, are you using the binary packages from the Qt project, or do you use a Qt version provided by the system?", "created" : "2017-01-25T13:04:09.000+0000", "updated" : "2017-01-25T13:04:09.000+0000", "authorKey" : "kkohne", "active" : "", "timeZone" : "Europe/Berlin" }, { "id" : "344624", "body" : ""QPrinter is not supported on Android"

But the code was compiled without warnings and worked till Qt5.7.
I use official Qt binary packages (online installers) on Linux and Windows host machines.", "created" : "2017-01-25T13:22:02.000+0000", "updated" : "2017-01-25T14:10:53.000+0000", "authorKey" : "greblus", "active" : "", "timeZone" : "UTC" }, { "id" : "344658", "body" : "I don't have currently the Android setup done, but when using the official build Qt 5.8.0 for Linux, QPrinter class is defined and can be used.

The <QPrinter> header should define the QPrinter class, except if QT_NO_PRINTER is defined. Can you verify whether you set the define anywhere?", "created" : "2017-01-25T15:31:22.000+0000", "updated" : "2017-01-25T15:31:22.000+0000", "authorKey" : "kkohne", "active" : "", "timeZone" : "Europe/Berlin" }, { "id" : "344689", "body" : "I'm sorry, I've reinstalled Qt5.8 on my Linux host and QPrinter is working on Linux (and as previously stated also on Windows).

But for the stable version of my project I use Qt5.6.2 and QPrinter is working on Android in this version, although it can only be used for pdf output in a few places so I've  simply removed it from the project.



", "created" : "2017-01-25T20:11:21.000+0000", "updated" : "2017-01-25T20:44:37.000+0000", "authorKey" : "greblus", "active" : "", "timeZone" : "UTC" }, { "id" : "344713", "body" : "Probably related to the changes to the configuration system in Qt 5.8", "created" : "2017-01-26T08:37:57.000+0000", "updated" : "2017-01-26T08:37:57.000+0000", "authorKey" : "esabraha", "active" : "", "timeZone" : "Europe/Oslo" }, { "id" : "344716", "body" : "Probably. From src/printsupport/configure.json in 5.8:

{code}
        "printer": {
            "label": "QPrinter",
            "purpose": "Provides a printer backend of QPainter.",
            "section": "Painting",
            "condition": "!config.android && !config.uikit && !config.winrt && features.picture && features.temporaryfile && features.pdf",
            "output": [ "publicFeature", "feature" ]
        },
{code}", "created" : "2017-01-26T08:49:40.000+0000", "updated" : "2017-01-26T08:49:40.000+0000", "authorKey" : "kkohne", "active" : "", "timeZone" : "Europe/Berlin" }, { "id" : "344717", "body" : "For reference, in Qt 5.6, QT_NO_PRINTER was defined for unsupported/android-g++ (the no-SDK-mkspec) but not for the official android-g++ mkspec. requirements.name: Map design TODOs
requirements.text:
There's a couple of things we need from design to proceed with implementing existing and new features:

 
 * Home and Work locations (how to add/edit/delete them)
 * -Design and assets to go the "current" location (the one that the map selects on startup)-
 * -Assets (icons) for the destination map pin and the navigation blue arrow-
 * -Assets for 3D/traffic icons-
 * -How to stop the navigation, and transition back to 2D map view-
 * How to switch between map styles (e.g. normal/terrain/satellite)
 * Would be nice to see some design for the secondary (cluster) screen

requirements.name: [REG 4.6.2 > 4.7.0] QtCreator can not set up msvc environment correctly after update
requirements.text:
This morning my QtCreator updated from Version 4.6.2 to Version 4.7.0. Since that time I am not able to compile, run or debug any projects because the MSVC Environment could not be set up correctly. I googled around all day and tried different things but nothing helped so far.

First of all I updated my cmake Version from 3.0.0 to 3.12.0 and checked my PATH.

The behavior of my pc is similar to that described here:

QTCREATORBUG-20671

QTCREATORBUG-20670

That means the Sophos Endpoind Security Control v10.8 takes up to 99% of CPU while there are several cmd.exe running (ca. 40-50 instances). And it seems the process is killed by the timeout mentioned here (AbstractMSVCToolChain::generateEnvironmentSettings):

QTCREATORBUG-17474

 

With Version 4.6.2 the startup needed some time, but in the end it could set up the Environment correctly.

 

Please find attached the profiling Output of QtCreator 4.7.0. Sometimes cmake is the first process being killed sometimes it's cmd.exe

 

Thanks in advance and Kind regards

Judith

requirements.text: Loading an armature that uses a QSkeleton instead of a QSkeletonLoader asserts. requirements.name: qmake preserves illegal characters in @BUNDLEIDENTIFIER@ string on macOS
requirements.text:
Steps:
 * Create qmake project on macOS
 * Set TARGET in .pro file to a string with spaces, like TARGET = "Test App"
 * Build project
 * Open Info.plist in resulting .app package

Expected result: CFBundleIdentifier entry is "com.yourcompany.TestApp" (spaces removed)

Actual result: CFBundleIdentifier is "com.yourcompany.Test App" (space remains)

"The bundle ID string must be a uniform type identifier (UTI) that contains only alphanumeric ({{A}}\-{{Z}},{{a}}\-{{z}},{{0}}\-{{9}}), hyphen ({{\-}}), and period ({{.}}) characters" according to [https://developer.apple.com/library/content/documentation/General/Reference/InfoPlistKeyReference/Articles/CoreFoundationKeys.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/20001431-102070]

This seems to happen both for provided and for generated .plist files.

requirements.name: HTTP/2 HEADERS frame ignored in open stream
requirements.text:
According to HTTP/2 spec:

_A stream in the "open" state may be used by both peers to send frames of any type._

In QHttp2ProtocolHandler::handleContinuedHEADERS(), there's a condition which finishes such stream with "HEADERS on invalid stream" error.

requirements.name: scxml editor force event id to transitions
requirements.text:
When scxml editor open a file containing an eventless transition (i.e. lacking the 'event' attribute) it force the event id to a default one (i.e Transition_1)

Since using "*" event id is not a workaround and eventless transitions works correctly in Qt scxml, I suggest to remove this behavior from editor.

from [www.w3.org/TR/scxml|https://www.w3.org/TR/scxml/#transition]:

_"An event designator consisting solely of "*" can be used as a wildcard matching any sequence of tokens, and thus any event. Note that this is different from a transition lacking the 'event' attribute altogether. Such an eventless transition does not match any event, but will be taken whenever its 'cond' attribute evaluates to 'true'."_
