requirements.name: Get macOS 10.12 into CI
Add declarative API to keep track of the checked buttons in a non-exclusive ButtonGroup
Set a sub-presentation from timeline context menu
requirements.text: Allow setting a sub-presentation for a layer, material, or image timeline row via the context menu.

requirements.name: Generate materials and parameters for custom materials
Update notification to support using text for the button
requirements.text: As a developer, I need to use a label instead of an icon in the notification item. The notification item need to be updated to support this.

requirements.name: Update Kria cluster and docs/comments to 1.1 APIs
requirements.text: Update the Kria 3D cluster demo over at https://git.qt.io/public-demos/qt3dstudio to use Data Input API as much as possible and update docs/comments to reflect this. Verify the demo works.

requirements.name: Emulator: Support changing device mockups
requirements.text: The QtGlesStream server is still running when the new device is loaded which means a further server can't be started.

requirements.name: Items' Accessible bound rect is incorrect in High DPI
requirements.text:
When using Inspect or Visual UIA Verify (C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\bin\x64\UIAVerify\VisualUIAVerifyNative.exe) I get the window and title bar bound rects correctly, but everything inside the window is being reported in virtual pixels not corrected by the screen's devicePixelRatio

Attached is a code to reproduce. It contains two panels each with two buttons.

requirements.name: Build target "profile" fails on Windows Device Creation cross-compilation
requirements.text:
Using Qt for Device Creation on Windows the cross compiled build "Profile" tries to run chmod on separate debug info symbols. chmod doesn't exist in the Mingw host binaries. Fix is to not to run chmod when cross compiling in Windows or add (dummy?) chmod to host bins.

Error is in qtbase\mkspecs\features\unix\separate_debug_info
chmod_debug_info = chmod -x $$shell_target_debug_info

{noformat}
C:/Qt/5.7/Boot2Qt/nitrogen6x/toolchain/sysroots/i686-pokysdk-mingw32/usr/bin/arm-poky-linux-gnueabi/arm-poky-linux-gnueabi-objcopy --strip-debug Cluster_Qt3d && C:/Qt/5.7/Boot2Qt/nitrogen6x/toolchain/sysroots/i686-pokysdk-mingw32/usr/bin/arm-poky-linux-gnueabi/arm-poky-linux-gnueabi-objcopy --add-gnu-debuglink=Cluster_Qt3d.debug Cluster_Qt3d && chmod -x Cluster_Qt3d.debug
'chmod' is not recognized as an internal or external command,

requirements.name: Glyphs get corrupted when using Vietnamese, Czech and Russian characters (Avenir ttf)
requirements.text: Glyphs get corrupted when using Vietnamese, Czech and Russian (+other languages) characters. The corruption happens at least when text with Avenir (ttf) font is displayed in a Qml application. FontLoader is used to load Avenir ttf.

requirements.name: Files included by Qt.include() do not get passed to the engine's url interceptor
requirements.text:
JavaScript files loaded via QML import statements get passed through the QQmlEngine's URL interceptor (if one is set).

Files loaded through the Qt.include() functions do no.

See https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/127360 for an attempt to fix this.

requirements.name: Removing Macro Crashes Creator
requirements.text:
Start recording macro, do something with keyboard, stop recording macro, save macro.

Go to tools > macros > select macro > remove > ok.

Start recording macro again ... QT creator crashes

requirements.name: Project Properties->Debugging->Environment permanently grows.
requirements.text:
Look inside anyproject.vcxproj.user
Initially it looks like:
<LocalDebuggerEnvironment>PATH=$(QTDIR)\bin;$(PATH)</LocalDebuggerEnvironment>
After some solution loads it looks like this:
 <LocalDebuggerEnvironment>PATH="$(QTDIR)\bin%3b$(QTDIR)\bin%3b$(QTDIR)\bin%3b$(QTDIR)\bin%3b$(QTDIR)\bin%3b$(QTDIR)\bin%3b$(PATH)</LocalDebuggerEnvironment>

requirements.name: Simple text viewer example's assistant help file (simpletextviewer.qhc) content tab links do not work
requirements.text:
When opening "simpletextviewer.qhc" help file with assistant, the links in the contents tab do not work. The error message is:

{code}
The page could not be found.
'qthelp://org.qt-project.examples.simpletextviewer/doc/./openfile.html'
{code}

The links seem to have an extra ./ for each file set which could be the cause for this:
{code}
<section title="Find File" ref="./findfile.html">
<section title="File Dialog" ref="./filedialog.html"></section>
<section title="Wildcard Matching" ref="./wildcardmatching.html"></section>
<section title="Browse" ref="./browse.html"></section>
{code}

Steps to reproduce:
* Run assistant on the simpletextviewer.qhc
*** assistant.exe -collectionFile <path_to_simpletextviewer.qhc> -enableRemoteControl
* In "Contents" tab, expand "Simple Text Viewer" node
* Click "Open File" child node
* EXPECTED: openfile.html is shown in the view
* ACTUAL: Error message is shown

This is reproducible also with the simple text viewer example, opening the assistant from Help -> Help Contents (F1).

requirements.name: Running configure sets incorrect default prefix
requirements.text:
Message after running configure:
"Qt will be installed into '\usr\local\Qt-5.9.0'."

This incorrect path is set if one does not explicitly configure with '-prefix [path]' option. Configuring with '-prefix' can be used as a workaround.

requirements.name: Locator eats shortcuts meant for editor
requirements.text:
# Open a file and place the cursor in it.
 # Press Ctrl+K.
 You're now using the Locator.
 # Type "t ab" and press Enter.
 This opens the "About Qt Creator" dialog.
 # Press Escape.
 The dialog closes.
 # Press Ctrl+W.
 Nothing happens.

Ctrl+W should close the current editor. In this case this would be the editor opened in step 1.
 The point of the Locator is to make Creator usable with the keyboard. That experience breaks with this bug.

requirements.name: Dangling pointer problems with QWebEngineUrlRequestInterceptor
requirements.text:
I have run into crashes because of dangling pointers when I used the same {{QWebEngineUrlRequestInterceptor}} for multiple pages and made one of them the parent of the interceptor: when I closed the parent page, the interceptor gets deleted and then the next navigation of the other one crashes.

This is probably the same issue that causes QTBUG-59876 and I have run into another crash when closing a page that has a {{QWebEngineUrlRequestInterceptor}} - after visiting youtube.com in {{--single-process}} mode as in QTBUG-60225. See the attached example.

Maybe we should turn BrowserContextAdapter::m_requestInterceptor into a QSharedPointer?

requirements.name: Gerrit state for declarative dev integration changes is out of sync with build branch
requirements.text:
When coin (re)starts, it attempts to resume changes that are in integrating state, that didn't finish earlier. This is done by locating the last refs/builds/qtci/<branch>/<timestamp> build branch and then running staging-approve with success or fail upon completion.

At the time of filing this report, the changes listed as integrating under https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/q/project:qt/qtdeclarative+status:integrating,n,z is

    https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/230797/
    https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/230902/
    https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/230877/
    https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/230876/
    https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/226950/

yet when resuming, coin tests

    https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/230691/
    https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/230770/
    https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/230774/
    https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/231020/
    https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/231027/

and then finds (rightly so) the build breaking and claims abandonment ("This change has been abandoned because it was already integrated in other branch which was merged into branch 'dev'.").

It appears that the latest build branch (refs/builds/qtci/dev/1527794892) contains the latter set of changes, while the former is what's marked as integrating in Gerrit.

requirements.name: QSVGRenderer: multiple transform attribute values are not handled correctly
requirements.text:
When rendering SVG Elements with multiple transform values ("transform-list" in W3C terms) containing at least one matrix transformation the resulting image is sometimes not correct. It seems that the combination of a matrix transform and other transformations is not handled properly, e.g.

{{transform="translate(...) matrix(...) scale(...)"}}

I have attached a small SVG file which shows this behaviour. Also attached is a corresponding PNG image rendered using QSVGRenderer and a PNG image example to show how other programs such as firefox or inkscape render this file.

 

The origin of the problem seems to be erroneous sequencing of a noncommutative matrix multiplication in parseTransformationMatrix() in qtsvg/qsvghandler.cpp. The attached patch for Qt 5.6.1 fixes this. After applying the patch the provided SVG (as well as other tested SVGs) appear to render fine.

requirements.name: Qt Creator Not Responding when new tool chains installed
requirements.text:
I have installed a working Qt 5.10.1 with MinGW 5.3.

Now i want to try other compilers like MSVC 2015/2017.

*1. MSVC 2015*

First i installed only MSVC 2015 and the precompiled components with Qt Maintenance Tool. After restart of my computer i started Qt Creator and it wasn't reacting anymore. The
 window title shows "Qt Creator (Not Responding)". So i killed the task. Restart Qt Creator again, but it shows again "Not Responding" in the window title. This time i was waiting and after some minutes Qt Creator was useable and doesn't show "Not Responding".

*2. MSVC 2017*

Not i installed MSVC 2017 and the precompiled components from Qt. And again after restart of the computer, Qt Creator shows "Not Responding". Some minutes later without killing the Qt Creator task, the GUI was useable again.

*What is going on here?*

Obviously Qt Creator is scanning the PC for new compilers, kids, toolchains etc. But this procedure is freezing the GUI of Qt Creator for some minutes. Maybe it is a feature that this is done in background, but it would be nice if Qt Creator shows a dialog or log window to show what is going on. When an application shows "Not responding" i guess the most users will kill the task and don't wait several minutes. When killing Qt Creator during this "scan of pc" may lead to unfinished or partly configured compiler/tool chain settings in Qt Creator.

I report this as bug, because any freezing of GUI is a bug. But take this also as suggestion to show the user that Qt Creator is currently scanning the system or try to execute something.

I guess all these processes are blocking with a high timeout, right?
 !Qt Creator vcvarsall.png|thumbnail!

requirements.name: Qt 5.6 ABI incompatibility due to qt_handleMouseEvent
requirements.text:
Qt 5.6 removed the following overload from qtestmouse.h:

{code}
qt_handleMouseEvent ( QWindow* w, QPointF const& local, QPointF const& global, Qt::MouseButtons b, Qt::KeyboardModifiers mods )
{code}

See http://abi-laboratory.pro/tracker/compat_report/qt/5.5.1/5.6.0/8f965/abi_compat_report.html#Removed

This broke PyQt binary compatibility on Archlinux, as it's probably inlined from {{QTest::mouseEvent}}: https://bugs.archlinux.org/task/48734

Also see this mail by Thiago: https://www.mail-archive.com/development@qt-project.org/msg23663.html

It'd be nice if it could be brought back in 5.6.1.

requirements.name: Coin leaks disk space
requirements.text: We leak tarballs in Coin. The leak is caused by change that used content sha1 instead of sha1 as a denominator for changes. Essentially storage saves source tarballs in wrong place, as it wrongly calculates build key.
